original: Vkn / atha khalu ratnākaro licchavikumāro bhagavato 'ntikād idam evaṃrūpaṃ mahāprātihāryaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu ratnākaraḥ licchavi kumāraḥ bhagavataḥ ntikāt idam evaṃrūpam mahā prātihāryam
translated: Then the Licchavi youth Ratnākara, from the Blessed One, this kind of great miracle,

original: dṛṣṭvaikāṃsam uttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena
translated: Seeing this, he arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground,

original: bhagavāṃs tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantaṃ gāthābhir abhyaṣṭāvīt /
analyzed: bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam gāthābhiḥ abhyaṣṭāvīt
translated: bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined, and praised the Blessed One with these verses:

analyzed: śubha śuddha kamala vara patra viśāla netra śuddha āśaya śamatha pāramitā agra prāpta
translated: You with eyes vast like the petals of a pure, white lotus, with pure intention, having attained the perfection of tranquility,

analyzed: śubha karma saṃcaya viśāla guṇa aprameya vandāmi tvām śramaṇa śāntipatha praṇetum
translated: Accumulation of good karma, immeasurable vast qualities, I pay homage to you, the one who sets forth the path of peace for ascetics.

analyzed: paśyatha ṛddhi puruṣa ṛṣabha nāyakasya saṃdṛśyate sugata kṣetra vara prakāśāḥ
translated: Behold the miraculous power of the leader, the bull among men! The radiance of the excellent buddha-field of the Sugata is seen.

original: amṛtaṃgamā ca varadharmakathā udārā sā sarva śrūyati ito gaganatalātaḥ // //
analyzed: amṛtaṃgamā ca vara dharma kathā udārā sā itas
translated: The sublime, vast discourse on the excellent Dharma leading to immortality - all of this is heard from here, from the surface of the sky.

original: dharmeṇa te jitam idaṃ varadharmarājyaṃ dharmaṃ dhanaṃ ca dadase jagato jitāre /
analyzed: dharmeṇa te jitam idam vara dharma rājyam dharmam dhanam ca dadase jagataḥ jitāre
translated: By Dharma, this excellent Dharma kingdom has been conquered by you. You, who have conquered the enemy, give the Dharma as wealth to the world.

original: dharmaprabhedakuśalaṃ paramārthadarśin dharmeśvaraṃ śirasi vandami dharmarājam // //
analyzed: dharma prabheda kuśalam parama artha darśin dharmeśvaram śirasi vandami dharmarājam
translated: Skilled in the analysis of the Dharma, seeing the ultimate truth, the lord of Dharma, I pay homage with my head to the Dharma King.

original: na ca nāma asti na ca nāsti giraṃ prabhāṣi hetuṃ pratītya imi saṃbhavi sarvadharmāḥ /
analyzed: na ca nāma asti na ca na asti giram prabhāṣi hetum pratītya imi saṃbhavi sarva dharmāḥ
translated: You speak words that are neither existent nor non-existent. All phenomena arise in dependence on causes.

original: naivātra ātmana ca kāraku vedako vā na ca karmu naśyati śubham aśubhaṃ ca kiṃcit // //
analyzed: na eva atra ca vedakaḥ vā na ca karmu naśyati śubham aśubham ca kiṃcid  /
translated: Here there is no self, no agent, and no experiencer, and no action, whether good or bad, is ever lost.

original: māras tvayāstu vijitas sabalo munīndraḥ prāptā śivā amṛtaśāntavarāgrabodhiḥ /
analyzed: māraḥ tvayā astu vijitaḥ sa balaḥ muni indraḥ prāptā śivā amṛta śānta vara agra bodhiḥ
translated: You, O Sage, have conquered Mara and his army, and attained the supreme, peaceful, and blissful state of nirvana.

original: yasminn avedita na cittamanaḥpracārā sarvakutīrthikagaṇāś ca na yānti gāhaṃ // //
analyzed: yasmin avedita na citta manaḥ pracārā sarva kutīrthika gaṇāḥ ca na yānti
translated: In this state, there is no consciousness, no mind, no mental activity, and no non-Buddhists can fathom it.

original: cakraṃ ca te triparivarti bahuprakāraṃ prāvartitaṃ praśamanaṃ prakṛtīviśuddham /
analyzed: cakram ca te tri parivarti bahu prakāram prāvartitam praśamanam prakṛtī viśuddham
translated: You have turned the wheel of Dharma in three ways and many aspects, leading to peace and purity.

original: pratyakṣa devamanujādbhutadharmarājā ratnāni trīṇi upadarśita tatra kāle // //
analyzed: ratnāni trīṇi upadarśita tatra kāle
translated: O Dharma King, you have manifested the three jewels before the gods and humans, who are amazed by the wondrous Dharma.

original: ye tubhya dharmaratanena vinīta samyak teṣām akalpana punaḥ satate praśāntā /
analyzed: ye tubhya dharma ratanena vinīta samyak teṣām akalpana punar satate praśāntā
translated: Those who are well-trained by your precious Dharma are always peaceful and free from conceptualization.

original: vaidyottamaṃ maraṇajātijarāntakāriṃ śirasā nato 'smi guṇasāgaram aprameyam // //
analyzed: vaidya uttamam maraṇa jāti jarā anta kārim śirasā nataḥ smi guṇa sāgaram aprameyam
translated: O supreme physician, you have put an end to birth, aging, and death. I bow my head to you, O immeasurable ocean of virtues.

original: satkārasatkṛta na vedhasi merukalpa duḥśīlaśīlavati tulyagatādhimaitrī /
analyzed: satkāra satkṛta na vedhasi meru kalpa duḥśīla śīlavati tulya gata adhimaitrī
translated: O one who is revered and honored, you are like Mount Meru. You have equal love and compassion for those with bad conduct and those with good conduct.

original: gaganaprakāśamanase samatāvihārī ko nāma satvaratane 'smi na kuryu pūjām // //
analyzed: gagana prakāśa manase samatā vihārī kaḥ nāma satva ratane smi na
translated: With a mind shining like the sky, abiding in equanimity, what being would not make offerings to this jewel of a Buddha?

original: samāgatā te janatā mahāmune mukham udīkṣanti prasannamānasā /
analyzed: samāgatā te janatā mahā mune mukham udīkṣanti prasanna mānasā
translated: The great assembly has gathered, O Sage, gazing at your face with joyful minds.

original: sarve ca paśyanti jinaṃ purastāj jinasya āveṇikabuddhalakṣaṇam // //
analyzed: sarve ca paśyanti jinam purastāt jinasya āveṇika buddha lakṣaṇam
translated: All see the Victor in front, with the unique Buddha qualities of the Victor.

original: ekāṃ ca vācaṃ bhagavān pramuñcase nānārutaṃ ca pariṣad vijānati /
analyzed: ekām ca vācam bhagavān pramuñcase nānārutam ca pariṣad vijānati
translated: You, Blessed One, speak a single word, but the assembly understands it in various languages.

original: yathāsvakaṃ cārtha vijānate jano jinasya āveṇikabuddhalakṣaṇam // //
analyzed: yathā svakam ca artha vijānate janaḥ jinasya āveṇika buddha lakṣaṇam
translated: Each person understands the meaning according to their own language, with the unique Buddha qualities of the Victor.

original: ekāya vācāya udīritāya vāsesi eke apare nividyasi /
analyzed: ekāya vācāya udīritāya vāsesi eke apare nividyasi
translated: When you utter a single word, some are satisfied, others are not.

original: ākāṅkṣatāṃ kāṅkṣa śamesir nāyako jinasya āveṇikabuddhalakṣaṇam // //
analyzed: ākāṅkṣatām kāṅkṣa śamesiḥ nāyakaḥ jinasya āveṇika buddha lakṣaṇam
translated: The Guide pacifies the doubts of those who have doubts, with the unique Buddha qualities of the Victor.

original: vandāmi tvāṃ daśabala satyavikramaṃ vandāmi tvām abhayagataṃ viśāradam /
analyzed: vandāmi tvām daśabala satya vikramam vandāmi tvām abhaya gatam viśāradam
translated: I pay homage to you, O One with Ten Powers, who conquers with truth, I pay homage to you, O Fearless One, who has attained fearlessness.

original: dharmeṣu āveṇikaniścayaṃ gataṃ vandāmi tvāṃ sarvajagatpraṇāyakam // //
analyzed: dharmeṣu āveṇika niścayam gatam vandāmi tvām sarva jagat praṇāyakam
translated: Having attained certainty in the unique Dharma, I pay homage to you, O Leader of the Entire World.

original: vandāmi samyojanabandhanacchidaṃ vandāmi tvāṃ pāragataṃ sthale sthitam /
analyzed: vandāmi samyojana bandhana chidam vandāmi tvām pāra gatam sthale sthitam
translated: I pay homage to you, O Cutter of the Bonds and Fetters, I pay homage to you, O One who has Reached the Other Shore, who stands on dry land.

original: vandāmi khinnasya janasya tārakaṃ vandāmi saṃsāragatāv aniśritam // //
analyzed: vandāmi khinnasya janasya tārakam vandāmi saṃsāra gatau aniśritam
translated: I pay homage to the one who liberates the weary, I pay homage to the one who is never attached to worldly existence.

original: satvair samādhānagataṃ gatīgatam gatīṣu sarvāsu vimuktamānasam /
analyzed: satvaiḥ samādhāna gatam gatī gatam gatīṣu sarvāsu vimukta mānasam
translated: The one who has attained concentration among beings, who has gone to the end of existence, whose mind is liberated from all destinies,

original: jaleruhaṃ vā salile na lipyase niṣevitā te munipadma śūnyatā // //
analyzed: jaleruham vā salile na lipyase niṣevitā te muni padma śūnya tā
translated: Like a lotus in water, you are not stained. O Sage, the emptiness of the lotus is cultivated by you.

original: vibhāvitā sarvanimitta sarvaśo na te kahiṃcit praṇidhāna vidyate /
analyzed: vibhāvitā sarva nimitta sarvaśas na te kahiṃcid praṇidhāna vidyate
translated: All signs are fully eliminated by you. Nowhere is your aspiration found.

analyzed: acintiyam buddha mahā anubhāvam vande ham ākāśa samam a niśritam
translated: The inconceivable great power of the Buddha, I pay homage to you who are equal to space and without support.

original: Vkn / atha ratnākaro licchavikumāro bhagavantam ābhir gāthābhir abhiṣṭutya bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha ratnākaraḥ licchavi kumāraḥ bhagavantam ābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ abhiṣṭutya bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Licchavi youth Ratnakara, having praised the Blessed One with these verses, said this to the Blessed One:

original: imāni bhagavan pañcamātrāṇi licchavikumāraśatāni sarvāṇy anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāni /
analyzed: imāni bhagavan pañca mātrāṇi licchavi kumāra śatāni sarvāṇi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāni
translated: Blessed One, these five hundred Licchavi youths have all set out for the highest complete enlightenment.

original: tāni cemāni buddhakṣetrapariśuddhiṃ paripṛcchanti ḥ katamā bodhisatvānāṃ buddhakṣetrapariśuddhir iti /
analyzed: tāni ca imāni buddhakṣetra pariśuddhim paripṛcchanti katamā bodhisatvānām buddhakṣetra pariśuddhiḥ iti
translated: And they ask about the purification of the Buddha-field: 'What is the purification of the Buddha-field for the bodhisattvas?'

original: tat sādhu bhagavan deśayatu tathāgato 'mīṣāṃ bodhisatvānāṃ buddhakṣetrapariśuddhim /
analyzed: tat sādhu bhagavan deśayatu tathāgataḥ mīṣām bodhisatvānām buddhakṣetra pariśuddhim
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, it would be good if the Tathāgata would teach the purification of the Buddha-fields of those Bodhisattvas.

original: evam ukte bhagavān ratnākarāya licchavikumārāya sādhukāram adāt /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān ratnākarāya licchavi kumārāya sādhukāram adāt
translated: When this had been said, the Blessed One gave his approval to the young Licchavi Ratnākara:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu kumāra
translated: “Good, good, young man!

original: sādhu khalu punas tvaṃ kumāra yas tvaṃ buddhakṣetrapariśuddhim ārabhya tathāgataṃ paripṛcchasi /
analyzed: sādhu khalu punar tvam kumāra yaḥ tvam buddhakṣetra pariśuddhim ārabhya tathāgatam paripṛcchasi
translated: It is indeed good that you, young man, have asked the Tathāgata about the purification of the Buddha-fields,🔽having begun with the purification of the Buddha-fields of the Bodhisattvas.

original: tena hi kumāra śṛṇu sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikuru /
analyzed: tena hi kumāra śṛṇu sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikuru
translated: Therefore, young man, listen well and keep in mind what I say.

original: bhāṣiṣye 'haṃ te yathā bodhisatvānāṃ buddhakṣetrapariśuddhim ārabhya /
analyzed: bhāṣiṣye ham te yathā bodhisatvānām buddhakṣetra pariśuddhim ārabhya
translated: I will tell you about how the Bodhisattvas purify their Buddha-fields, having begun with the purification of the Buddha-fields of the Bodhisattvas.”

original: sādhu bhagavann iti ratnākaro licchavikumāras tāni ca pañcamātrāṇi licchavikumāraśatāni bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣuḥ /
analyzed: sādhu bhagavan iti ratnākaraḥ licchavi kumāraḥ tāni ca pañca mātrāṇi licchavi kumāra śatāni bhagavataḥ pratyaśrauṣuḥ
translated: “Good, Blessed One,” said the young Licchavi Ratnākara, and those five hundred young Licchavis also said, “Good, Blessed One,” and they listened to the Blessed One.

analyzed: bhagavān teṣām etat avocat
translated: The Blessed One said this to them:

analyzed: satva kṣetram kula putra bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: “Noble sir, the field of beings is the Buddha-field of a Bodhisattva.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is this?

original: yāvantaṃ bodhisatvaḥ satveṣūpacayaṃ karoti tāvad buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: yāvantam bodhisatvaḥ satveṣu upacayam karoti tāvat buddhakṣetram parigṛhṇāti
translated: To the extent that a Bodhisattva develops beings, to that extent he takes possession of a Buddha-field.

original: yādṛśaḥ satvānāṃ vinayo bhavati tādṛśaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhnāti /🔽yādṛśena buddhakṣetrāvatāreṇa satvā buddhajñānam avataranti tādṛśaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhnāti /
analyzed: yādṛśaḥ satvānām vinayaḥ bhavati tādṛśam buddhakṣetram parigṛhnāti  yādṛśena buddhakṣetra avatāreṇa satvāḥ buddha jñānam avataranti tādṛśam buddhakṣetram parigṛhnāti
translated: He takes up a buddhafield in accordance with the way in which he disciplines beings.🔽He takes up a buddhafield in accordance with the way in which beings enter into the knowledge of a buddha.

original: yādṛśena buddhakṣetrāvatāreṇa satvānām āryākārāṇīndriyāṇy utpadyante tādṛśaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: yādṛśena buddhakṣetra avatāreṇa satvānām ārya ākārāṇi indriyāṇi utpadyante tādṛśam buddhakṣetram parigṛhṇāti
translated: He takes up a buddhafield in accordance with the way in which the noble faculties of beings are produced by means of the entry into a buddhafield.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is this?

analyzed: satva artha nirjātam hi kula putra bodhisatvānām buddhakṣetram
translated: Noble sir, the buddhafields of bodhisattvas are produced from the welfare of beings.

original: tadyathā ratnākara yādṛśam icched ākāśaṃ māpayituṃ tādṛśaṃ māpayeta /
analyzed: tat yathā ratnākara yādṛśam icchet ākāśam māpayitum tādṛśam māpayeta
translated: For example, Ratnâkara, if someone wants to create a space, he can create it as he wishes.

original: na cākāśaṃ śakyate māpayituṃ nāpy alaṃkartum /
analyzed: na ca ākāśam śakyate māpayitum na api alaṃkartum
translated: But space cannot be created or adorned.

original: evam eva ratnākara ākāśasamān sarvadharmāñ jñātvā /
analyzed: evam eva ratnākaraḥ ākāśa samān sarva dharmām jñātvā
translated: In the same way, Ratnâkara, having known that all phenomena are like space,

original: yādṛśam icched bodhisatvaḥ satvaparipākāya buddhakṣetraṃ māpayituṃ tādṛśaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ māpayati /
analyzed: yādṛśam icchet bodhisatvaḥ satva paripākāya buddhakṣetram māpayitum tādṛśam buddhakṣetram māpayati
translated: a bodhisattva can create a buddhafield as he wishes in order to develop beings.

original: na ca buddhakṣetrākāśatā śakyaṃ māpayituṃ nāpy alaṃkartum /
analyzed: na ca buddhakṣetra ākāśa tā śakyam māpayitum na api alaṃkartum
translated: But the space of a buddhafield cannot be created or adorned.

analyzed: api ca ratnākara
translated: Moreover, Ratnâkara,

analyzed: āśaya kṣetram bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: The field of intention is a bodhisattva’s buddha-field.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasyāśaṭhā amāyāvinaḥ satvā buddhakṣetra upapadyante /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya aśaṭhāḥ amāyāvinaḥ satvāḥ buddhakṣetre upapadyante
translated: When he attains awakening, beings who are not deceitful or fraudulent are reborn in his buddha-field.

analyzed: adhyāśaya kṣetram kula putra bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: The field of superior intention is a bodhisattva’s buddha-field.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvakuśalasaṃbhāropacitāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya sarva kuśala saṃbhāra upacitāḥ satvāḥ buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti
translated: When he attains awakening, beings who have accumulated all the stores of goodness are reborn in his buddha-field.

analyzed: prayoga kṣetram bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: The field of practice is a bodhisattva’s buddha-field.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvakuśaladharmopasthitāḥ satvās tatra buddhakṣetra upapadyante /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya sarva kuśala dharma upasthitāḥ satvāḥ tatra buddhakṣetre upapadyante
translated: When he attains awakening, beings who are established in all good qualities are reborn in his buddha-field.

analyzed: udāraḥ bodhisatvasya bodhi citta utpādaḥ buddhakṣetram
translated: The bodhisattva’s generation of the Awakening Mind is a buddha-field.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya mahāyānasaṃprasthitāḥ satvās tatra buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya mahāyāna saṃprasthitāḥ satvāḥ tatra buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti
translated: When he attains awakening, beings who have set out in the Great Vehicle are reborn in his buddha-field.

analyzed: dāna kṣetram bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: The field of generosity is a bodhisattva’s buddha-field.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvaparityāginaḥ satvās tatra buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya sarva parityāginaḥ satvāḥ tatra buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti
translated: When he attains awakening, beings who have given up everything are reborn in his buddha-field.

analyzed: śīla kṣetram bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: The field of morality is a bodhisattva’s buddha-field.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvābhiprāyasaṃpannā daśakuśalakarmapathasaṃrakṣakāḥ satvās tatra buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya sarva abhiprāya saṃpannāḥ daśa kuśala karma patha saṃrakṣakāḥ satvāḥ tatra buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti
translated: When he attains Awakening, beings who are endowed with all aims and who observe the ten wholesome courses of action will be born in his Buddha-field.

analyzed: kṣānti kṣetram kula putra bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: A field of patience, noble sir, is a Bodhisattva’s Buddha-field.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya dvātriṃśallakṣanālaṃkṛtāḥ kṣāntidamaśamathapāramiprāptāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya dvātriṃśat lakṣana alaṃkṛtāḥ kṣānti dama śamatha pārami prāptāḥ satvāḥ buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti
translated: When he attains Awakening, beings who are adorned with the thirty-two marks, who have attained the perfection of patience and self-control, will be born in his Buddha-field.

analyzed: vīrya kṣetram bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: A field of effort, noble sir, is a Bodhisattva’s Buddha-field.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvakuśalaparyeṣṭiṣv ārabdhavīryāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya sarva kuśala paryeṣṭiṣu ārabdha vīryāḥ satvāḥ buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti
translated: When he attains Awakening, beings who are energetic in seeking all forms of goodness will be born in his Buddha-field.

analyzed: dhyāna kṣetram bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: A field of meditation, noble sir, is a Bodhisattva’s Buddha-field.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya smṛtisaṃprajanyasamāhitāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya smṛti saṃprajanya samāhitāḥ satvāḥ buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti
translated: When he attains Awakening, beings who are concentrated, mindful, and aware will be born in his Buddha-field.

analyzed: prajñā kṣetram bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: A field of wisdom, noble sir, is a Bodhisattva’s Buddha-field.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya samyaktvaniyatāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya samyaktva niyatāḥ satvāḥ buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti
translated: When he attains Awakening, beings who are fixed on what is right will be born in his Buddha-field.

analyzed: catvāri apramāṇāni ca bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: The four immeasurables, noble sir, are a Bodhisattva’s Buddha-field.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya maitrīkaruṇāmuditopekṣāvihārinaḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya maitrī karuṇā muditā upekṣā vihārinaḥ satvāḥ buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti
translated: When he attains Awakening, beings who dwell in lovingkindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity will be born in his Buddha-field.

analyzed: catvāri saṃgraha vastūni kula putra bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: The four means of gathering students are a Bodhisattva’s Buddha-field.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvavimuktisaṃgṛhītāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya sarva vimukti saṃgṛhītāḥ satvāḥ buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti
translated: When he attains Awakening, beings who are gathered by the four means of gathering students will be born in his Buddha-field.

analyzed: upāya kauśalyam bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: Skill in means is a Bodhisattva’s Buddha-field.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvopāyamīmāṃsākuśalāḥ satvā buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya sarva upāya mīmāṃsā kuśalāḥ satvāḥ buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti
translated: When he attains Awakening, beings who are skilled in all the methods of investigation will be born in his Buddha-field.

analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣāḥ dharmāḥ bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: The thirty-seven aids to Awakening are a Bodhisattva’s Buddha-field.

analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya samyaksmṛti upasthāna samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārga vidhi jñāḥ satvāḥ buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti
translated: When he attains Awakening, beings who know the methods of right mindfulness, right effort, the bases of spiritual success, the faculties, the powers, the aspects of Awakening, and the path will be born in his Buddha-field.

analyzed: pariṇāmanā cittam bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: The mind of aspiration is a Bodhisattva’s Buddha-field.

analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya sarva guṇa alaṃkāram buddhakṣetram dṛśyate
translated: When he attains Awakening, his Buddha-field will be seen to be adorned with every good quality.

analyzed: aṣṭa akṣaṇa praśama deśanā kula putra bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: Teaching the cessation of the eight inopportune times, son of noble family, is a bodhisattva’s buddhafield.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya sarvāpāyasamucchinnam aṣṭākṣaṇavigataṃ buddhakṣetraṃ saṃbhavanti /
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya sarva apāya samucchinnam aṣṭa akṣaṇa vigatam buddhakṣetram saṃbhavanti
translated: When he attains awakening, in his buddhafield there is complete cessation of all inopportune times and the eight inopportune times do not exist.

original: svayaṃ śikṣāpadeṣu vartamānā parāpattyacodanatā bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram /
analyzed: svayam śikṣā padeṣu vartamānā parāpatti acodana tā bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: Not reproaching others for their transgressions while oneself observing the precepts, son of noble family, is a bodhisattva’s buddhafield.

analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya āpatti śabdaḥ pi buddhakṣetre na saṃbhavati
translated: When he attains awakening, in his buddhafield even the word ‘transgression’ does not exist.

analyzed: daśa kuśala karma patha pariśuddhiḥ kula putra bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetram
translated: Purifying the ten wholesome courses of action, son of noble family, is a bodhisattva’s buddhafield.

original: tasya bodhiprāptasya niyatāyuṣo mahābhogā brahmacāriṇaḥ satyānuparivartinyā vācālaṃkṛtā
analyzed: tasya bodhi prāptasya niyata āyuṣaḥ mahā bhogāḥ brahmacāriṇaḥ satya anuparivartinyā vācā alaṃkṛtā
translated: When he attains awakening, beings with fixed lifespans, great enjoyments, celibate, truthful, adorned with eloquence,

original: madhuravacanā abhinnaparṣado bhinnasaṃdhānakuśalā īrṣyāvigatā avyāpannacittāḥ samyagdṛṣṭisamanvāgatāḥ
analyzed: madhura vacanāḥ abhinna parṣadaḥ bhinna saṃdhāna kuśalāḥ īrṣyā vigatāḥ a vyāpanna cittāḥ samyak dṛṣṭi samanvāgatāḥ
translated: with sweet speech, unbroken assemblies, skilled in reconciling those who are divided, free from envy, with untroubled minds, endowed with right view,

analyzed: satvāḥ buddhakṣetre saṃbhavanti
translated: are born in his buddhafield.

original: Vkn / iti hi kulaputra /🔽yāvanto bodhisatvasya prayogās tāvanta āśayāḥ /
analyzed: iti hi kula putra  yāvantaḥ bodhisatvasya prayogāḥ tāvantaḥ āśayāḥ
translated: Thus, son of noble family,🔽as many are the bodhisattva’s practices, so many are his intentions.

analyzed: yāvantaḥ āśayāḥ tāvantaḥ dhyā āśayāḥ
translated: As many are his intentions, so many are his superior intentions.

analyzed: yāvantaḥ dhyā śayāḥ tāvantyaḥ nidhyaptayaḥ
translated: As many as are the high resolves, so many are the certainties.

original: yāvantyo nidhyaptayas tāvantyaḥ pratipattayaḥ /🔽yāvantyaḥ pratipattayas tāvantyaḥ pariṇāmanāḥ /
analyzed: yāvantyaḥ nidhi aptayaḥ tāvantyaḥ pratipattayaḥ  yāvantyaḥ pratipattayaḥ tāvantyaḥ pariṇāmanāḥ
translated: As many as are the certainties, so many are the practices.🔽As many as are the practices, so many are the dedications.

original: yāvantyaḥ pariṇāmanās tāvanta upāyāḥ /🔽yāvanta upāyās tāvantyaḥ kṣetrapariśuddhayaḥ /
analyzed: yāvantyaḥ pariṇāmanāḥ tāvantaḥ upāyāḥ  yāvantaḥ upāyāḥ tāvantyaḥ kṣetra pariśuddhayaḥ
translated: As many as are the dedications, so many are the means.🔽As many as are the means, so many are the purities of the fields.

analyzed: yādṛśī kṣetra pariśuddhiḥ tādṛśī satva pariśuddhiḥ
translated: As is the purity of the field, so is the purity of beings.

original: yādṛśī satvapariśuddhis tādṛśī jñānapariśuddhiḥ /🔽yādṛśī jñānapariśuddhis tādṛśī deśanāpariśuddhiḥ /
analyzed: yādṛśī satva pariśuddhiḥ tādṛśī jñāna pariśuddhiḥ  yādṛśī jñāna pariśuddhiḥ tādṛśī deśanā pariśuddhiḥ
translated: As is the purity of beings, so is the purity of knowledge.🔽As is the purity of knowledge, so is the purity of teaching.

analyzed: yādṛśī deśanā pariśuddhiḥ tādṛśī jñāna pratipatti pariśuddhiḥ
translated: As is the purity of teaching, so is the purity of the knowledge and practice.

analyzed: yādṛśī jñāna pratipatti pariśuddhiḥ tādṛśī sva citta pariśuddhiḥ
translated: As is the purity of the knowledge and practice, so is the purity of one's own mind.

original: tasmāt tarhi kulaputra buddhakṣetraṃ pariśodhayitukāmena bodhisatvena svacittapariśodhane yatnaḥ karaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kula putra buddhakṣetram pariśodhayitu kāmena bodhisatvena sva citta pariśodhane yatnaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: Therefore, noble sir, a bodhisattva who wishes to purify a buddha-field should strive to purify his own mind.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yādṛśī bodhisatvasya cittapariśuddhis tādṛśī buddhakṣetrapariśuddhiḥ saṃbhavati /
analyzed: yādṛśī bodhisatvasya citta pariśuddhiḥ tādṛśī buddhakṣetra pariśuddhiḥ saṃbhavati
translated: The purity of a bodhisattva's mind results in the purity of a buddha-field.

analyzed: atha buddha anubhāvena āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya etat abhavat
translated: Then, through the Buddha's power, the venerable Śāriputra had this thought:

original: yadi yādṛśī cittapariśuddhis tādṛśī bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetrapariśuddhiḥ saṃbhavati /
analyzed: yadi yādṛśī citta pariśuddhiḥ tādṛśī bodhisatvasya buddhakṣetra pariśuddhiḥ saṃbhavati
translated: If the purity of a bodhisattva's mind results in the purity of a buddha-field,

original: tan mā āhaiva bhagavataḥ śākyamuner bodhisatvacaryāṃ carataś cittam apariśuddhaṃ yenedaṃ buddhakṣetram evam apariśuddhaṃ saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: tat mā āha eva bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ bodhisatva caryām carataḥ cittam a pariśuddham yena idam buddhakṣetram evam a pariśuddham saṃdṛśyate
translated: then the mind of the Blessed Śākyamuni must not have been very pure when he was practicing bodhisattva conduct, since this buddha-field appears to be so impure.

original: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkam ājñāyāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram etad avocat /🔽tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat  tat kim manyase
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing in his mind the thoughts that had arisen in the mind of the venerable Śāriputra, said to the venerable Śāriputra:🔽What do you think, Śāriputra?

original: śāriputra mā āhaiva sūryācandramasāv apariśuddhau yaj jātyandho na paśyati /
analyzed: śāriputra mā āha eva sūryācandramasau a pariśuddhau yat jāti andhaḥ na paśyati
translated: Are the sun and moon impure because a person born blind cannot see them?

original: āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavan jātyandhāparādha eṣa na sūryacandramasoḥ /
analyzed: āha no hi idam bhagavan jāti andha aparādhaḥ eṣa na sūrya candramasoḥ
translated: He said, No, Blessed One, that is the fault of the person born blind, not of the sun and moon.

original: āha / evam eva śāriputra satvānām ajñānāparādha eṣa yas tathāgatasya buddhakṣetraguṇālaṃkāravyūhaṃ kecit satvā na paśyanti /
analyzed: āha evam eva śāriputra satvānām ajñāna aparādhaḥ eṣa yaḥ tathāgatasya buddhakṣetra guṇa alaṃkāra vyūham kecid satvāḥ na paśyanti
translated: The Blessed One said, In just the same way, Śāriputra, it is the fault of sentient beings, their lack of knowledge, that some sentient beings do not see the array of the qualities and ornaments of the Tathāgata's buddha-field.

analyzed: na tatra tathāgatasya aparādhaḥ
translated: The Tathāgata is not at fault there.

original: pariśuddhaṃ hi śāriputra tathāgatasya buddhakṣetraṃ yūyaṃ punar idaṃ na paśyatha /
analyzed: pariśuddham hi śāriputra tathāgatasya buddhakṣetram yūyam punar idam na paśyatha
translated: The Buddha-field of the Tathāgata is pure, but you do not see it.”

original: Vkn / atha khalu jaṭī brahmā sthaviraṃ śāriputram etad avocat /🔽mā bhadantaśāriputra tathāgatasyāpariśuddhaṃ buddhakṣetram idaṃ vyāhārṣīt /
analyzed: atha khalu jaṭī brahmā sthaviram śāriputram etat avocat  mā bhadanta śāriputra tathāgatasya apariśuddham buddhakṣetram idam vyāhārṣīt
translated: Then Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā World, said to the elder Śāriputra,🔽“Do not say, Venerable Śāriputra, that the Buddha-field of the Tathāgata is impure.

analyzed: pariśuddham hi bhadanta śāriputra bhagavataḥ buddhakṣetram
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the Buddha-field of the Tathāgata is pure; you do not see it because of your impure thought.

original: tadyathāpi nāma śāriputra vaśavartināṃ devānāṃ bhavanavyūhāḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma śāriputra vaśa vartinām devānām bhavana vyūhāḥ
translated: Śāriputra, it is like this: the adornments of the heaven of the lord of the Paranirmita-vaśa-vartin gods

original: īdṛśān vayaṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ paśyāmaḥ /
analyzed: īdṛśān vayam buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ paśyāmaḥ
translated: we see such adornments of the qualities of the Buddha-field of the Lord Śākyamuni.”

original: atha khalu sthaviraḥ śāriputro jaṭinaṃ brahmāṇam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu sthaviraḥ śāriputraḥ jaṭinam brahmāṇam etat avocat
translated: Then the elder Śāriputra said to Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā World,

original: vayaṃ punar brahmann imāṃ mahāpṛthivīm utkūlanikūlāṃ kaṇṭakaprapātagiriśekharaśvabhragūthoḍigallapratipūrṇāṃ paśyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam punar brahman imām mahā pṛthivīm utkūla nikūlām kaṇṭaka prapāta giri śekhara śvabhra gūtha uḍigalla pratipūrṇām paśyāmaḥ
translated: “But, Brahmā, we see this great earth with its high and low places, its thorns, precipices, peaks, and canyons, and its cesspools and charnel grounds.”

analyzed: jaṭī brahmā āha
translated: Brahmā said,🔽“Venerable Śāriputra, it is because of your impure thought that you see this great earth with its high and low places, its thorns, precipices, peaks, and canyons, and its cesspools and charnel grounds.

original: nūnaṃ bhadantaśāriputrasyotkūlanikūlaṃ cittam apariśuddhabuddhajñānāśayaṃ yenedṛśaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ paśyasi /
analyzed: nūnam bhadanta śāriputrasya utkūla nikūlam cittam a pariśuddha buddha jñāna āśayam yena īdṛśam buddhakṣetram paśyasi
translated: “Reverend Śāriputra, your mind is confused by the Buddha’s power, and your thought is perverted by the Buddha’s power, since you do not recognize this buddhafield as pure.

original: ye punas te bhadantaśāriputra bodhisatvāḥ sarvasatvasamacittāḥ pariśuddhabuddhajñānāśayās ta imaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ pariśuddhaṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: ye punar te bhadanta śāriputra bodhisatvāḥ sarva satva sama cittāḥ pariśuddha buddha jñāna āśayāḥ te imam buddhakṣetram pariśuddham paśyanti
translated: But, reverend Śāriputra, those bodhisattvas who have purified their transmigration have minds that are not confused by the Buddha’s power, and their thought is not perverted by the Buddha’s power. They see this buddhafield as pure.”

original: Vkn / atha bhagavān pādāṅguṣṭhena imaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasraṃ lokadhātuṃ parāhanti sma /
analyzed: atha bhagavān pādāṅguṣṭhena imam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasram lokadhātum parāhanti sma
translated: Then the Buddha touched the earth with his big toe, and suddenly it appeared covered with a network of the most precious jewels.

original: atha khalu tasmin samaye 'yaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātur anekaratnaśatasahasrasaṃcito 'nekaratnaśatasahasrapratyarpitaḥ saṃsthito 'bhūt
analyzed: atha khalu tasmin samaye yam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ aneka ratna śata sahasra saṃcitaḥ neka ratna śata sahasra pratyarpitaḥ saṃsthitaḥ bhūt
translated: Then the earth trembled in six ways, and the whole of this Sahā world sphere was seen to be adorned with the most precious jewels.

original: tadyathāpi nāma ratnavyūhasya tathāgatasyānantaguṇaratnavyūho lokadhātus tādṛśo 'yaṃ lokadhātuḥ saṃdṛśyate sma /🔽tatra sā sarvāvatī parṣad āścaryaprāptā ratnapadmaniṣaṇnam ātmānaṃ saṃjānīte sma /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma ratnavyūhasya tathāgatasya ananta guṇa ratna vyūhaḥ lokadhātuḥ tādṛśaḥ yam lokadhātuḥ saṃdṛśyate sma 🔽tatra sā sarvāvatī parṣad āścarya prāptā ratna padma niṣaṇnam ātmānam saṃjānīte sma
translated: It was like the universe called Ratnaviśuddha, the field of the Tathāgata called Ratna­kusuma­suviśuddha­śrī.🔽And all the beings in this Sahā world sphere, from the hells of Avīci downward to the sphere of neither perception nor nonperception, were freed from the suffering of their states of existence and came to experience the happiness of the gods.

original: Vkn / tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram āmantrayate sma
translated: There the Blessed One said to the venerable Śāriputra:

analyzed: paśyasi tvam śāriputra imān buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān
translated: Śāriputra, do you see these arrays of qualities in the Buddha-field?

original: āha / paśyāmi bhagavan adṛṣṭāśrutapūrvā ime vyūhāḥ saṃdṛśyante /
analyzed: āha paśyāmi bhagavan adṛṣṭa aśruta pūrvāḥ ime vyūhāḥ saṃdṛśyante
translated: He said, Blessed One, I see these arrays that have never been seen or heard before.

original: āha / īdṛśaṃ mama śāriputra sadā buddhakṣetram /
analyzed: āha īdṛśam mama śāriputra sadā buddhakṣetram
translated: He said, Śāriputra, my Buddha-field is always like this,

original: hīnasatvaparipākāya tu tathāgata evaṃ bahudoṣaduṣṭaṃ buddhakṣetram upadarśayati /
analyzed: hīna satva paripākāya tu tathāgataḥ evam bahu doṣa duṣṭam buddhakṣetram upadarśayati
translated: but in order to mature inferior beings, the Tathāgata shows a Buddha-field with so many faults.

original: tadyathā śāriputra devaputrāṇām ekapātryāṃ bhuñjānānāṃ yathā puṇyopacayaviśeṣeṇa sudhādevabhojanam upatiṣṭhataḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā śāriputra deva putrāṇām eka pātryām bhuñjānānām yathā puṇya upacaya viśeṣeṇa sudhādeva bhojanam upatiṣṭhataḥ
translated: Just as, Śāriputra, when the sons of the gods are eating from the same vessel, the nectar of the gods appears according to the difference in their merit,

original: evam eva śāriputra ekabuddhakṣetropapannā yathā cittapariśuddhyā satvā buddhānāṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān paśyanti /
analyzed: evam eva śāriputra eka buddhakṣetra upapannāḥ yathā citta pariśuddhyā satvāḥ buddhānām buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān paśyanti
translated: in the same way, Śāriputra, beings who are born in the same Buddha-field see the arrays of qualities in the Buddha-fields of the Buddhas according to the purity of their minds.

original: Vkn / asmin khalu punar buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhālaṃkāre saṃdarśyamāne caturaśīteḥ prāṇisahasrāṇām anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittāny utpannāni
analyzed: asmin khalu punar buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūha alaṃkāre saṃdarśyamāne caturaśīteḥ prāṇi sahasrāṇām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpannāni
translated: And when this array of the qualities and adornments of the Buddha-field was being shown, the thought of supreme perfect enlightenment arose in eighty-four thousand living beings,

original: yāni ca tāni ratnākareṇa licchavikumāreṇa sārdhaṃ pañca licchavikumāraśatāny āgatāni teṣām apy ānulomikyāḥ kṣānteḥ pratilaṃbho 'bhūt /
analyzed: yāni ca tāni ratnākareṇa licchavi kumāreṇa sārdham pañca licchavi kumāra śatāni āgatāni teṣām api ānulomikyāḥ kṣānteḥ pratilaṃbhaḥ bhūt
translated: And those five hundred Licchavi youths who had come with Ratnākara, they too attained the acceptance that accords with reality.

original: Vkn / atha bhagavān punar eva tām ṛddhiṃ pratisaṃharati sma /
analyzed: atha bhagavān punar eva tām ṛddhim pratisaṃharati sma
translated: Then the Blessed One withdrew that miracle.

original: tataḥ punar evedaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ tatsvabhāvam eva saṃvṛtam /
analyzed: tatas punar eva idam buddhakṣetram tad svabhāvam eva saṃvṛtam
translated: Then this buddha-field again became as it was before.

original: tatra śrāvakayānikānāṃ devamanuṣyāṇām ḥ anityā bateme sarvasaṃskārā iti viditvā dvātriṃśatā prāṇisahasrāṇāṃ virajovigatamalaṃ dharmeṣu dharmacakṣur
analyzed: tatra śrāvaka yānikānām deva manuṣyāṇām anityāḥ bata ime sarva saṃskārāḥ iti viditvā dvātriṃśatā prāṇi sahasrāṇām virajaḥ vigata malam dharmeṣu dharma cakṣuḥ
translated: There, among the devas and humans who followed the Śrāvakayāna, thirty-two thousand beings, knowing that all conditioned things are indeed impermanent,

analyzed: viśuddham
translated: purified the Dharma-eye that sees phenomena free from dust and unobscured.

original: aṣṭānāṃ ca bhikṣusahasrāṇām anupādāyāsravebhyaś cittāni vimuktāni /🔽caturaśīteś ca prāṇisahasrāṇām udārabuddhadharmādhimuktānāṃ viṭhapanapratyupasthānalakṣaṇāḥ sarvadharmā iti viditvānuttarasyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: aṣṭānām ca bhikṣu sahasrāṇām an upādāya āsravebhyaḥ cittāni vimuktāni  caturaśīteḥ ca prāṇi sahasrāṇām udāra buddha dharma adhimuktānām viṭhapana pratyupasthāna lakṣaṇāḥ sarva dharmāḥ iti viditvā anuttarasyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And the minds of eight thousand monks were liberated from the defilements without further clinging.🔽And the minds of eighty-four thousand beings who had deep faith in the Buddha's teachings arose for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: cittāni utpannāni
translated: knowing that all phenomena are characterized by pretense and dependence.

analyzed: buddhakṣetra pariśuddhi nidāna parivartaḥ prathamaḥ
translated: The First Chapter: The Introduction to the Purification of the Buddha-Field

original: Vkn / tena khalu punaḥ samayena vaiśālyāṃ mahānagaryāṃ vimalakīrtir nāma licchaviḥ prativasati sma /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena vaiśālyām mahā nagaryām vimalakīrtiḥ nāma licchaviḥ prativasati sma

analyzed: pūrva jina kṛta adhikāraḥ

analyzed: avaropita kuśala mūlaḥ
translated: He had planted the roots of virtue.

analyzed: bahu buddha paryupāsitaḥ  pratilabdha kṣāntikaḥ
translated: He had attended many buddhas.🔽He had attained patient acceptance.

analyzed: labdha pratibhānaḥ
translated: He had attained eloquence.

analyzed: dhāraṇī pratilabdhaḥ  vaiśāradya prāptaḥ
translated: He was skilled in the great superknowledges.🔽He had attained retention.🔽He had attained fearlessness.

analyzed: nihata māra pratyarthikaḥ
translated: He had defeated Māra and his adversaries.

analyzed: gambhīra dharma naya su praviṣṭaḥ  prajñāpāramitā nirjātaḥ  upāya kauśalya gatiṃgataḥ
translated: He had penetrated the profound Dharma method.🔽He was born from the perfection of wisdom.🔽He had attained skill in means.

analyzed: pratibhāna samanvāgataḥ
translated: He possessed eloquence.

analyzed: satva āśaya carita kuśalaḥ
translated: He was skilled in the intentions and conduct of beings.

analyzed: indriya para apara jñāna niryātaḥ
translated: He had emerged through knowledge of the higher and lower faculties.

analyzed: yathāpratyarha dharma deśakaḥ
translated: He taught the Dharma according to the occasion.

analyzed: kṛta niścayaḥ kṛta śramaḥ iha mahāyāne
translated: He had made a firm resolve and exerted himself in this Great Vehicle.

analyzed: su parīkṣita karma kārī
translated: He performed well-examined actions.

analyzed: buddha īryā patha pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: He was established in the Buddha's conduct.

analyzed: sāgaravara buddhi anupraviṣṭaḥ
translated: He had penetrated the ocean-like excellent mind.

analyzed: sarva buddha stuta stomita praśaṃsitaḥ
translated: He was praised, extolled, and lauded by all buddhas.

analyzed: sarva śakra brahma lokapāla namaskṛtaḥ
translated: He was bowed to by all Śakras, Brahmās, and world guardians.

original: sa satvaparipākāyopāyakauśalyena vaiśālyāṃ mahānagaryāṃ prativasati sma /
analyzed: sa satva paripākāya upāya kauśalyena vaiśālyām mahā nagaryām prativasati sma
translated: He lived in the great city of Vaiśālī with skillful means for the sake of ripening beings.

analyzed: akṣaya bhogaḥ daridra anātha sattva saṃgrahāya
translated: He had inexhaustible wealth for the sake of gathering beings who were poor and helpless.

analyzed: pariśuddha śīlaḥ duḥśīla saṃgrahāya

analyzed: kṣama dama prāptaḥ duṣṭa praduṣṭa vyāpanna krudha cittānām satvānām saṃgrahāya
translated: He had attained patience and self-control for the sake of gathering beings with malicious, hostile, and angry minds.

analyzed: uttapta vīryaḥ kusīdānām satvānām saṃgrahāya
translated: He had fervent energy for the sake of gathering lazy beings.

analyzed: dhyāna smṛti samādhi sthitaḥ vibhrānta cittānām satvānām saṃgrahāya
translated: He was established in meditation, mindfulness, and concentration for the sake of gathering beings with distracted minds.

analyzed: prajñā niścaya prāptaḥ duḥprajñānām satvānām saṃgrahāya
translated: He had attained certainty in wisdom for the sake of gathering beings with poor wisdom.

analyzed: avadāta vastra dhārī śramaṇa īryāpatha saṃpannaḥ
translated: He wore white clothes and was endowed with the conduct of an ascetic.

analyzed: gṛha vāsa sthitaḥ kāmadhātu rūpadhātu ārūpya dhātu asaṃsṛṣṭaḥ
translated: He lived in a household, but was unattached to the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

analyzed: bhāryā putra dārān ca saṃdarśayati
translated: He displayed a wife, sons, and daughters.

analyzed: sadā ca brahmacārī
translated: But he was always celibate.

analyzed: parivāra parivṛtaḥ ca bhavati
translated: He was surrounded by a retinue.

analyzed: sadā ca viveka cārī
translated: But he always practiced solitude.

analyzed: ābharaṇa vibhūṣitaḥ ca saṃdṛśyate
translated: He was seen adorned with ornaments.

analyzed: sadā ca lakṣaṇa paricchinnaḥ
translated: But he was always marked with the characteristics [of a renunciant].

analyzed: anna pāna bhojana jīvaḥ saṃdṛśyate
translated: He was seen living on food and drink.

analyzed: sadā ca dhyāna āhāraḥ
translated: And he always eats food that is the result of meditation.

analyzed: sarva dyūta karaśālāsu ca saṃdṛśyate
translated: He is seen in all gambling houses.

analyzed: dyūta krīḍā āsakta cittān ca satvān paripācayati
translated: And he ripens those beings whose minds are attached to the play of gambling.

analyzed: sadā ca apramāda cārī
translated: And he always practices heedfulness.

analyzed: sarva pāṣaṇḍa pratyeṣakaḥ ca
translated: And he is a follower of all the heretics.

analyzed: buddhe ca abhedya āśayaḥ
translated: And he is unshakable in his faith in the Buddha.

analyzed: sarva laukika lokottara śāstra vidhi jñaḥ ca
translated: And he knows the methods of all the worldly and transcendent sciences.

analyzed: sadā ca dharma ārāma rati rataḥ
translated: And he is always devoted to the pleasure of delighting in the Dharma.

analyzed: sarva saṃgaṇikāsu ca saṃdṛśyate
translated: And he is seen in all the social gatherings.

analyzed: sarvatra ca agra pūjitaḥ
translated: And he is honored as the foremost everywhere.

original: Vkn / dharmavādī ca vṛddhamadhyadahrasahāyakaś ca lokānuvartanāya /
analyzed: dharma vādī ca vṛddha madhya dahra sahāyakaḥ ca loka anuvartanāya
translated: And he speaks the Dharma, and he associates with the old, the middle-aged, and the young, in order to conform to the world.

analyzed: sarva vyavahāra udyuktaḥ ca na ca lābha bhoga abhilāṣī
translated: And he is engaged in all the legal procedures, but he does not desire gain or enjoyments.

analyzed: sarva catvara śrṅgāṭakeṣu ca saṃdṛśyate sarva satva vainayika tāyai
translated: And he is seen in all the crossroads and street corners, in order to guide all beings.

analyzed: rāja kārya anupraviṣṭaḥ ca sattva ārakṣāyai
translated: And he is involved in royal affairs, in order to protect beings.

original: sarvadharmaśravaṇasāṃkathyeṣu ca saṃdṛśyate hīnayānavicchandanāya mahāyāne samādāpanatayā /
analyzed: sarva dharma śravaṇa sāṃkathyeṣu ca saṃdṛśyate hīnayāna vicchandanāya mahāyāne samādāpana tayā
translated: And he is seen in all the discussions about listening to the Dharma, in order to discourage the Lesser Vehicle and to inspire the Great Vehicle.

analyzed: sarva lipi śālāsu ca upasaṃkrāmati dāraka paripācanāya
translated: And he goes to all the schools, in order to ripen the children.

analyzed: sarva gaṇikā kulāni ca praviśati kāma doṣa saṃdarśanāya
translated: He entered all the brothels in order to show the faults of desire.

analyzed: sarva kallavāla gṛhāṇi ca praviśati smṛti saṃprajanya upasthāpanāya
translated: He entered all the houses of prostitutes in order to establish mindfulness and awareness.

analyzed: śreṣṭhiṣu ca śreṣṭhi saṃmataḥ śreṣṭha dharma ārocana tāyai
translated: Among the merchants, he was considered a merchant in order to teach the supreme Dharma.

analyzed: gṛhapatiṣu ca gṛhapati saṃmataḥ sarva grāha udgraha paricchedāya
translated: Among the householders, he was considered a householder in order to cut off all grasping and clinging.

analyzed: kṣatriyeṣu ca kṣatriya saṃmataḥ kṣānti sauratya bala pratiṣṭhāpanāya
translated: Among the kṣatriyas, he was considered a kṣatriya in order to establish the power of patience and gentleness.

analyzed: brāhmaṇeṣu ca brāhmaṇa saṃmataḥ māna mada darpa nirghātanāya
translated: Among the brahmins, he was considered a brahmin in order to destroy pride, conceit, and arrogance.

original: āmātyeṣu cāmātyasaṃmataḥ sarvarājakāryasahadharmamyojanāya /🔽kumāreṣu ca kumārasaṃmato rājabhogaiśvaryābhilāṣavinivartanāya /
analyzed: āmātyeṣu ca amātya saṃmataḥ sarva rāja kārya sahadharmamyojanāya  kumāreṣu ca kumāra saṃmataḥ rāja bhoga aiśvarya abhilāṣa vinivartanāya
translated: Among the ministers, he was considered a minister in order to apply the Dharma to all royal affairs.🔽Among the princes, he was considered a prince in order to turn them away from longing for the pleasures and power of kingship.

analyzed: antaḥpureṣu ca kāñcukīya saṃmataḥ strī kumārikā paripācanāya
translated: Among the harem women, he was considered a chamberlain in order to ripen the women and girls.

analyzed: prākṛta jana anuvartakaḥ ca sāmānya puṇya viśiṣṭa adhyālaṃbanāya
translated: He followed the common people in order to focus on the superior merit of the ordinary.

analyzed: śakreṣu ca śakra saṃmataḥ aiśvarya anitya tva saṃdarśanāyau
translated: Among the Śakras, he was considered a Śakra in order to show the impermanence of power and wealth.

analyzed: brahmasu ca brahma saṃmataḥ viśeṣa jñāna saṃdarśanāya
translated: And among the Brahmas, he was considered a Brahma, in order to show special knowledge.

analyzed: lokapāleṣu ca lokapāla saṃmataḥ sarva satva paripālanāya
translated: And among the world guardians, he was considered a world guardian, in order to protect all beings.

original: iti hi vimalakīrtir licchavir evam apramāṇopāyakauśalajñānasamanvāgato vaiśālyāṃ mahānagaryāṃ prativasati sma /
analyzed: iti hi vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ evam a pramāṇa upāya kauśala jñāna samanvāgataḥ vaiśālyām mahā nagaryām prativasati sma
translated: Thus, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti, endowed with such immeasurable skillful means and knowledge, dwelt in the great city of Vaiśālī.

original: Vkn / sa upāyakauśalyena glānam ātmānam upadarśayati sma /🔽tasya glānasya vaiśālyāṃ mahānagaryāṃ rājarājamahāmātrāmātyakumārapāriṣadyā brāhmaṇagṛhapatayaḥ
analyzed: saḥ upāya kauśalyena glānam ātmānam upadarśayati sma  tasya glānasya vaiśālyām mahā nagaryām rāja rāja mahāmātra amātya kumāra pāriṣadyāḥ brāhmaṇa gṛhapatayaḥ
translated: He, by skillful means, manifested himself as sick.🔽The kings, royal ministers, court officials, princes, attendants, brahmins, householders,🔽merchants, city-dwellers, country-people, and many thousands of other living beings from the great city of Vaiśālī

original: śreṣṭhinaigamajānapadās tadanyāni ca bahūni prāṇisahasrāṇi glānaparipṛcchakāny upasaṃkrāmanti sma /
analyzed: śreṣṭhi naigama jānapadāḥ tad anyāni ca bahūni prāṇi sahasrāṇi glāna paripṛcchakāni upasaṃkrāmanti sma
translated: approached him to inquire about his illness.

analyzed: teṣām upasaṃkrāntānām vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ
translated: To those who approached, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti

original: imam eva cāturmahābhautikaṃ kāyam ārabhya dharmaṃ deśayati sma /
analyzed: imam eva cāturmahābhautikam kāyam ārabhya dharmam deśayati sma
translated: taught the Dharma, beginning with the very body composed of the four great elements:

analyzed: evam anityaḥ yam mārṣāḥ kāyaḥ  evam adhruvaḥ
translated: Friends, this body is so impermanent,🔽so unstable,

analyzed: evam anāsvāsikaḥ  evam durbalaḥ
translated: so unreliable,🔽so weak,🔽so insubstantial,

analyzed: evam asāraḥ 🔽evam jarjaraḥ
translated: so fragile,

analyzed: evam itvaraḥ  evam duḥkhaḥ
translated: It is like this.

analyzed: evam ābādhikaḥ
translated: It is like this. It is suffering.🔽It is like this. It is subject to disease.

analyzed: evam vipariṇāma dharmā
translated: It is like this. It is subject to change.

analyzed: evam bahu roga bhājanaḥ yam mārṣāḥ kāyaḥ
translated: Friends, this body is a vessel of many diseases.

analyzed: tatra paṇḍitena niśrayaḥ na kartavyaḥ
translated: The wise should not rely on it.

analyzed: phena piṇḍa upamaḥ yam mārṣāḥ parimardana kṣamaḥ
translated: Friends, this body is like a lump of foam, unable to bear pressure.

analyzed: budbuda upamaḥ yam cirasthitikaḥ
translated: This body is like a bubble, not remaining long.

analyzed: marīci upamaḥ yam kāyaḥ kleśa tṛṣṇā saṃbhūtaḥ  kadalī skandha upamaḥ yam sāraka tvāt
translated: This body is like a mirage, arising from afflictions and craving.🔽This body is like the trunk of a plantain tree, being without essence.

analyzed: yantra bhūtaḥ bata ayam kāyaḥ sthi snāyu vinibaddhaḥ  māyā upamaḥ yam kāyaḥ viparyāsa saṃbhūtaḥ
translated: This body is like a machine, bound by bones and sinews.🔽This body is like an illusion, arising from error.

original: svapnopamo 'yaṃ kāyo vitathadarśanaḥ /🔽pratibhāsopamo 'yaṃ kāyaḥ pūrvakarmapratibhāsatayā saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: svapna upamaḥ yam kāyaḥ vitatha darśanaḥ  pratibhāsa upamaḥ yam kāyaḥ pūrva karma pratibhāsa tayā saṃdṛśyate
translated: This body is like a dream, a false vision.🔽This body is like a reflection, seen due to past karma.

analyzed: pratiśrutkā upamaḥ yam kāyaḥ pratyaya adhīna tvāt  megha upamaḥ yaiḥ kāyaḥ citta ākula vigama lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: This body is like an echo, dependent on conditions.🔽This body is like a cloud, characterized by the dispersion of the agitated mind.

analyzed: vidyut sadṛśaḥ yam kāyaḥ kṣaṇa bhaṅga yuktaḥ nava sthitaḥ
translated: This body is like lightning, subject to momentary disintegration and instability.

analyzed: asvāmikaḥ yam kāyaḥ nānā pratyaya saṃbhūtaḥ
translated: This body has no owner, arising from various conditions.

analyzed: nirvyāpāraḥ yam kāyaḥ pṛthivī sadṛśaḥ
translated: This body is devoid of activity, like the earth.

analyzed: anātmaḥ yam kāya u psadṛśaḥ  nirjīvaḥ yam kāyaḥ tejaḥ sadṛśaḥ
translated: This body is without a self, like water.🔽This body is without a living being, like fire.

analyzed: niṣpudgalaḥ yam kāyaḥ vāyu sadṛśaḥ
translated: This body is without a person, like air.

analyzed: niḥsvabhāvaḥ yam kāyaḥ ākāśa sadṛśaḥ
translated: This body is without intrinsic nature, like space.

analyzed: asaṃbhūtaḥ yam kāyaḥ mahābhūtānām ālayaḥ
translated: This body is unreal, a repository of the great elements.

analyzed: śūnyaḥ yam kāyaḥ ātma ātmīya vigataḥ
translated: This body is empty, devoid of a self and what belongs to a self.

analyzed: jaḍaḥ yam kāyaḥ tṛṇa kāṣṭha kuḍya loṣṭa pratibhāsa sadṛśaḥ
translated: This body is inert, like grass, wood, walls, or clods of earth.

analyzed: niśceṣṭaḥ yam kāyaḥ vāta yantra yuktaḥ vartate
translated: This body moves about through the combination of wind and machinery.

analyzed: riktaḥ yam śuci pūti saṃcayaḥ
translated: This body is hollow, a collection of impurities and what is rotten.

analyzed: tucchaḥ yam kāyaḥ ucchādana parimardana vikiraṇa vidhvansana dharmā
translated: This body is worthless, subject to being scratched, rubbed, scattered, and destroyed.

original: upadruto 'yaṃ kāyaś caturuttaraiś caturbhī rogaśataiḥ /🔽jīrṇodapānasadṛśo 'yaṃ kāyaḥ sadā jarābhibhūtaḥ /
analyzed: upadrutaḥ yam kāyaḥ catur uttaraiḥ caturbhiḥ roga śataiḥ  jīrṇa udapāna sadṛśaḥ yam kāyaḥ sadā jarā abhibhūtaḥ
translated: This body is afflicted by the four hundred and four diseases.🔽This body is always overcome by old age, like an old well.

analyzed: paryanta sthāyī bata ayam kāyaḥ maraṇa paryavasānaḥ
translated: This body is limited, ending in death.

analyzed: vadha kāśīviṣa śūnya grāma upamaḥ yam kāyaḥ skandha dhātu āyatana parigṛhītaḥ
translated: This body, consisting of aggregates, elements, and sense bases, is like a murderer, a poisonous snake, an empty village.

original: tatra yuṣmābhir evaṃrūpe kāye nirvidvirāga utpādayitavyas tathāgatakāye ca spṛhotpādayitavyā /
analyzed: tatra yuṣmābhiḥ evaṃrūpe kāye nirvid virāgaḥ utpādayitavyaḥ tathāgata kāye ca spṛhā utpādayitavyā
translated: Therefore, you should generate disgust and detachment towards such a body, and generate longing for the body of the Tathāgata.

original: Vkn / dharmakāyo hi mārṣāḥ tathāgatakāyo dānanirjātaḥ śīlanirjātaḥ samādhinirjātaḥ prajñānirjāto vimuktinirjāto vimuktijñānadarśananirjātaḥ
analyzed: dharmakāyaḥ hi mārṣāḥ tathāgata kāyaḥ dāna nirjātaḥ śīla nirjātaḥ samādhi nirjātaḥ prajñā nirjātaḥ vimukti nirjātaḥ vimukti jñāna darśana nirjātaḥ
translated: The Dharma body, friends, is the body of the Tathāgata, born of generosity, born of morality, born of concentration, born of wisdom, born of liberation, born of the vision and cognition of liberation.
It is born of loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

analyzed: dāna dama saṃyama nirjātaḥ kṣānti sauratya nirjātaḥ dṛḍha vīrya kuśala mūla nirjātaḥ dhyāna vimokṣa samādhi samāpatti nirjātaḥ śruta prajñā upāya nirjātaḥ
translated: It is born of giving, self-control, and restraint, born of patience and gentleness, born of firm diligence and wholesome roots, born of meditation, liberation, concentration, and absorption, born of learning, wisdom, and skillful means.

analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣya nirjātaḥ śamatha vidarśanā nirjātaḥ daśa bala nirjātaḥ catur vaiśāradya nirjātaḥ
translated: It is born of the thirty-seven factors of awakening, born of tranquility and insight, born of the ten powers, born of the four forms of fearlessness.

analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharma nirjātaḥ sarva pāramitā nirjātaḥ
translated: It is born of the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, born of all the perfections.

original: abhijñāvidyānirjātaḥ sarvākuśaladharmaprahāṇāya nirjātaḥ sarvakuśaladharmaparigrahanirjātaḥ satyanirjāto bhūtanirjāto 'pramādanirjātaḥ /
analyzed: abhijñā vidyā nirjātaḥ sarva akuśala dharma prahāṇāya nirjātaḥ sarva kuśala dharma parigraha nirjātaḥ satya nirjātaḥ bhūta nirjātaḥ pramāda nirjātaḥ
translated: He is born from the knowledge of the superknowledges, born from the abandonment of all unwholesome dharmas, born from the possession of all wholesome dharmas, born from the truths, born from the real, born from heedfulness,

original: apramāṇaśubhakarmanirjāto mārṣās tathāgatakāyas tatra yuṣmābhiḥ spṛhā kartavyā /
analyzed: apramāṇa śubha karma nirjātaḥ mārṣāḥ tathāgata kāyaḥ tatra yuṣmābhiḥ spṛhā kartavyā
translated: born from immeasurable wholesome actions, friends, is the body of the Tathāgata. You should aspire to that.

original: sarvasatvānāṃ ca sarvakleśavyādhiprahāṇāyānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittāny utpādayitavyāni /
analyzed: sarva satvānām ca sarva kleśa vyādhi prahāṇāya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayitavyāni
translated: And you should arouse the mind of enlightenment for the sake of all beings, for the abandonment of all the afflictions and sicknesses of all beings, and for the highest complete enlightenment.

original: Vkn / evaṃ vimalakīrtir licchavis tathā saṃnipatitānāṃ teṣāṃ glānaparipṛcchakānāṃ
analyzed: evam vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ tathā saṃnipatitānām teṣām glāna paripṛcchakānām
translated: Thus Vimalakīrti, the Licchavi, for those who had assembled to inquire about his illness

original: tathā tathā dharmaṃ deśayati yad bahūni satvaśatasahasrāṇy anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: tathā tathā dharmam deśayati yat bahūni satva śata sahasrāṇi anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: taught the Dharma in such a way that many hundreds of thousands of living beings generated

analyzed: cittāni utpādayanti
translated: the mind of enlightenment.

analyzed: acintyopāyakauśalyaparivartaḥ nāma dvitīyaḥ
translated: The second chapter, named “The Inconceivable Skill in Means.”

original: Vkn / atha vimalakīrter licchaver etad abhavat /
analyzed: atha vimalakīrteḥ licchaveḥ etat abhavat
translated: Then the Licchavi Vimalakīrti thought,

analyzed: aham ca glānaḥ ābādhikaḥ mañca samārūḍhaḥ
translated: “I am sick, lying on my bed in pain,

original: na ca māṃ tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ samanvāharati /
analyzed: na ca mām tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ samanvāharati
translated: and yet the Tathāgata does not consider me or take pity on me.”

original: na ca me glānaparipṛcchakaṃ kaṃcit preṣayaty anukaṃpām upādāya /
analyzed: na ca me glāna paripṛcchakam kaṃcid preṣayati anukaṃpām upādāya
translated: And he does not send anyone out of compassion to ask about my illness.

original: Vkn / samanvāhṛtaś ca bhagavatā vimalakīrtir licchaviḥ /
analyzed: samanvāhṛtaḥ ca bhagavatā vimala kīrtiḥ licchaviḥ
translated: Then the Lord directed his thought to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti.

original: atha bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram āmantrayate sma
translated: Thereupon the Lord said to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: gaccha tvaṃ śāriputra vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
analyzed: gaccha tvam śāriputra vimala kīrteḥ licchaveḥ glāna paripṛcchakaḥ
translated: “Śāriputra, go to inquire about the illness of the Licchavi Vimalakīrti.”

original: evam ukta āyuṣmāñ śāriputro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam uktaḥ āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Thus addressed, the venerable Śāriputra said to the Lord,

original: nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: na aham bhagavan utsahe vimalakīrteḥ licchaveḥ glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  abhijānāmi aham bhagavan
translated: And why?

analyzed: ekasmin samaye nyatamasmin vṛkṣa mūle pratisaṃlīnaḥ bhūvam
translated: Lord, I remember one day when I was in the śuddhāvāsa, in the Tūṣita heaven,

original: vimalakīrtiś ca licchavir yena tad vṛkṣamūlaṃ tenopasaṃkramya mām etad avocat /
analyzed: vimalakīrtiḥ ca licchaviḥ yena tat vṛkṣa mūlam tena upasaṃkramya mām etat avocat
translated: the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came there and, having bowed down at my feet, said to me,

original: Vkn / na bhadantaśāriputra evaṃ pratisaṃlayanaṃ saṃlātavyaṃ yathā tvaṃ pratisaṃlīnaḥ /
analyzed: na bhadanta śāriputra evam pratisaṃlayanam saṃlātavyam yathā tvam pratisaṃlīnaḥ
translated: ‘Reverend Śāriputra, do not enter into concentration by the way of the śrāvakas, but enter into concentration by the way of the bodhisattvas.

original: api tu tathā pratisaṃlīyaś ca yathā traidhātuke na kāyaś cittaṃ vā saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: api tu tathā pratisaṃlīyaḥ ca yathā traidhātuke na kāyaḥ cittam vā saṃdṛśyate
translated: But rather, one should meditate in such a way that the body and mind are not seen in the three realms.

original: tathā pratisaṃlīyaś ca yathā nirodhāc ca na vyuttiṣṭhasi sarveryāpatheṣu ca saṃdṛśyase /
analyzed: tathā pratisaṃlīyaḥ ca yathā nirodhāt ca na vyuttiṣṭhasi sarva īryāpatheṣu ca saṃdṛśyase
translated: One should meditate in such a way that one does not arise from cessation, yet is seen in all modes of conduct.

original: tathā pratisaṃlīyaś ca yathā prāptilakṣaṇaṃ ca na vijahāsi pṛthagjanalakṣaṇeṣu ca saṃdṛśyase /
analyzed: tathā pratisaṃlīyaḥ ca yathā prāpti lakṣaṇam ca na vijahāsi pṛthagjana lakṣaṇeṣu ca saṃdṛśyase
translated: One should meditate in such a way that one does not abandon the characteristics of attainment, yet is seen in the characteristics of ordinary beings.

original: tathā pratisaṃlīyaś ca yathā te na cādhyātmaṃ cittam avasthitaṃ bhaven na bahirdhopavicaret /
analyzed: tathā pratisaṃlīyaḥ ca yathā te na ca adhyātmam cittam avasthitam bhavet na bahirdhā upavicaret
translated: One should meditate in such a way that one's mind is not internally fixed, yet does not wander externally.

original: tathā pratisaṃlīyaś ca yathā sarvadṛṣṭigatebhyaś ca na calasi saptatriṃśatsu ca bodhipakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu saṃdṛśyase /
analyzed: tathā pratisaṃlīyaḥ ca yathā sarva dṛṣṭi gatebhyaḥ ca na calasi saptatriṃśatsu ca bodhi pakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu saṃdṛśyase
translated: One should meditate in such a way that one does not move from all the views, yet is seen in the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: tathā pratisaṃlīyaś ca yathā saṃsārāvacarāṃś ca kleśān na prajahāsi nirvāṇasamavasaraṇaś ca bhavasi /
analyzed: tathā pratisaṃlīyaḥ ca yathā saṃsāra avacarān ca kleśān na prajahāsi nirvāṇa samavasaraṇaḥ ca bhavasi
translated: One should meditate in such a way that one does not abandon the afflictions that occur in cyclic existence, yet enters into nirvana.

original: ye bhadantaśāriputra evaṃ pratisaṃlayanaṃ pratisaṃlīyante teṣāṃ bhagavān pratisaṃlayanam anujānāti /
analyzed: ye bhadanta śāriputra evam pratisaṃlayanam pratisaṃlīyante teṣām bhagavān pratisaṃlayanam anujānāti
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, the Blessed One approves of the meditation of those who meditate in this way.

original: Vkn / so 'haṃ bhagavan etāṃ śrutvā tūṣṇīm evābhūvam /
analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavan etām śrutvā tūṣṇīm eva abhūvam
translated: I, Lord, having heard this, remained silent.

original: na tasya śaknomy uttare prativacanaṃ dātum /
analyzed: na tasya śaknomi uttare prativacanam dātum
translated: I was not able to give him an answer.

original: tan nāham utsahe tasya kulaputrasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: tat na aham utsahe tasya kula putrasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Therefore, I am reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.”

original: Vkn / tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ mahāmaudgalyāyanam āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam mahāmaudgalyāyanam āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Lord said to the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana,

original: gaccha tvaṃ maudgalyāyana vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
analyzed: gaccha tvam maudgalyāyana vimala kīrteḥ licchaveḥ glāna paripṛcchakaḥ
translated: “Maudgalyāyana, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

analyzed: maudgalyāyanaḥ pi āha
translated: Maudgalyāyana replied,

original: nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And why?

analyzed: abhijānāmi aham bhagavan
translated: Lord, I remember that one day,

original: ekasmin samaye vaiśālyāṃ mahānagaryām anyatamasmin vīthīmukhe gṛhapatibhyo dharmaṃ deśayāmi /
analyzed: ekasmin samaye vaiśālyām mahā nagaryām anyatamasmin vīthī mukhe gṛhapatibhyaḥ dharmam deśayāmi
translated: when I was teaching the Dharma to householders in the town,

original: tatra māṃ vimalakīrtir licchavir upasaṃkrāmyaivam āha /
analyzed: tatra mām vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ upasaṃkrāmya evam āha
translated: the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came along and said to me,

original: Vkn / na bhadantamaudgalyāyana gṛhibhyo 'vadātavasanebhya evaṃ dharmo deśayitavyo yathā bhadanto deśayati /
analyzed: na bhadanta maudgalyāyana gṛhibhyaḥ vadāta vasanebhyaḥ evam dharmaḥ deśayitavyaḥ yathā bhadantaḥ deśayati
translated: ‘Reverend Maudgalyāyana, do not teach the Dharma to the householders in such a way.

original: api tu tathā bhadantamaudgalyāyana dharmo deśayitavyo yathaiva sa dharmaḥ /
analyzed: api tu tathā bhadanta maudgalyāyana dharmaḥ deśayitavyaḥ yathā eva sa dharmaḥ
translated: But, Venerable Maudgalyāyana, the Dharma should be taught just as it is.

analyzed: dharmaḥ hi bhadanta maudgalyāyana asatvaḥ satva rajaḥ vigataḥ
translated: Venerable Maudgalyāyana, the Dharma is without sentient beings, free from the dust of sentient beings.

analyzed: nairātmyaḥ rāga rajaḥ vigataḥ
translated: Selflessness is free from the dust of passion.

analyzed: nirjīvaḥ jāti cyuti vigataḥ
translated: Lifelessness is free from birth and death.

analyzed: niṣpudgalaḥ pūrva anta apara anta paricchinnaḥ
translated: Without a person, it is cut off from the past and future.

analyzed: śāntaḥ upaśānta lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Peaceful, it has the characteristic of tranquility.

analyzed: virāgaḥ na ārambaṇa gatikaḥ  anakṣaraḥ sarva vākya chedaḥ
translated: Dispassionate, it goes beyond objects.🔽Without letters, it cuts off all speech.

analyzed: an udāhāraḥ sarva ūrmi vigataḥ  sarvatra anugataḥ ākāśa sama sadṛśaḥ
translated: Without expression, it is free from all waves.🔽Pervading everywhere, it is like space.

analyzed: avarṇa liṅga saṃsthānaḥ sarva pracāra vigataḥ
translated: Without color, gender, or form, it is free from all activity.

analyzed: amamaḥ mamakāra vigataḥ
translated: Without mine, it is free from the notion of mine.

analyzed: a vijñaptiḥ citta manaḥ vijñāna vigataḥ
translated: Unmanifested, it is free from mind, thought, and consciousness.

analyzed: asadṛśaḥ niṣpratipakṣa tvāt
translated: Unlike, because it has no counterpart.

analyzed: hetu vilakṣaṇaḥ pratyaya asamāropaḥ
translated: Different from causes, it does not superimpose conditions.

analyzed: dharmadhātu samavasaraṇaḥ sarva dharma samāhitaḥ
translated: It enters the realm of phenomena, being united with all phenomena.

analyzed: tathatā anugataḥ nanu gamana yogena
translated: Following suchness, it is connected through non-connection.

analyzed: bhūtakoṭi pratiṣṭhitaḥ utyanta acalita tvāt
translated: Established at the limit of reality, it is utterly unshakable.

analyzed: acalitaḥ ṣaṣ viṣaya a niśrita tvāt
translated: Unshakable, it does not rely on the six sense objects.

analyzed: na kvacid gamana āgamanaḥ na vasthita tvāt
translated: It does not go anywhere, because it does not stand still.

analyzed: śūnyatā samāhitaḥ praṇihita lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: It is concentrated on emptiness, manifested in the signless, and characterized by wishlessness.

analyzed: ūha apoha vigataḥ
translated: It is free from speculation.

analyzed: an utkṣepaḥ prakṣepaḥ
translated: It is without rejection and without acceptance.

analyzed: utpāda bhaṅga vigataḥ
translated: It is free from origination and destruction.

analyzed: an ālayaḥ cakṣuḥ śrotra ghrāṇa jihvā kāya manaḥ patha samatikrāntaḥ
translated: It is without abode, transcending the paths of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and thought.

analyzed: an unnataḥ navanataḥ
translated: It is neither elevated nor low.

analyzed: sthitaḥ na iñjyam prāptaḥ
translated: It is stable, having attained imperturbability.

analyzed: sarva pracāra vigataḥ
translated: It is free from all activity.

original: Vkn / īdṛśasya bhadantamahāmaudgalyāyana dharmasya kīdṛśī deśanā /
analyzed: īdṛśasya bhadanta mahāmaudgalyāyana dharmasya kīdṛśī deśanā
translated: “Reverend Mahā­maudgalyāyana, what is the teaching of such a Dharma?”

analyzed: dharma deśanā iti bhadanta mahāmaudgalyāyana samāropa padam etat
translated: “Reverend Mahā­maudgalyāyana, ‘teaching the Dharma’ is a term that is superimposed.

analyzed: ye pi śṛṇvanti te pi samāropena eva śṛṇvanti
translated: Those who listen to it also listen to it through superimposition.

original: yatra bhadantamaudgalyāyana asamāropapadaṃ na tatra deśyate na śrūyate na vijñāyate /
analyzed: yatra bhadanta maudgalyāyana a samāropa padam na tatra deśyate na śrūyate na vijñāyate
translated: Reverend Maudgalyāyana, where there is no term of superimposition, there is no teaching, no listening, and no understanding.”

analyzed: tat yathā māyā puruṣaḥ māyā puruṣebhyaḥ dharmam deśayati
translated: “It is just as a man of illusion teaches the Dharma to men of illusion.”

original: Vkn / evaṃ hi cittāvasthānena dharmo deśayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: evam hi citta avasthānena dharmaḥ deśayitavyaḥ
translated: “Thus, by remaining in such a state of mind, the Dharma should be taught.

analyzed: satva indriya kuśalena ca te bhavitavyam
translated: And you should be skilled in the faculties of sentient beings.

original: sudṛṣṭaprajñādarśanena mahākaruṇāmukhībhūtena mahāyānasaṃvarṇakena buddhekṛtajñena śuddhāśayena dharmaniruktividhijñena /
analyzed: su dṛṣṭa prajñā darśanena mahā karuṇā mukhībhūtena mahāyāna saṃvarṇakena buddhe kṛtajñena śuddha āśayena dharma nirukti vidhi jñena
translated: who has the face of great compassion through the vision of well-seen wisdom, who praises the Great Vehicle, who is grateful to the Buddhas, who has a pure intention, who knows the rules of Dharma expression,

analyzed: tri ratna vaṃśa an upacchedāya ca te dharmaḥ deśayitavyaḥ
translated: and you should teach the Dharma for the sake of not cutting off the lineage of the Three Jewels.

original: Vkn / tena bhagavan tathā tathā dharmo deśito yathā tato gṛhapatiparsado 'ṣṭānāṃ gṛhapatiśatānām anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittāny utpannāni
analyzed: tena bhagavan tathā tathā dharmaḥ deśitaḥ yathā tatas gṛhapati parsadaḥ ṣṭānām gṛhapati śatānām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpannāni
translated: Then, Blessed One, the Dharma was taught in such a way that from that assembly of householders, eight hundred householders gave rise to the mind of unexcelled perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: aham ca niṣpratibhānaḥ bhūvam
translated: and I became speechless.

original: tan nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: tat na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, I am not able to go and inquire about the illness of that good man.

original: Vkn / tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ mahākāśyapam āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam mahākāśyapam āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Mahākāśyapa:

original: gaccha tvaṃ mahākāśyapa vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
analyzed: gaccha tvam mahākāśyapa vimala kīrteḥ licchaveḥ glāna paripṛcchakaḥ
translated: Go, Mahākāśyapa, and inquire about the illness of the Licchavi Vimalakīrti.

analyzed: mahākāśyapaḥ pi āha
translated: Mahākāśyapa replied:

original: nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Blessed One, I am not able to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: And why?

original: abhijānāmy ahaṃ bhagavan daridravīthyāṃ piṇḍāya carāmi /
analyzed: abhijānāmi aham bhagavan daridra vīthyām piṇḍāya carāmi
translated: I remember, Blessed One, when I was going for alms in the street of the poor.

original: tatra māṃ vimalakirtir licchavir upasaṃkramyaivam āha /
analyzed: tatra mām vimalakirtiḥ licchaviḥ upasaṃkramya evam āha
translated: There the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came along and said to me,

analyzed: prādeśikī bhadanta mahākāśyapasya karuṇā maitrī
translated: ‘Reverend Mahākāśyapa, your compassion is partial.

analyzed: yat mahā kulāni utsṛjya daridra kulāni upasaṃkrāmasi
translated: Why is it that, abandoning the great families, you go to the houses of the poor?

original: api tu bhadantamahākāśyapa dharmasamatāpratiṣṭhitena te bhavitavyam /🔽sarvadā sarvasatvasamanvāhāreṇa piṇḍapātaḥ paryeṣṭavyaḥ /🔽anāhāreṇa cāhāraḥ paryeṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: api tu bhadanta mahākāśyapa dharma samatā pratiṣṭhitena te bhavitavyam  sarvadā sarva satva samanvāhāreṇa piṇḍapātaḥ paryeṣṭavyaḥ  anāhāreṇa ca āhāraḥ paryeṣṭavyaḥ
translated: Moreover, reverend Mahākāśyapa, you should be impartial, for you are a son of the Śākya clan, who have gone forth from the home life.🔽You should seek alms with the thought of universal equality,🔽and you should seek alms without discriminating “This one will give; that one will not.”

original: parapiṇḍagrāhāpanayāya ca te piṇḍāya caritavyam /🔽śūnyagrāmādhiṣṭhitena ca grāmaḥ praveṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: para piṇḍa grāha apanayāya ca te piṇḍāya caritavyam  śūnya grāma dhiṣṭhitena ca grāmaḥ praveṣṭavyaḥ
translated: You should go for alms without taking offense at anyone.🔽You should enter the village for alms as if you were entering an empty house.

original: naranārīparipākāya ca te nagaraṃ praveṣṭavyam /🔽buddhakulakulīnena ca te kulāny upasaṃkramitavyāni /
analyzed: nara nārī paripākāya ca te nagaram praveṣṭavyam  buddha kula kulīnena ca te kulāni upasaṃkramitavyāni
translated: You should enter the city for alms as if you were taming an untamed elephant.🔽You should go to the houses for alms as if you were a great merchant going to the treasure island.

analyzed: a pratigrahaṇa tayā ca piṇḍapātaḥ pratigrāhyaḥ
translated: You should receive alms without accepting or rejecting anything.

analyzed: jāti andha sama tayā ca rūpāṇi draṣṭavyāni
translated: You should see forms as if they were a reflection of the moon in water.

analyzed: pratiśrutaka upama tayā ca śabdāḥ śrotavyāḥ
translated: And sounds should be heard with the patience of one who has been insulted.

original: vātasamatayā ca gandhā ghrātavyāḥ /🔽avijñaptito rasā āsvādayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: vāta sama tayā ca gandhāḥ ghrātavyāḥ  avijñaptitaḥ rasāḥ āsvādayitavyāḥ
translated: Smells should be smelled with the patience of one who is like the wind.🔽Tastes should be tasted with the patience of one who is not aware of them.

analyzed: jñāna asparśana tayā ca sparśāḥ spraṣṭavyāḥ
translated: Tangibles should be touched with the patience of one who is not aware of them.

analyzed: māyā puruṣa vijñāptyā ca dharmāḥ vijñātavyāḥ
translated: And dharmas should be known with the knowledge of a magical man.

analyzed: para bhāvaḥ ca tat an ujjvalitam
translated: That which has no intrinsic nature and no other nature is not burning.

analyzed: yat anujjvalitam tat na śāmyati
translated: That which is not burning does not go out.

original: Vkn / yadi sthaviro mahākāśyapo 'ṣṭau ca mithyātvāni samatikrāmet /
analyzed: yadi sthaviraḥ mahākāśyapaḥ ṣṭau ca mithyātvāni samatikrāmet
translated: If the Elder Mahākāśyapa were to transcend the eight wrongnesses

analyzed: aṣṭau ca vimokṣān samāpadyeta
translated: and enter the eight liberations,

analyzed: mithyāsamatayā ca samyaktva samatām avataret
translated: and by the equality of wrongness enter the equality of rightness,

analyzed: ekena ca piṇḍapātena sarva satvān pratipādayet
translated: and with a single alms-food satisfy all sentient beings,

original: sarvabuddhān sarvāryāṃś ca pratipādya paścād ātmanā paribhuñjīta /
analyzed: sarva buddhān sarva āryān ca pratipādya paścāt ātmanā paribhuñjīta
translated: having satisfied all the Buddhas and all the noble ones, then afterwards he himself would eat.

original: tathā ca paribhuñjīta yathā na saṃkleśo na vigatakleśaḥ /🔽paribhuñjīta na samāhito na vyutthitaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca paribhuñjīta yathā na saṃkleśaḥ na vigata kleśaḥ  paribhuñjīta na samāhitaḥ na vyutthitaḥ
translated: He should eat in such a way that he is neither defiled nor free from defilement.🔽He should eat neither in a state of concentration nor in a state of distraction.

analyzed: na saṃsāra sthitaḥ na nirvāṇa sthitaḥ paribhuñjīta
translated: He should eat neither in a state of worldly existence nor in a state of nirvāṇa.

original: ye ca bhadantāya piṇḍapātaṃ dadati te teṣāṃ nālpaphalaṃ na mahāphalaiḥ bhavet /
analyzed: ye ca bhadantāya piṇḍapātam dadati te teṣām na alpa phalam na mahā phalaiḥ bhavet
translated: And those who give alms-food to the Venerable One, for them it will not be of little fruit, not of great fruit.

original: na ca hānāya na viśeṣāya gacchet /
analyzed: na ca hānāya na viśeṣāya gacchet
translated: It will not lead to loss, nor to distinction.

analyzed: buddha gati samavasaraṇāya ca bhaveta na śrāvaka gati samavasaraṇāya
translated: It will lead to entering the Buddha's way, not to entering the way of the disciples.

analyzed: evam sthaviraḥ mahākāśyapaḥ mogham rāṣṭra piṇḍam paribhuñjīta
translated: Thus, Elder Mahakasyapa, you should enjoy the country's alms without fail.

original: Vkn / so 'haṃ bhagavan imaṃ dharmanirdeśaṃ śrutvāścaryaprāptaḥ sarvabodhisatvān namasyāmi /
analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavan imam dharma nirdeśam śrutvā āścarya prāptaḥ sarva bodhisatvān namasyāmi
translated: Then, Blessed One, having heard this teaching of the Dharma, I am amazed and pay homage to all the Bodhisattvas.

analyzed: gṛhiṇaḥ nāma evaṃrūpam pratibhānam
translated: Even householders have such eloquence.

analyzed: kaḥ nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam na utpādayet
translated: Who would not arouse the mind for supreme perfect enlightenment?

original: tataḥ prabhṛti me na kaścit satvaḥ śrāvakayāne pratyekabuddhayāne vā samādāpitapūrvo 'nyatra mahāyānāt /
analyzed: tatas prabhṛti me na kaścid satvaḥ śrāvaka yāne pratyekabuddha yāne vā samādāpita pūrvaḥ nyatra mahāyānāt
translated: From that time on, I have never before inspired any being to the vehicle of the disciples, to the vehicle of the Solitary Buddhas, but only to the Great Vehicle.

original: tan nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya kulaputrasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: tat na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya kula putrasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, I am not able to go to that noble son to inquire about his illness.

original: Vkn / tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the Venerable Subhuti:

original: gaccha tvaṃ subhūte vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
analyzed: gaccha tvam subhūte vimala kīrteḥ licchaveḥ glāna paripṛcchakaḥ
translated: Go, Subhūti, to inquire about the illness of the Licchavi Vimalakīrti.

analyzed: subhūtiḥ api āha
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.
