analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ  abhijānāmi aham bhagavan
translated: And why?🔽Lord, I remember one day when I had gone to beg my food at the house of the Licchavi Vimalakīrti in the great city of Vaiśālī,

original: ekasmin samaye vaiśālyāṃ mahānagaryāṃ piṇḍāya carāmi /
analyzed: ekasmin samaye vaiśālyām mahā nagaryām piṇḍāya carāmi
translated: and he took my bowl and filled it with some excellent food and said to me,🔽‘Reverend Subhūti, take this food if you understand the sameness of all things through the sameness of material objects,🔽if you understand the sameness of all things through the sameness of sensation, of perception, of mental formations, and of consciousness.🔽Take this food if you are free from attachment to material objects,

analyzed: vimalakīrteḥ licchaveḥ niveśanam piṇḍāya praviṣṭaḥ
translated: if you are free from attachment to sensation, perception, mental formations, and consciousness.🔽Take this food if you are free from attachment to the passions,🔽if you are free from attachment to the abandonment of the passions,🔽if you are free from attachment to ignorance,

original: tasya me vimalakīrtir licchaviḥ pātraṃ gṛhītvā praṇītena bhojanena pratipūryaivam āha /
analyzed: tasya me vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ pātram gṛhītvā praṇītena bhojanena pratipūrya evam āha
translated: if you are free from attachment to knowledge,🔽if you are free from attachment to the world of the senses,🔽if you are free from attachment to the world of form,🔽if you are free from attachment to the formless world,🔽if you are free from attachment to the unconditioned,🔽if you are free from attachment to the conditioned,

original: Vkn / sacet tvaṃ bhadantasubhūte āmiṣasamatayā sarvadharmasamatām anugataḥ sarvadharmasamatayā ca buddhadharmasamatām anugata eva /🔽tvam imaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ pratigṛhnīṣva /🔽sacet tvaṃ bhadantasubhūte na rāgadoṣamohaprahīṇo na ca taiḥ sārdhaṃ saṃvasasi /
analyzed: saced tvam bhadanta subhūte āmiṣa samatayā sarva dharma samatām anugataḥ sarva dharma samatayā ca buddha dharma samatām anugataḥ eva  tvam imam piṇḍapātam pratigṛhnīṣva  saced tvam bhadanta subhūte na rāga doṣa moha prahīṇaḥ na ca taiḥ sārdham saṃvasasi
translated: if you are free from attachment to the fruits of the holy ones,🔽if you are free from attachment to the unfixed,🔽if you are free from attachment to the fixed,🔽if you are free from attachment to the vehicle of the disciples,

original: saced evam asy avikopya satkāyam ekāyanaṃ mārgam anugataḥ /
analyzed: saced evam asi a vikopya sat kāyam ekāyanam mārgam anugataḥ
translated: if you are free from attachment to the vehicle of the solitary sages,🔽if you are free from attachment to the Great Vehicle,🔽if you are free from attachment to the unattached,🔽if you are free from attachment to the attached,🔽if you are free from attachment to the conditioned and the unconditioned,🔽if you are free from attachment to the past,🔽if you are free from attachment to the future,🔽if you are free from attachment to the present,🔽if you are free from attachment to the three times,🔽if you are free from attachment to the uncreated,🔽if you are free from attachment to the created,🔽if you are free from attachment to the internal,🔽if you are free from

original: na ca te 'vidyā bhavatṛṣṇā ca samudghātitā na ca vidyāvimuktī utpādite /
analyzed: na ca te vidyā bhava tṛṣṇā ca samudghātitā na ca vidyā vimuktī utpādite
translated: And you have not destroyed ignorance and craving for existence, nor have you produced knowledge and liberation.

analyzed: ānantarya samatayā ca te samādhi vimuktiḥ
translated: And your concentration and liberation are the same as those of the Buddhas.

analyzed: na ca asi muktaḥ na baddhaḥ
translated: And you are neither liberated nor bound.

original: na ca te catvāry āryasatyāni dṛṣṭāni na ca na dṛṣṭasatyaḥ /
analyzed: na ca te catvāri ārya satyāni dṛṣṭāni na ca na dṛṣṭa satyaḥ
translated: And you have not seen the four noble truths, nor are you one who has not seen the truths.

analyzed: na prāpta phalaḥ na pṛthagjana samavasaraṇaḥ
translated: You are not one who has attained the fruits, nor are you included among ordinary people.

analyzed: na ca asi āryaḥ na anāryaḥ
translated: You are neither a noble one nor not a noble one.

analyzed: na sarva dharma samanvāgataḥ ca sarva dharma samadhigataḥ ca
translated: You are neither endowed with all dharmas nor have you attained all dharmas.

original: Vkn / na ca te śāstā dṛṣṭo na dharmaḥ śruto na saṃghaḥ paryupāsitaḥ /
analyzed: na ca te śāstā dṛṣṭaḥ na dharmaḥ śrutaḥ na saṃghaḥ paryupāsitaḥ
translated: You have not seen the Teacher, nor have you heard the Dharma, nor have you attended on the Saṅgha.

original: ye ca te ṣaṭ śāstāras tadyathā pūraṇaḥ kāśyapaḥ /
analyzed: ye ca te ṣaṭ śāstāraḥ tat yathā pūraṇaḥ kāśyapaḥ
translated: And those six teachers, namely Pūraṇa Kāśyapa,
Maskarin Gośālīputra,

analyzed: saṃjayaḥ vairāṣṭrika putraḥ
translated: Saṃjaya Vairaṭṭīputra,

analyzed: kakudaḥ kātyāyanaḥ
translated: Kakuda Kātyāyana,

analyzed: ajitaḥ keśa kambalaḥ
translated: Ajita Keśakambala,

analyzed: nirgranthaḥ jñāti putraḥ
translated: and Nirgrantha Jñātiputra,

original: te ca bhadantasya śāstāras tāṃś ca niśritya pravrajito yadgāminas te ṣaṭ śāstāras tadgāmy evāryasubhūtiḥ /
analyzed: te ca bhadantasya śāstāraḥ tān ca niśritya pravrajitaḥ yad gāminaḥ te ṣaṭ śāstāraḥ tad gāmī eva ārya subhūtiḥ
translated: those teachers of yours, relying on whom you went forth, the noble Subhūti goes to the same place as those six teachers.

original: Vkn / sarvadṛṣṭigateṣu cāryaman antargato na cāntamadhyaprāptaḥ /
analyzed: sarva dṛṣṭi gateṣu ca aryaman antargataḥ na ca anta madhya prāptaḥ
translated: You are within all the views, yet you have not attained an end or a middle.

original: aṣṭākṣaṇasamavasaraṇaś cāsi na cāsi lakṣaṇam anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭa akṣaṇa samavasaraṇaḥ ca asi na ca asi lakṣaṇam anuprāptaḥ
translated: You are included in the eight inopportune situations, yet you have not attained the marks.

analyzed: saṃkleśena ca asi samaḥ vyavadānam adhigataḥ
translated: You are equal to affliction, yet you have attained non-purification.

original: yā ca sarvasatvānām araṇā sā bhadantasyāpy araṇā /
analyzed: yā ca sarva satvānām araṇā sā bhadantasya api araṇā
translated: And the harmlessness towards all beings, that is also harmlessness towards you, Venerable One.

analyzed: na ca tvayā dakṣiṇā viśodhyate
translated: And you do not purify the offerings.

original: ye ca bhadantāya piṇḍapātaṃ dadati tāṃś ca vinipātayasi /
analyzed: ye ca bhadantāya piṇḍapātam dadati tān ca vinipātayasi
translated: Those who give almsfood to you, Venerable One, you cause them to fall.

original: sarvamāraiś ca te sārdham ekahastaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: sarva māraiḥ ca te sārdham eka hastaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: You have made common cause with all Māras.

analyzed: sarva kleśāḥ ca te sahāyāḥ
translated: And all afflictions are your companions.

analyzed: yad svabhāvāḥ ca kleśāḥ tad svabhāvaḥ bhadantaḥ
translated: And whatever is the nature of the afflictions, that is the nature of the Venerable One.

original: sarvasatveṣu te vadhakacittaṃ pratyupasthitam /🔽sarvabuddhāś ca te 'bhyākhyātāḥ /
analyzed: sarva satveṣu te vadhaka cittam pratyupasthitam  sarva buddhāḥ ca te bhyākhyātāḥ
translated: You have a mind of killing towards all beings.🔽And you have reviled all the Buddhas.

analyzed: sarva buddha dharmān ca pratikrośasi
translated: And you have spoken against all the teachings of the Buddhas.

analyzed: na ca asi saṃgha pratisaraṇaḥ
translated: And you are not a refuge for the Saṅgha.

analyzed: na ca jātu parinirvāsyasi
translated: And you will never attain final nirvāṇa.

analyzed: evam tvam imam piṇḍapātam pratigṛhīṇa
translated: Thus you should accept this almsfood.

original: Vkn / tasya me bhagavan imaṃ dharmanirdeśaṃ śrutvāndhakāraprāptā diśo 'bhūvan ḥ tat kim asmai nirdiśāmi /
analyzed: tasya me bhagavan imam dharma nirdeśam śrutvā andhakāra prāptāḥ diśaḥ bhūvan tat kim asmai nirdiśāmi
translated: When I heard this teaching of the Dharma from the Blessed One, I became like one who has fallen into a dark pit: What shall I teach him?

analyzed: katham vā pratipadye iti
translated: Or how shall I proceed?

original: so 'haṃ tat pātram utsṛjya tato gṛhān niṣkramiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: saḥ ham tat pātram utsṛjya tatas gṛhāt niṣkramiṣyāmi iti
translated: And I thought, 'I will throw away this bowl and leave the house.'

analyzed: vimalakīrtiḥ mām evam āha
translated: Then Vimalakīrti came to me and said,

analyzed: mā bhadanta subhūte akṣarebhyaḥ uttrasīḥ
translated: Reverend Subhūti, do not be afraid of these words.

analyzed: pratigṛhāṇa idam pātram
translated: Take this bowl.

analyzed: tat kim manyase bhadanta subhūte
translated: What do you think, reverend Subhūti?

original: yadi tathāgatanirmita evam ucyeta kaccit sa uttraset /
analyzed: yadi tathāgata nirmitaḥ evam ucyeta kaccit saḥ uttraset
translated: If the Tathāgata were to say to a magically created monk, 'Son of good family, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness,' would that magically created monk be afraid?

analyzed: saḥ ham avocam
translated: I replied,

analyzed: no hi idam kula putra
translated: No, noble sir.

analyzed: sa mām evam āha
translated: He continued,

analyzed: nirmita māyā svabhāvebhyaḥ bhadanta subhūte sarva dharmebhyaḥ na uttrasitavyam
translated: Reverend Subhūti, one should not be afraid of words.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sarvāṇi hi tāni vacanāni tad svabhāvāni
translated: All those words are of the nature of magical creations.

original: evaṃ paṇḍitā akṣareṣu na sajjanti na tebhya uttrasyanti /
analyzed: evam paṇḍitāḥ akṣareṣu na sajjanti na tebhyaḥ uttrasyanti
translated: Thus the wise do not cling to words and are not afraid of them.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sarvāṇi tāny akṣarāṇy anakṣarāṇi sthāpayitvā vimuktiṃ vimuktilakṣaṇāṃś ca sarvadharmān /
analyzed: sarvāṇi tāni akṣarāṇi anakṣarāṇi sthāpayitvā vimuktim vimukti lakṣaṇān ca sarva dharmān
translated: All those letters are without letters, except for liberation and the characteristics of liberation of all dharmas.

original: Vkn / iha nirdeśe nirdiśyamāne dvayor devaputraśatayor virajo vigatamalaṃ dharmeṣu dharmacakṣur viśuddham /
analyzed: iha nirdeśe nirdiśyamāne dvayoḥ deva putra śatayoḥ virajaḥ vigata malam dharmeṣu dharma cakṣuḥ viśuddham
translated: When this instruction was being taught, the Dharma eye of dust-free, stainless vision in regard to phenomena arose in two hundred gods and goddesses,

original: pañcānāṃ ca devaputraśatānām ānulomikyāḥ kṣānteḥ pratilambho 'bhūt /
analyzed: pañcānām ca devaputra śatānām ānulomikyāḥ kṣānteḥ pratilambhaḥ bhūt
translated: and five hundred gods and goddesses attained the acceptance of phenomena that accord with the Dharma.

analyzed: aham ca niṣpratibhānaḥ bhūvam
translated: And I became speechless.

original: na cāsya śaknomy uttare prativacanaṃ dātum /
analyzed: na ca asya śaknomi uttare prativacanam dātum
translated: And I was not able to give a reply to him.

original: tan nāham utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: tat na aham utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Therefore, I am not eager to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

original: Vkn / atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ pūrṇaṃ maitrāyaṇīputram āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam pūrṇam maitrāyaṇīputram āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra:

original: gaccha tvaṃ pūrṇa vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
analyzed: gaccha tvam pūrṇa vimala kīrteḥ licchaveḥ glāna paripṛcchakaḥ
translated: Pūrṇa, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.

analyzed: pūrṇaḥ pi āha
translated: Pūrṇa replied:

original: nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Blessed One, I am indeed not eager to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: And why?

analyzed: abhijānāmi aham bhagavan
translated: Blessed One, I remember that one day,

original: ekasmin samaye vanasyānyatamasmin pṛthivīpradeśa ādikarmikāṇāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ dharmaṃ deśayāmi /
analyzed: ekasmin samaye vanasya anyatamasmin pṛthivī pradeśe ādi karmikāṇām bhikṣūṇām dharmam deśayāmi
translated: At one time, in a certain forest region, I was teaching the Dharma to the beginner monks.

original: tatra vimalakīrtir licchavir upasaṃkramya mām evam āha /
analyzed: tatra vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ upasaṃkramya mām evam āha
translated: There the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came to me, saluted me, and said,

original: Vkn / samāpadya bhadantapūrṇa eteṣāṃ bhikṣūṇāṃ cittaṃ vyavalokya dharmaṃ deśaya /
analyzed: samāpadya bhadanta pūrṇa eteṣām bhikṣūṇām cittam vyavalokya dharmam deśaya
translated: ‘Reverend Pūrṇa, before you expounded the Dharma to these monks, you should have subdued their minds with the samādhi of the holy Dharma.

analyzed: mā mahā ratna bhājaneṣu prati kulmāṣān prākṣaipsīḥ
translated: Do not pour the contents of a water jar into a crack in the wall!

original: jāniṣva tāvat kimāśayā ete bhikṣava iti /
analyzed: jāniṣva tāvat kimāśayāḥ ete bhikṣavaḥ iti
translated: First find out what these monks are thinking of, what their inclinations are, and what their propensities are.

analyzed: mā vaiḍūrya ratnam kācamaṇikaiḥ samānīkārṣīḥ
translated: Do not compare the beryl to glass!

original: mā bhadantapūrṇa apratyavekṣyā satvendriyeṣu prādeśikendriyatvam upasaṃhārṣīḥ /
analyzed: mā bhadanta pūrṇa a pratyavekṣyā satva indriyeṣu prādeśika indriya tvam upasaṃhārṣīḥ
translated: Reverend Pūrṇa, do not apply the universal medicine indiscriminately, without taking into account the illnesses of the patients.

original: mā akṣatāṃ kṣiṇuṣva /🔽mā mahāmārgam avatartukāmān bhandarathyāṃ praveśaya /
analyzed: mā akṣatām kṣiṇuṣva  mā mahā mārgam avatartu kāmān bhanda rathyām praveśaya
translated: Do not destroy what little faith they have!

analyzed: mā mahā sāgaram goṣpade praveśaya
translated: Do not lead those who wish to enter the great ocean of the bodhisattva vehicle to enter the well of a śrāvaka!🔽Do not lead those who wish to drink the water of the ocean of the bodhisattva vehicle to drink the water of the puddle of the śrāvakas!

analyzed: mā sūrya prabhām khadyotakaiḥ nirvartaya
translated: Do not compare the light of the sun to the light of a glowworm!

analyzed: mā siṃhanāda saṃprasthitān sṛgāla nāde niyojaya
translated: Do not make those who have set out on the lion-path enter the jackal-path!

original: api bhadantapūrṇa sarve hy ete bhikṣavo mahāyānasaṃprasthitā amuṣitabodhicittāḥ /
analyzed: api bhadanta pūrṇa sarve hi ete bhikṣavaḥ mahāyāna saṃprasthitāḥ a muṣita bodhi cittāḥ
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, are all these monks who have set out in the Great Vehicle, but have not yet given rise to the thought of awakening?

analyzed: teṣām bhadanta pūrṇa mā śrāvaka yānam upadarśaya
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa, do not teach them the Śrāvakayāna.

analyzed: kaṣṭam hi śrāvaka yānam
translated: For the Śrāvakayāna is difficult.

original: jātyandhā iva me śrāvakāḥ pratibhānti satvendriyavimātratājñāne /
analyzed: jāti andhāḥ iva me śrāvakāḥ pratibhānti satva indriya vimātra tā jñāne
translated: My disciples seem to be blind from birth in knowing the differences in the faculties of sentient beings.

original: Vkn / atha vimalakīrtir licchavis tasyāṃ velāyāṃ tathārūpaṃ samādhiṃ samāpadyate sma /
analyzed: atha vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ tasyām velāyām tathārūpam samādhim samāpadyate sma
translated: Then the Licchavi Vimalakīrti entered into a concentration, and performed a miraculous feat such that those monks saw all the hells,

original: yathā te bhikṣavo 'nekavidhaṃ pūrvenivāsam anusmaraṇti sma /
analyzed: yathā te bhikṣavaḥ na ekavidham pūrvenivāsam anusmaranti sma
translated: and they remembered the many kinds of former lives in which they had been born as animals.

analyzed: te pañca buddha śata paryupāsita kuśala mūlāḥ samyaksaṃbodhaye
translated: They had planted wholesome roots by serving five hundred Buddhas in the past, and had attained the patient acceptance of the fact that dharmas are not produced.

analyzed: teṣām tat bodhi cittam āmukhībhūtam
translated: They had turned toward the supreme, perfect enlightenment.

original: te tasya satpuruṣasya pādau śirobhiḥ praṇamya tatraiva niṣaṇṇāḥ prāñjalayo bhūtvā /
analyzed: te tasya sat puruṣasya pādau śirobhiḥ praṇamya tatra eva niṣaṇṇāḥ prāñjalayaḥ bhūtvā
translated: They bowed their heads at the feet of that good man, and sat down to one side.🔽He gave them such a Dharma teaching that they all attained the patient acceptance of the fact that dharmas are not produced.

original: teṣāṃ tādṛśī dharmadeśanā kṛtā yathāvaivartikāḥ saṃvṛttā anuttarasyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: teṣām tādṛśī dharma deśanā kṛtā yathā vaivartikāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ anuttarasyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: They all turned toward the supreme, perfect enlightenment.

original: Vkn / tan nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: tat na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: “Therefore, Blessed One, I am reluctant to go and ask that good man about his illness.”

original: Vkn / tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ kātyāyanam āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam kātyāyanam āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Mahākātyāyana,

original: gaccha tvaṃ kātyāyana vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /🔽kātyāyano 'py āha /
analyzed: gaccha tvam kātyāyana vimala kīrteḥ licchaveḥ glāna paripṛcchakaḥ  kātyāyanaḥ pi āha
translated: “Kātyāyana, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

original: nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Kātyāyana replied, “Blessed One, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: And why?

original: abhijānāmy ahaṃ bhagavan /🔽bhagavatā saṃkṣiptena bhikṣūṇām avavādo dattaḥ /
analyzed: abhijānāmi aham bhagavan  bhagavatā saṃkṣiptena bhikṣūṇām avavādaḥ dattaḥ
translated: Blessed One, I remember that one day,

analyzed: teṣām sūtra pada viniścayāya dharmam deśayāmi
translated: when I was teaching the Dharma to the assembly of many hundreds of monks in brief and in detail,🔽the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came there and said to me, ‘Reverend Mahākātyāyana, do not teach the Dharma of the disciples in brief and in detail to the bodhisattvas.🔽The bodhisattvas should be taught the Dharma in terms of the ultimate.

original: yad idam anityārthaṃ duḥkhārtham anātmārthaṃ śāntārtham /
analyzed: yat idam anitya artham duḥkha artham anātma artham śānta artham
translated: What is called the “Dharma of the disciples” is impermanent, painful, empty, and insubstantial.🔽What is called “impermanent” is the arising of the mind.🔽What is called “painful” is the cessation of the mind.

original: tatra vimalakīrtir licchavir upasaṃkramya mām evam āha /
analyzed: tatra vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ upasaṃkramya mām evam āha
translated: What is called “empty” is the mind that is subject to cessation.

original: Vkn / mā bhadantakātyāyana sapracārām utpādabhaṅgayuktāṃ dharmatāṃ nirdiśa /
analyzed: mā bhadanta kātyāyana sa pracārām utpāda bhaṅga yuktām dharmatām nirdiśa
translated: What is called “insubstantial” is the mind that is not to be grasped.

original: yo bhadantamahākātyāyana atyantatayā na jāto na janiṣyati notpanno na niruddho na nirotsyate 'yam anityārthaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ bhadanta mahākātyāyana atyanta tayā na jātaḥ na janiṣyati nā utpannaḥ na niruddhaḥ na nirotsyate yam anitya arthaḥ
translated: “Reverend Mahakatyayayana, he who is absolutely unborn, will not be born, has not been born, has not arisen, has not ceased, and will not cease—this is the meaning of impermanence.

original: yaḥ pañcānāṃ skandhānāṃ śūnyatānugamānutpādānirodhārtho 'yaṃ duḥkhārthaḥ /🔽yad ātmānātmayor advayatvam ayam anātmārthaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ pañcānām skandhānām śūnyatā anugama anutpāda anirodha arthaḥ yam duḥkha arthaḥ  yat ātma anātmayoḥ advaya tvam ayam anātma arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of suffering is the meaning of the non-arising and non-ceasing of the five aggregates, which is realized through the emptiness of the five aggregates.🔽The meaning of non-self is the non-duality of self and non-self.

analyzed: yaḥ para bhāvaḥ tat an ujjvalitam
translated: That which has no intrinsic nature has no other nature. That is uninflamed.

analyzed: yat anujvalitam na tat śāmyati
translated: That which is uninflamed does not cease.

analyzed: tyanta upaśamaḥ yam śānta arthaḥ
translated: That which is absolute peace is the meaning of peace.

original: Vkn / asmin khalu punar nirdeśe nirdiśyamāne teṣāṃ bhikṣūṇām anupādāyāsravebhyaś cittāni vimuktāni /
analyzed: asmin khalu punar nirdeśe nirdiśyamāne teṣām bhikṣūṇām an upādāya āsravebhyaḥ cittāni vimuktāni
translated: When this teaching was being taught, the minds of those monks were liberated from contaminations without further appropriation.

original: tan nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: tat na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, I am not able to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.”

original: Vkn / tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam aniruddham āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam aniruddham āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Aniruddha,

original: gaccha tvam aniruddha vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /
analyzed: gaccha tvam aniruddha vimala kīrteḥ licchaveḥ glāna paripṛcchakaḥ
translated: “Aniruddha, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

analyzed: aniruddhaḥ pi āha
translated: Aniruddha replied,🔽“Blessed One, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

original: nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: “Lord, I am not able to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: abhijānāmi aham bhagavan
translated: “Lord, I remember that once,

analyzed: anyatamasmin caṅkrame caṅkramāmi
translated: when I was walking in a certain place,🔽there appeared a Brahmā named Śubhavyūha with ten thousand other Brahmas.

original: tatra śubhavyūho nāma brahmā daśabhir brahmasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ taṃ pradeśam avabhāsya yenāhaṃ tenopasaṃkramya mama pādau śirasābhivandyaikānte
analyzed: tatra śubhavyūhaḥ nāma brahmā daśabhiḥ brahma sahasraiḥ sārdham tam pradeśam avabhāsya yena aham tena upasaṃkramya mama pādau śirasā abhivandya ekānte
translated: They illuminated the place with their radiance and approached me. They bowed their heads at my feet and then stood to one side.

analyzed: sthitvā mām etat avocat
translated: One of them said to me,

original: kiyad āyuṣmān aniruddho divyena cakṣuṣā paśyati /
analyzed: kiyat āyuṣmān aniruddhaḥ divyena cakṣuṣā paśyati
translated: ‘How far can the Venerable Aniruddha see with his divine eye?’

original: tam enam aham etad avocam /🔽ahaṃ mārṣa imaṃ triṃ sāhasramahāsāhasraṃ lokadhātuṃ bhagavataḥ śākyamuner buddhakṣetraṃ tad yathāpi nāma karatale nyastam āmalakaphalam evaṃ
analyzed: tam enam aham etat avocam  aham mārṣaḥ imam trim sāhasra mahā sāhasram lokadhātum bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ buddhakṣetram tat yathā api nāma kara tale nyastam āmalaka phalam evam
translated: I replied,

original: paśyāmi /🔽Vkn / iyaṃ ca kathā pravṛttā vimalakīrtiś ca licchavis taṃ pradeśam upasaṃkrāmat /
analyzed: paśyāmi  iyam ca kathā pravṛttā vimalakīrtiḥ ca licchaviḥ tam pradeśam upasaṃkrāmat
translated: ‘My friend, I see this billion-world-galactic universe of the Lord Śākyamuni, the Buddha-field, as clearly as a man of ordinary vision sees a myrobalan nut on the palm of his hand.’

original: upasaṃkramya mama pādau śirasā vanditvaivam āha /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya mama pādau śirasā vanditvā evam āha
translated: “When this conversation was taking place, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came there and, having bowed his head at my feet, said to me,🔽‘Reverend Aniruddha, is your divine eye innate, or is it produced by previous action, or is it produced by mental development?’

original: kiṃ bhadantāniruddha divyaṃ cakṣur abhisaṃskāralakṣaṇam utānabhisaṃskāralakṣaṇam /
analyzed: kim bhadanta aniruddha divyam cakṣuḥ abhisaṃskāra lakṣaṇam uta an abhisaṃskāra lakṣaṇam
translated: Venerable Aniruddha, is the divine eye characterized by formation or is it characterized by non-formation?

original: yady abhisaṃskāralakṣaṇaṃ tad bāhyaiḥ pañcābhijñaiḥ samam /
translated: If it is characterized by formation, then it is the same as the five higher knowledges of outsiders.

original: athānabhisaṃskāralakṣaṇaṃ anabhisaṃskāro 'saṃskṛtas tena na śakyaṃ draṣṭum /
analyzed: atha an abhisaṃskāra lakṣaṇam an abhisaṃskāraḥ saṃskṛtaḥ tena na śakyam draṣṭum
translated: If it is characterized by non-formation, then non-formation is unconditioned, and it cannot be seen by that.

analyzed: tat katham sthaviraḥ paśyati
translated: Then how does the Elder see?

analyzed: saḥ ham tūṣṇīm abhūvam
translated: I remained silent.

original: Vkn / sa ca brahmā tasya satpuruṣasyemaṃ nirdeśaṃ śrutvāścaryaprāptas taṃ namaskṛtyaitad avocat /
analyzed: sa ca brahmā tasya sat puruṣasya imam nirdeśam śrutvā āścarya prāptaḥ tam namaskṛtya etat avocat
translated: And that Brahma, having heard this instruction from that good man, became astonished. Having paid homage to him, he said this:

analyzed: ke loke divya cakṣuṣaḥ
translated: Who in the world have the divine eye?

original: āha / buddhā bhagavanto loke divyacakṣuṣo ye samāhitāvasthāṃ ca na vijahati sarvabuddhakṣetrāṇi ca paśyanti /
analyzed: āha buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ loke divya cakṣuṣaḥ ye samāhita avasthām ca na vijahati sarva buddhakṣetrāṇi ca paśyanti
translated: He said, The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in the world have the divine eye, who do not abandon the state of concentration and see all Buddha-fields,

analyzed: na ca dvaya prabhāvitāḥ
translated: but are not manifested by duality.

original: Vkn / atha sa brahmemaṃ nirdeśaṃ śrutvā daśasahasraparivāro 'dhyāśayenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayati sma /
analyzed: atha sa brahmā imam nirdeśam śrutvā daśa sahasra parivāraḥ dhyā āśayena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayati sma
translated: Then that Brahma, having heard this instruction, together with an entourage of ten thousand, generated the mind of unexcelled perfect enlightenment with the highest resolve.

original: sa māṃ vanditvā taṃ ca satpuruṣam abhivādya tatraivāntarhitaḥ /
analyzed: sa mām vanditvā tam ca sat puruṣam abhivādya tatra eva antarhitaḥ
translated: He bowed to me and to that good man, and then disappeared right there.

analyzed: aham ca niṣpratibhānaḥ bhūvam
translated: I, on the other hand, was left speechless.

original: tan nāham utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: tat na aham utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Therefore, I am reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.”

original: Vkn / tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam upālim āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam upālim āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Upāli,

original: gaccha tvam upāle vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /🔽upālir apy āha /
analyzed: gaccha tvam upāle vimala kīrteḥ licchaveḥ glāna paripṛcchakaḥ  upāliḥ api āha
translated: “Upāli, go to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

original: nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Upāli replied, “Blessed One, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: And why?

analyzed: abhijānāmi aham bhagavan
translated: Blessed One, I remember that one day

analyzed: anyatamau dvau bhikṣū āpattim āpannau
translated: two monks who had committed offenses against the major and minor rules of discipline came to me.

analyzed: tau bhagavataḥ paryapatrapamāṇau bhagavantam na upasaṃkrāmataḥ
translated: They were ashamed to appear before the Blessed One,

original: tau yenāhaṃ tenopasaṃkrāntāv upasaṃkrāmya mām etad avocatām /🔽āvāṃ bhadantopāle āpattim āpannau /
analyzed: tau yena aham tena upasaṃkrāntau upasaṃkrāmya mām etat avocatām  āvām bhadanta upāle āpattim āpannau
translated: and so they asked me to absolve them of their offenses.🔽I said to them, ‘Venerable ones, the Blessed One, the Buddha, is our teacher.

original: tāv āvāṃ paryapatrapamāṇau bhagavantam upasaṃkramituṃ notsahāvahe /
analyzed: tau āvām paryapatrapamāṇau bhagavantam upasaṃkramitum na utsahāvahe
translated: We should go to him for refuge.

original: utsāhāya āyuṣmann upāle vinodayasvāvayoḥ kaukṛtyaṃ vyutthāpayasvāvām āpatteḥ /
analyzed: utsāhāya āyuṣman upāle vinodayasva āvayoḥ kaukṛtyam vyutthāpayasva āvām āpatteḥ
translated: Help us, Venerable Upāli! Clear away our remorse and lift us out of our downfall.

original: Vkn / so 'haṃ bhagavaṃs tau bhikṣū dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayāmi /🔽vimalakīrtiś ca licchavis taṃ pradeśam anuprāptaḥ sa mām etad avocat /
analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavan tau bhikṣū dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayāmi  vimalakīrtiḥ ca licchaviḥ tam pradeśam anuprāptaḥ sa mām etat avocat
translated: I said to them, Venerable ones, I will show you the Dharma.

original: mā bhadantopāle etau bhikṣū āgāḍhīkārṣīḥ /🔽vinodayānayor āpattim /
analyzed: mā bhadanta upāle etau bhikṣū āgāḍhīkārṣīḥ  vinodaya anayoḥ āpattim
translated: Then the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came there and, having bowed my head to his feet, said to me, Reverend Upāli, do not aggravate the sicknesses of these two monks.🔽Clear away their downfalls.

analyzed: mā āvilīkārṣīḥ
translated: Do not muddy them.

original: na hi bhadantopāle āpattir adhyātmapratiṣṭhitā na bahirdhāsaṃkrānto nobhayam antareṇopalabhyate /
analyzed: na hi bhadanta upāle āpattiḥ adhyātma pratiṣṭhitā na bahirdhā saṃkrāntaḥ na ubhayam antareṇa upalabhyate
translated: Upāli, a downfall is not something that exists internally, nor does it exist externally, nor does it exist between the two, nor does it exist without cause.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: uktaṃ hi bhagavatā cittasaṃkleśāt satvāḥ saṃkliśyante cittavyavadānād viśudhyante /
analyzed: uktam hi bhagavatā citta saṃkleśāt satvāḥ saṃkliśyante citta vyavadānāt viśudhyante
translated: The Blessed One has said, 'Sentient beings are defiled by mental afflictions and purified by mental purification.'

original: cittaṃ ca bhadantopāle nādhyātmapratiṣṭhitaṃ na bahirdhā nobhayam antareṇopalabhyate /
analyzed: cittam ca bhadanta upāle na adhyātma pratiṣṭhitam na bahirdhā na ubhayam antareṇa upalabhyate
translated: Upāli, the mind does not exist internally, nor does it exist externally, nor does it exist between the two, nor does it exist without cause.

analyzed: yathā cittam tathā āpattiḥ
translated: As is the mind, so is a downfall;

analyzed: yathā āpattiḥ tathā sarva dharmāḥ
translated: as is a downfall, so are all phenomena.

analyzed: tathatām na vyativartante
translated: They do not go beyond suchness.🔽 🔽 Upāli, if you can understand this teaching, then you should go to the sick monks and say to them, 'Venerable friends, the body is like a dream, and so too are feelings, perceptions, mental formations, and consciousness.🔽 Venerable friends, the eye is like a mirage, and so too are sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact.🔽 Venerable friends, the ear is like an echo, and so too are sounds, ear consciousness, and ear contact.🔽 Venerable friends, the nose is like a flower in the sky, and so too are smells, nose consciousness, and nose contact.🔽 Venerable friends, the tongue is like a magical creation, and so too are tastes, tongue consciousness, and tongue contact.🔽 Venerable friends, the body is like a plantain tree, and so too are tactile objects, body consciousness, and body contact.🔽 Venerable friends, the mind is like a magical creation, and so too are mental phenomena, mind consciousness, and mind contact.🔽 Venerable friends, the earth element is like a lump of foam, and so too are the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element.

original: yā bhadantopāle cittasya prakṛtir yayā cittaprakṛtyā bhadantasya cittaṃ vimuktam /
analyzed: yā bhadanta upāle cittasya prakṛtiḥ yayā citta prakṛtyā bhadantasya cittam vimuktam
translated: “Reverend Upāli, whatever is the nature of the mind, by that nature of mind the reverend’s mind is liberated.

analyzed: kim jātu sā citta prakṛtiḥ saṃkliṣṭā
translated: Is that nature of mind ever defiled?”

analyzed: āha naḥ hidam
translated: He replied, “No, indeed not.”

analyzed: āha tad prakṛtikāni bhadanta upāle sarva satvānām cittāni
translated: He said, “Reverend Upāli, the minds of all sentient beings have that nature.

analyzed: saṃkalpaḥ bhadanta upāle kleśaḥ
translated: “Reverend Upāli, conceptual thought is a reactive emotion.

analyzed: akalpa avikalpā ca prakṛtiḥ
translated: The nature of mind is free of conceptual thought and free of discrimination.

analyzed: viparyāsaḥ saṃkleśaḥ
translated: Reversal is a reactive emotion.

analyzed: aviparyastā ca prakṛtiḥ  ātma samāropaḥ saṃkleśaḥ
translated: The nature of mind is free of reversal.🔽The superimposition of a self is a reactive emotion.

analyzed: nairātmyā ca prakṛtiḥ
translated: The nature of mind is free of self.

analyzed: utpanna bhagna anavasthitāḥ bhadanta upāle sarva dharmāḥ māyā megha vidyut sadṛśāḥ
translated: “Reverend Upāli, all things are produced and destroyed, and do not remain as they are. They are like a magical illusion, a cloud, or a flash of lightning.

analyzed: nirapekṣāḥ sarva dharmāḥ kṣaṇam api na avatiṣṭhante
translated: All things are independent, and do not remain even for a moment.

analyzed: svapna marīci sadṛśāḥ sarva dharmāḥ vitatha darśanāḥ
translated: All things are like a dream or a mirage, because they are seen falsely.

original: dakacandrapratibimbasadṛśāḥ sarvadharmāś cittaparikalpenotpadyante /🔽ye tv evaṃ jānanti te vinayadharā ity ucyante /
analyzed: daka candra pratibimba sadṛśāḥ sarva dharmāḥ citta parikalpena utpadyante  ye tu evam jānanti te vinaya dharāḥ iti ucyante
translated: All things are like the reflection of the moon in water or a magical creation, because they are produced by the conceptual thought of the mind.🔽Those who know this are called ‘those who have learned the scriptures.’

analyzed: ye evam vinītāḥ te su vinītāḥ
translated: Those who have learned in this way are well-learned.”

original: Vkn / atha tau bhikṣu etad avocatām /
analyzed: atha tau bhikṣu etat avocatām
translated: Then those two monks said this:

analyzed: prajñā dharaḥ vinaya dharaḥ yam upāsakaḥ
translated: This lay disciple is a master of wisdom and discipline.

original: na tv ayaṃ bhadantopālir yo bhagavatā vinayadharāṇām agro nirdiṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: na tu ayam bhadanta upāliḥ yaḥ bhagavatā vinaya dharāṇām agraḥ nirdiṣṭaḥ
translated: But this Venerable Upāli is not the one who was designated by the Blessed One as the foremost of those who uphold the Vinaya.

analyzed: tau aham evam vadāmi
translated: I say this to them:

analyzed: mā bhikṣū atra gṛhapati saṃjñām utpādayatām
translated: Monks, do not conceive of him as a householder.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathāgataṃ sthāpayitvā nāsti kaścic chrāvako vā bodhisatvo vā /
analyzed: tathāgatam sthāpayitvā na asti kaścid śrāvakaḥ vā bodhisatvaḥ vā
translated: Except for the Tathāgata, there is no disciple or bodhisattva

analyzed: yaḥ etasya pratibhānam ācchindyāt
translated: who could surpass his eloquence.

analyzed: tādṛśaḥ etasya prajñā ālokaḥ
translated: Such is the light of his wisdom.

original: Vkn / atha tau bhikṣū vinītakaukṛtyāv adhyāśayena tatraivānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditavantau /
analyzed: atha tau bhikṣū vinīta kaukṛtyau adhyāśayena tatra eva anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpāditavantau
translated: Then those two monks, having confessed their remorse, generated the intention for supreme and perfect awakening right there with a superior intention.

analyzed: tam ca sat puruṣam abhivandya evam āhatuḥ
translated: And having paid homage to that good man, they said this:

analyzed: sarva satvāḥ īdṛśasya pratibhānasya lābhinaḥ bhavantu
translated: May all beings attain such eloquence.

original: tan nāham utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: tat na aham utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Therefore, I am not capable of going to inquire about the illness of that good man.

original: Vkn / tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ rāhulam āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam rāhulam āmantrayate sma
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the Venerable Rāhula:

original: gaccha tvaṃ rāhula vimalakīrter licchaver glānaparipṛcchakaḥ /🔽rāhulo 'py āha /
analyzed: gaccha tvam rāhula vimala kīrteḥ licchaveḥ glāna paripṛcchakaḥ  rāhulaḥ pi āha
translated: Go, Rāhula, to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti to inquire about his illness.”

original: nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /🔽tat kasmād dhetoḥ /
analyzed: na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum  tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Rāhula replied, “Lord, I am indeed reluctant to go to that good man to inquire about his illness.

analyzed: abhijānāmi aham bhagavan
translated: And why? Lord, I remember one day when the Tathāgata was in the house of Vṛji,

original: ekasmin samaye saṃbahulā licchavikumārakā yenāhaṃ tenopasaṃkramya mām etad avocan /
analyzed: ekasmin samaye saṃbahulāḥ licchavi kumārakāḥ yena aham tena upasaṃkramya mām etat avocan
translated: a number of Licchavi youths, including Vimalakīrti, came to where I was.

original: tvaṃ rāhula tasya bhagavataḥ putraś cakravartirājyam utsṛjya pravrajitaḥ /
analyzed: tvam rāhula tasya bhagavataḥ putraḥ cakravarti rājyam utsṛjya pravrajitaḥ
translated: They said to me, ‘Rāhula, you are the son of the Lord, and you have renounced the kingdom of a universal monarch to enter the religious life.

analyzed: tatra ke te pravrajyāyāḥ guṇa anuśaṃsāḥ
translated: What are the advantages of the religious life that you have entered?’

original: teṣām ahaṃ yathārūpaṃ pravrajyāyā guṇānuśaṃsā nirdiśāmi /🔽vimalakīrtir licchavir yenāhaṃ tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām aham yathārūpam pravrajyāyāḥ guṇa anuśaṃsāḥ nirdiśāmi  vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ yena aham tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: I then explained to them the advantages of the religious life.

original: sa mām abhivandyaitad avocat /🔽Vkn / na bhadantarāhula evaṃ pravrajyāyā guṇānuśaṃsā nirdeṣṭavyā yathā tvaṃ nirdiśasi /
analyzed: sa mām abhivandya etat avocat  na bhadanta rāhula evam pravrajyāyāḥ guṇa anuśaṃsā nirdeṣṭavyā yathā tvam nirdiśasi
translated: Just then, the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came there and, having saluted me, said, ‘Reverend Rāhula, do not present the advantages of the religious life in such a way.🔽The advantages of the religious life are not to be thus presented.’

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: He then said, ‘Reverend Rāhula, the advantages of the religious life are not to be thus presented.

analyzed: nirguṇā niranuśaṃsā hi pravrajyā
translated: The religious life is itself without advantage or disadvantage.

analyzed: yatra bhadanta rāhula saṃskṛta pravṛttiḥ tatra guṇa anuśaṃsā
translated: Venerable Rāhula, where there is engagement in the conditioned, there are qualities and benefits.

analyzed: pravrajyā ca a saṃskṛtā
translated: But going forth is unconditioned.

analyzed: a saṃskṛte ca na guṇāḥ na anuśāṃsā
translated: And in the unconditioned there are no qualities or benefits.

analyzed: pravrajyā bhadanta rāhula arūpiṇi rūpa vigatā
translated: Venerable Rāhula, going forth is formless, free from form.

analyzed: panthāḥ nirvāṇasya  praśaṃsitā paṇḍitaiḥ
translated: It is the path to nirvāṇa.🔽It is praised by the wise.

analyzed: parigṛhītā āryaiḥ
translated: It is embraced by the noble ones.

analyzed: parājayaḥ sarva mārāṇām
translated: It is the defeat of all māras.

analyzed: pañca gatī uttāraṇī              pañca bala pratilambhā
translated: It delivers from the five destinies.🔽It purifies the five eyes.🔽It is the attainment of the five powers.

analyzed: pañca indriya pratiṣṭhā
translated: It is the foundation of the five faculties.

analyzed: pareṣām anupaghātaḥ
translated: It is not harming others.

analyzed: pāpa dharmā a saṃsṛṣṭā
translated: It is not mixed with evil dharmas.🔽It crushes the non-Buddhist tīrthikas.

analyzed: prajñapti samatikrāntā
translated: It transcends designations.

analyzed: paṅke saṃkramaḥ
translated: It is a bridge across the mire.

analyzed: amamā mamakāra vigatā  a parigrahā  an upādānā
translated: It is without possessions, free from the notion of 'mine'.🔽It is without grasping.🔽It is without clinging.

analyzed: an ākulā
translated: It is free from agitation.

analyzed: ākula prahīṇā
translated: It is free from disturbance.
It shows one's own mind and protects the minds of others.

analyzed: śamatha anukūlā
translated: It is favorable to tranquility.

analyzed: sarvatas navadyā
translated: It is irreproachable in every way.

analyzed: iyam ucyate pravrajyā
translated: This is called going forth.

analyzed: ye evam pravrajitāḥ te su pravrajitāḥ
translated: Those who go forth in this way, they have gone forth well.

original: Vkn / pravrajata yūyaṃ kumārakāḥ svākhyāte dharmavinaye /
analyzed: pravrajata yūyam kumārakāḥ su ākhyāte dharma vinaye
translated: Go forth, young men, in this well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

analyzed: durlabhaḥ hi buddha utpādaḥ
translated: For the appearance of a Buddha is rare.

analyzed: durlabhā kṣaṇa saṃpad
translated: The perfection of a moment is rare.

analyzed: durlabhaḥ manuṣya pratilambhaḥ
translated: The attainment of human birth is rare.

original: te kumārakā evam āhuḥ /🔽śrutam asmābhir gṛhapate /
analyzed: te kumārakāḥ evam āhuḥ  śrutam asmābhiḥ gṛhapate
translated: Those young men said,

analyzed: sa tān āha utpādayata yūyam kumārakāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam
translated: He said to them, Young men, generate the mind of unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: pratipattyā ca saṃpādayata
translated: And accomplish it through practice.

analyzed: sā eva yuṣmākam bhaviṣyati pravrajyā sa upasaṃpad
translated: That itself will be your going forth and higher ordination.

original: Vkn / tatra dvātriṃśatā licchavikumārair anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittāny utpāditāni /
analyzed: tatra dvātriṃśatā licchavi kumāraiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpāditāni
translated: There, thirty-two Licchavi youths generated the mind of unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

original: tan nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: tat na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, I am not confident to go and inquire about the illness of that good man.

original: Vkn / tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma
translated: There, the Blessed One addressed the venerable Ananda:

analyzed: gaccha tvam ānanda vimala kīrteḥ licchaveḥ glāna paripṛcchakaḥ
translated: Go, Ananda, and inquire about the illness of the Licchavi Vimalakirti.

original: ānanda āha / nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Ananda said, Blessed One, I am not confident to go and inquire about the illness of that good man.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: abhijānāmi aham bhagavan
translated: I remember, Blessed One,

original: ekasmin samaye bhagavataḥ kāyasya kaścid evābādhaḥ /
analyzed: ekasmin samaye bhagavataḥ kāyasya kaścid eva ābādhaḥ
translated: at one time the Blessed One had some kind of illness in his body,

analyzed: tatra ca kṣīreṇa kṛtyam āsīt
translated: and milk was needed for that.

original: so 'ham anyatamasmin brāhmaṇamahāśālasya gṛhamūle pātraṃ gṛhītvā sthitaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ ham anyatamasmin brāhmaṇa mahāśālasya gṛha mūle pātram gṛhītvā sthitaḥ
translated: I, holding my bowl at the door of a certain great brahman's house,

analyzed: vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ tam pradeśam anuprāptaḥ
translated: the Licchavi Vimalakīrti came there and,

analyzed: sa mām vanditvā evam āha
translated: having saluted me, said this:

original: Vkn / kiṃ bhadantānanda kālyam eva pātram ādāyāsmin gṛhadvārasamīpe tiṣṭhasi /
analyzed: kim bhadanta ānanda kālyam eva pātram ādāya asmin gṛha dvāra samīpe tiṣṭhasi
translated: Why, Venerable Ānanda, do you stand at the door of this house with your bowl?

analyzed: tam enam aham etat avocam
translated: I said to him:

analyzed: bhagavataḥ gṛhapate kāyasya kaścid eva ābādhaḥ
translated: Householder, the Blessed One has some kind of illness in his body,

analyzed: tatra ca kṣīreṇa kṛtyam
translated: and milk is needed for that.

analyzed: tat paryeṣāmi
translated: I am seeking it.

analyzed: sa mām evam āha
translated: He said to me:

analyzed: alam bhadanta ānanda mā evam vocaḥ
translated: Enough, Venerable Ānanda, do not say such a thing!

original: vajrasaṃhatano hi bhadantānanda tathāgatakāyaḥ sarvākuśalavāsanāprahīṇaḥ sarvamahaujaskakuśaladharmasamanvāgataḥ /
analyzed: vajrasaṃhatanaḥ hi bhadanta ānanda tathāgata kāyaḥ sarva akuśala vāsanā prahīṇaḥ sarva mahā ojaska kuśala dharma samanvāgataḥ
translated: Venerable Ānanda, the body of the Tathāgata is like adamant, free from all afflictions and latent tendencies, endowed with all wholesome qualities.

analyzed: kutas tasya vyādhiḥ kutas upadravaḥ
translated: Where can he have an illness, where can he have an affliction?

analyzed: tūṣṇīṃbhūtaḥ bhadanta ānanda gaccha
translated: Go in silence, Venerable Ānanda.

analyzed: mā bhagavantam abhyācakṣva
translated: Do not ask the Blessed One.

analyzed: mā kasyacid bhūyas evam vocaḥ
translated: Do not say this to anyone else.

original: mā mahaujaskā devaputrā anyabuddhakṣetrasaṃnipatitāś ca bodhisatvāḥ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: mā mahā ojaskāḥ deva putrāḥ anya buddhakṣetra saṃnipatitāḥ ca bodhisatvāḥ śroṣyanti
translated: Do not let the powerful gods and bodhisattvas assembled from other buddha-fields hear this.

original: rājñas tāvad bhadantānanda cakravartina itvarakuśalamūlasamanvāgatasya vyādhir na saṃvidyate /
analyzed: rājñaḥ tāvat bhadanta ānanda cakravartinaḥ itvara kuśala mūla samanvāgatasya vyādhiḥ na saṃvidyate
translated: Venerable Ānanda, even a wheel-turning king, who possesses only a small amount of wholesome roots, does not have illness.

analyzed: kutas tasya bhagavataḥ pramāṇa kuśala samanvāgatasya vyādhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: How could the Blessed One, who possesses immeasurable wholesome qualities, have illness?

analyzed: na idam sthānam vidyate
translated: This is not possible.

analyzed: gaccha gaccha bhadanta ānanda
translated: Go, go, Venerable Ānanda.

analyzed: mā mām adhyapatrāpaya
translated: Do not embarrass me.

analyzed: mā anya tīrthika caraka parivrājaka nigranthājīvāḥ śroṣyanti
translated: Do not let the non-Buddhist ascetics, naked ascetics, and Jains hear this.

analyzed: mā teṣām evam bhaviṣyati
translated: Do not let them think this way:

analyzed: kīdṛśaḥ bata ayam eṣām śāstā yaḥ svayam eva tāvat ātmānam glānam na śaknoti paritrātum

analyzed: kutas punar glānānām satvānām trāṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: let alone be a protector for sick beings?

analyzed: tatas pracchannam bhadanta ānanda gaccha śīghram
translated: Therefore, Venerable Ānanda, go quickly in secret.

analyzed: mā kaścid śṛṇuyāt
translated: Let no one hear it.

original: Vkn / api tu bhadantānanda dharmakāyās tathāgatā nāmiṣakāyāḥ /
analyzed: api tu bhadanta ānanda dharma kāyāḥ tathāgatāḥ na āmiṣa kāyāḥ
translated: Moreover, Venerable Ānanda, the Tathāgatas have the Dharma-body, not the body of material elements.

original: lokottarakāyās tathāgatāḥ sarvalokadharmasamatikrāntāḥ /🔽anābādhas tathāgatasya kāyaḥ sarvāsravavinivṛtaḥ /

analyzed: a saṃskṛtaḥ tathāgatasya kāyaḥ sarva saṃkhyā vigataḥ

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: sarva satva anubodhaḥ hi bodhiḥ

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: parinirvṛtāni te satvāni paśyanti nirvāṇa prakṛtikāni

analyzed: na bodhau kaścid pratiṣṭhate

analyzed: na nivartate

analyzed: a samāropaḥ bodhiḥ sarva ārambaṇānām

original: vigamo bodhiḥ sarvaparikalpānām /🔽visaṃyogo bodhiḥ sarveñjitamanyasyanditānām /🔽anadhiṣṭhānaṃ bodhiḥ sarvapraṇidhānānām /

analyzed: asaṅga praveśaḥ bodhiḥ sarva udgraha vigatā

analyzed: sthitā bodhiḥ dharmadhātu sthāne

analyzed: anugatā bodhiḥ tathatāyām

analyzed: pratiṣṭhitā bodhiḥ bhūtakoṭyām

analyzed: advayā bodhiḥ manaḥ dharma vigatā

analyzed: samā bodhiḥ ākāśa sama tayā

analyzed: asaṃskṛtā bodhiḥ utpāda bhaṅga sthiti anyathātva vigatā

analyzed: parijñā bodhiḥ sarva satva citta carita āśayānām

analyzed: a dvārā bodhiḥ āyatanānām

analyzed: asaṃsṛṣṭā bodhiḥ sarva vāsanā anusaṃdhi kleśa vigatā

original: na deśasthā na pradeśasthā bodhiḥ sthānāsthānavigatā /
analyzed: na deśa sthā na pradeśa sthā bodhiḥ sthāna asthāna vigatā

analyzed: tathatā pratiṣṭhitā bodhiḥ sarvatas dṛśyā

analyzed: an ākulā bodhiḥ prakṛti pariśuddhā

analyzed: an udgrahā bodhiḥ adhyālambana vigatā

analyzed: anupamā bodhiḥ upama upanyāsa vigatāḥ

analyzed: sūkṣmā bodhiḥ duranubodha tvāt

analyzed: sarvatra anugatā bodhiḥ ākāśa svabhāva tvāt

original: sā na śakyā kāyena vācā cittenābhisaṃboddhum /

analyzed: vīrya maṇḍaḥ eṣaḥ vinivartana tayā

analyzed: dhyāna maṇḍaḥ eṣa citta karmaṇya tayā
translated: The seat of meditation is the pliability of mind.

analyzed: prajñā maṇḍaḥ eṣa pratyakṣa darśi tayā

analyzed: upāya maṇḍaḥ eṣa satva paripācana tayā

original: saṃgrahavastumaṇḍa eṣa sarvasatvasaṃgrahanatayā /🔽śrutamaṇḍa eṣa pratipattisārakatvāt /🔽nidhyaptimaṇḍa eṣa yoniśaḥpratyavekṣaṇatayā /

analyzed: sarva sattva maṇḍaḥ eṣa sattva asvabhāva tayā

analyzed: sarva māra nirghātana maṇḍaḥ calana tayā

original: Vkn / ahaṃ cāścaryaprasādapratilabdhas tasya satpuruṣasya caraṇau praṇamya śatasahasramūlyaṃ muktāhāraṃ kaṇṭhād avatārya dadāmi /
analyzed: aham ca āścarya prasāda pratilabdhaḥ tasya sat puruṣasya caraṇau praṇamya śata sahasra mūlyam muktā hāram kaṇṭhāt avatārya dadāmi
translated: I too, having attained a sense of wonder and faith, bowed down at the feet of that good man and, taking off a pearl necklace worth a hundred thousand, gave it to him.

original: sa taiḥ muktāhāraṃ na pratigṛhṇāti sma /
analyzed: sa taiḥ muktā hāram na pratigṛhṇāti sma
translated: But he did not accept the pearl necklace.

analyzed: tam aham etat avocam
translated: I said to him:🔽Here is the corrected and aligned text:

analyzed: pratigṛhya imam
translated: Accept this.

original: yatra te prasādo bhavati tasmai prayaccheti /
analyzed: yatra te prasādaḥ bhavati tasmai prayaccha iti
translated: Give it to whoever you have faith in.

analyzed: tena sa muktā hāraḥ gṛhītvā dvidhākṛtaḥ
translated: He took the pearl necklace and divided it in two.

original: eko bhāgo yas tatra yajñaśālāyāṃ sarvalokajugupsito nagaradaridras tasmai dattaḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ bhāgaḥ yaḥ tatra yajña śālāyām sarva loka jugupsitaḥ nagara daridraḥ tasmai dattaḥ
translated: One half was given to the most despised poor man in the city, who was there in the sacrificial ground.

original: dvitīyaś ca bhāgo duṣprasahāya tathāgatāya dattaḥ /
analyzed: dvitīyaḥ ca bhāgaḥ duṣprasahāya tathāgatāya dattaḥ
translated: And the second half was given to the Tathāgata Duṣprasaha.

original: yathā ca sarvā parṣat paśyati taṃ ca marīciṃ lokadhātuṃ taṃ ca duṣprasahaṃ tathāgataṃ
analyzed: yathā ca sarvā parṣad paśyati tam ca marīcim lokadhātum tam ca duṣprasaham tathāgatam
translated: And the entire assembly saw that mirage world and the Tathāgata Duṣprasaha,

original: taṃ ca muktāhāraṃ duṣprasahasya mūrdhasaṃdhau muktāhārakūṭāgāraṃ prādurbhūtaṃ citraṃ
analyzed: tam ca muktā hāram duṣprasahasya mūrdha saṃdhau muktā hāra kūṭāgāram prādurbhūtam citram
translated: and that pearl necklace appeared as a pavilion of pearl necklaces on the crown of Duṣprasaha's head, colorful

analyzed: darśanīyam catur asram catur sthūṇam samaṃbhāgaśas su vibhaktam
translated: and beautiful, with four sides, four pillars, and equal proportions, well-divided.

original: Vkn / sa idaṃ prātihāryaṃ saṃdarśyemāṃ vācam abhāṣata /
analyzed: saḥ idam prātihāryam saṃdarśya imām vācam abhāṣata
translated: Having displayed this miracle, he spoke these words:

original: yasya dāyakasya dānapater yādṛśī tathāgate dakṣiṇīyasaṃjñā tādṛśī nagaradaridre nirnānātvena samā /
analyzed: yasya dāyakasya dānapateḥ yādṛśī tathāgate dakṣiṇīya saṃjñā tādṛśī nagara daridre niḥ nānātvena samā
translated: The donor, the benefactor, has the same non-differentiation towards the poor of the city as he has towards the Tathāgata, who is considered worthy of offerings.

analyzed: mahā karuṇā cittena vipāka a pratikāṅkṣaṇa tayā parityāgaḥ
translated: It is generosity with a mind of great compassion, without expectation of reward.

analyzed: iyam dharma yajñasya paripūriḥ
translated: This is the fulfillment of the sacrifice of Dharma.

original: Vkn / tatrāsau nagaradaridra idaṃ prātihāryaṃ dṛṣṭvā /
analyzed: tatra asau nagara daridraḥ idam prātihāryam dṛṣṭvā
translated: There, the poor man of the city, having seen this miracle,

analyzed: imam ca dharma nirdeśam śrutvā
translated: and having heard this teaching of the Dharma,

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayati sma
translated: gave rise to the mind set on unexcelled, perfect awakening.

original: tan nāhaṃ bhagavan utsahe tasya satpuruṣasya glānaparipṛcchako gantum /
analyzed: tat na aham bhagavan utsahe tasya sat puruṣasya glāna paripṛcchakaḥ gantum
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, I am not able to go and inquire about the illness of that good man.

original: Vkn / iti hi sarve te bodhisatvā mahāsatvāḥ svakasvakān nirdeśān nirdiśanti sma /
analyzed: iti hi sarve te bodhisatvāḥ mahāsatvāḥ svaka svakān nirdeśān nirdiśanti sma
translated: Thus, all those bodhisattva great beings each gave their own instructions,

original: ye caiṣāṃ tena satpuruṣeṇa sārdham antarākathāsamudāhārā abhūvan /
analyzed: ye ca eṣām tena sat puruṣeṇa sārdham antarākathā samudāhārāḥ abhūvan
translated: and they had conversations with that good man.

analyzed: na ca utsahante gantum
translated: But they were not able to go.

analyzed: śrāvakabodhisatvavisarjanapraśnaḥ nāma tṛtīyaḥ parivartaḥ
translated: The third chapter, named The Question of Sending the Disciples and Bodhisattvas.

original: Vkn / tatra bhagavān mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtam āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam āmantrayate sma
translated: There, the Blessed One addressed Mañjuśrī, the youth:

analyzed: gaccha tvam mañjuśrīḥ vimala kīrteḥ licchaveḥ glāna paripṛcchakaḥ
