analyzed: mañjuśrīḥ api āha
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: kiṃ cāpi durāsado 'sau bhagavan vimalakīrtir licchaviḥ /
analyzed: kim ca api sau bhagavan vimala kīrtiḥ licchaviḥ
translated: Blessed One, that Licchavi Vimalakīrti is difficult to rival.
He has penetrated the profound way of eloquence.

analyzed: vyasta samasta vacana nirhāra kuśalaḥ
translated: He is skilled in accomplishing words that are both concise and detailed.

analyzed: a viṣṭhita pratibhānaḥ
translated: He has uninterrupted eloquence.

analyzed: apratima buddhiḥ sarva satveṣu
translated: He has an incomparable intellect with regard to all beings.

analyzed: sarva bodhisatva kriyāsu niryātaḥ
translated: He has set out on all the activities of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: sarva bodhisatva sarva buddha guhya sthāneṣu su praviṣṭaḥ
translated: He is well-established in all the secret places of the bodhisattvas and buddhas.

analyzed: sarva māra sthāna vivartana kuśala mahā abhijñā vikrīḍitaḥ
translated: He is skilled in turning away from all the abodes of Mara, and he playfully displays the great higher knowledges.

analyzed: advaya a saṃbheda dharmadhātu gocara parama pārami prāptaḥ
translated: He has attained the ultimate perfection of the sphere of the non-dual, indivisible dharmadhatu.
He teaches the Dharma with an infinite array of aspects within the single array of the dharmadhatu.

analyzed: sarva satva indriya vyūha saṃprāpaṇa jñāna kuśalaḥ  upāya kauśalya gatiṃgataḥ
translated: He is skilled in the knowledge of bestowing the arrays of the faculties of all beings.🔽He has attained skill in means.
He has attained certainty in answering questions.

analyzed: sa na śakyaḥ lpakena saṃnāhena abhirādhayitum
translated: He cannot be satisfied with a small amount of armor.

analyzed: atha ca punar gamiṣyāmi buddha adhiṣṭhānena
translated: Nevertheless, I will go by the empowerment of the Buddha.

analyzed: tatra yathāśakti yathābalam nirdekṣyāmi
translated: There I will teach according to my ability and strength.

original: Vkn / atha tataḥ parṣadas teṣāṃ bodhisatvānāṃ teṣāṃ ca śrāvakāṇāṃ teṣāṃ ca śakrabrahmalokapālānāṃ teṣāṃ ca devaputrāṇām etad abhavat /
analyzed: atha tatas parṣadaḥ teṣām bodhisatvānām teṣām ca śrāvakāṇām teṣām ca śakra brahma lokapālānām teṣām ca deva putrāṇām etat abhavat
translated: Vkn. Then from that assembly, those bodhisattvas, those disciples, those Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, and those many hundreds of thousands of devaputras, this thought arose:

analyzed: niścayena tatra mahā dharma śravaṇa sāṃkathyam bhaviṣyati
translated: Certainly there will be a great Dharma discourse there,

original: yatra mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtaḥ sa ca satpuruṣa ubhau saṃlapiṣyataḥ /
analyzed: yatra mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ sa ca sat puruṣaḥ ubhau saṃlapiṣyataḥ
translated: where Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta and that good man will converse together.🔽There, eight thousand bodhisattvas, five hundred disciples, many Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, and many hundreds of thousands of devaputras

original: tatrāṣṭau ca bodhisatvasahasrāṇi pañcamātrāṇi ca śrāvakaśatāni saṃbahulāś ca śakrabrahmalokapālāḥ saṃbahulāni ca devaputraśatasahasrāṇi mañjuśriyam
analyzed: tatra aṣṭau ca bodhisatva sahasrāṇi pañca mātrāṇi ca śrāvaka śatāni saṃbahulāḥ ca śakra brahma lokapālāḥ saṃbahulāni ca devaputra śata sahasrāṇi mañjuśriyam
translated: followed Mañjuśrī

original: anubaddhāni dharmaśravaṇāya /🔽atha mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūtas tair bodhisatvair mahāsatvais taiś ca śrāvakais taiś ca śakrabrahmalokapālair devaputraiś ca parivṛto vaiśālīṃ
analyzed: anubaddhāni dharma śravaṇāya  atha mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ taiḥ bodhisatvaiḥ mahāsatvaiḥ taiḥ ca śrāvakaiḥ taiḥ ca śakra brahma lokapālaiḥ devaputraiḥ ca parivṛtaḥ vaiśālīm
translated: to listen to the Dharma.

analyzed: mahā nagarīm praviśati sma
translated: Then Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta, surrounded by those bodhisattva mahāsattvas, those disciples, those Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, and devaputras, entered the great city of Vaiśālī.

analyzed: atha vimalakīrteḥ etat abhavat
translated: Then this thought occurred to Vimalakīrti:

original: ayaṃ mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūta āgacchati mahatā parivāreṇa /
analyzed: ayam mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ āgacchati mahatā parivāreṇa
translated: Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta is coming here with a great retinue.

original: yan nv ahaṃ śūnyaṃ gṛham adhitiṣṭheyam /
analyzed: yat nu aham śūnyam gṛham adhitiṣṭheyam
translated: I will now stay in an empty house.

original: tena taṃ gṛhaṃ śūnyam adhiṣṭhitam apagatadvārapālam /
analyzed: tena tam gṛham śūnyam adhiṣṭhitam apagata dvārapālam
translated: He then stayed in that empty house, without a doorkeeper.

original: na tatra mañcā vā pīṭhā vāsanāni vā saṃdṛśyante 'nyatraikasmān mañcāt /
analyzed: na tatra mañcāḥ vā pīṭhāḥ vā āsanāni vā saṃdṛśyante nyatra ekasmāt mañcāt
translated: There were no beds or seats seen there, except for one bed,

analyzed: yatra ātmanā glānaḥ samārūḍhaḥ śayitaḥ
translated: where he himself, being sick, had climbed up and was lying down.

original: Vkn / atha mañjuśrīḥ saparivāro yena vimalakīrter niveśanaṃ tenopasaṃkrāmat /
analyzed: atha mañjuśrīḥ sa parivāraḥ yena vimalakīrteḥ niveśanam tena upasaṃkrāmat
translated: Then Mañjuśrī, together with his retinue, approached the house of Vimalakīrti.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya praviśati sma
translated: Having approached, he entered.

original: sa taṃ gṛhaṃ śūnyam apaśyad vigatadvārapālam /
analyzed: sa tam gṛham śūnyam apaśyat vigata dvārapālam
translated: He saw that house empty, without a doorkeeper.

original: na cātra mañcān vā pīṭhān vāpaśyad anyatraikamañcāt /
analyzed: na ca atra mañcān vā pīṭhān vā apaśyat anyatra eka mañcāt
translated: And there he saw no beds or seats, except for one bed,

analyzed: yatra vimalakīrtiḥ śayitaḥ
translated: where Vimalakīrti was lying down.

original: atha vimalakīrtir licchavir mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtam adrākṣīt /
analyzed: atha vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam adrākṣīt
translated: Then the Licchavi Vimalakīrti saw Mañjuśrī, the Youth,

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar evam āha
translated: and having seen him, said this:

analyzed: svāgatam mañjuśriyaḥ svāgatam mañjuśriyaḥ nāgatasya a dṛṣṭa śruta pūrvasya darśanam
translated: Welcome, Mañjuśrī! Welcome, Mañjuśrī! It is a sight never before seen or heard of for one who has not come to see one who has not come.

analyzed: mañjuśriḥ āha
translated: Mañjuśrī said:

analyzed: evam etat gṛhapate yathā vadasi
translated: Householder, it is just as you say.

original: ya āgato na sa bhūya āgamiṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ āgataḥ na sa bhūyas āgamiṣyati
translated: One who has come will not come again.

original: yaś ca gato na sa bhūyo gamiṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ ca gataḥ na sa bhūyas gamiṣyati
translated: And that which has gone will not go again.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na cāgatasyāgamanaṃ prajñāyate /🔽na ca gatasya gamanam /
analyzed: na ca āgatasya āgamanam prajñāyate  na ca gatasya gamanam
translated: The going of that which has come is not perceived.🔽And the going of that which has gone.

original: yaś ca dṛṣṭo na bhūyo draṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca dṛṣṭaḥ na bhūyas draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: And that which has been seen will not be seen again.

original: Vkn / api tu kaccit te satpuruṣa kṣapaṇīyam /
analyzed: api tu kaccit te sat puruṣa kṣapaṇīyam
translated: Moreover, good man, is your illness decreasing?

analyzed: kaccit yāpanīyam
translated: Is it becoming less?

analyzed: kaccit vātena pratikupyanti dhātavaḥ
translated: Are the elements disturbed by wind?

original: kaccid apagacchati vyādhir na vivardhate /🔽bhagavāṃs te 'lpābādhatāṃ paripṛcchati /
analyzed: kaccit apagacchati vyādhiḥ na vivardhate  bhagavān te lpa ābādha tām paripṛcchati
translated: Is the disease subsiding, not increasing?

original: alpātaṅkatāṃ cālpaglānyatāṃ ca laghūtthānatāṃ ca yatrāṃ ca balaṃ ca sukhaṃ cānavadyatāṃ ca sparśavihāratāṃ ca /
analyzed: alpa ātaṅka tām ca alpa glānya tām ca laghu utthāna tām ca yatrām ca balam ca sukham ca anavadya tām ca sparśa vihāra tām ca
translated: The Blessed One inquires about your few afflictions, little distress, little discomfort, lightness, strength, comfort, freedom from illness, and ease in activity.

original: Vkn / kutra te gṛhapate idaṃ vyādhisamutthānam /
analyzed: kutra te gṛhapate idam vyādhi samutthānam
translated: Householder, where did you get this illness?

analyzed: kiyat ciram upādāya te vyādhiḥ
translated: How long has it been since you became ill?

analyzed: kadā ca upaśamiṣyati
translated: When will it subside?

analyzed: vimalakirtiḥ āha
translated: Vimalakīrti replied:

original: yāvacciram upādāya mañjuśrīḥ avidyā bhavatṛṣṇā ca tāvacciram upādāya mamaiṣa vyādhiḥ /
analyzed: yāvat ciram upādāya mañjuśrīḥ avidyā bhava tṛṣṇā ca tāvat ciram upādāya mama eṣa vyādhiḥ
translated: As long as ignorance, craving for existence, and thirst for birth have existed, so long has this illness of mine existed.

original: yadā ca sarvasatvā vigatavyādhayo bhaviṣyanti tadā mama vyādhiḥ praśrabdho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yadā ca sarva satvāḥ vigata vyādhayaḥ bhaviṣyanti tadā mama vyādhiḥ praśrabdhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And when all sentient beings are free from disease, then my disease will be cured.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: satva adhiṣṭhānaḥ hi mañjuśrīḥ bodhisatvasya saṃsāraḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva’s saṃsāra is based on sentient beings.

analyzed: saṃsāra niśritaḥ ca vyādhiḥ
translated: And disease is based on saṃsāra.

original: yadā sarvasatvā vigatavyādhayo bhaviṣyanti tadā bodhisatvo 'rogo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yadā sarva satvāḥ vigata vyādhayaḥ bhaviṣyanti tadā bodhisatvaḥ rogaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: When all sentient beings are free from disease, then the bodhisattva will be healthy.

original: Vkn / tadyathā mañjuśrīḥ śreṣṭhina ekaputrako glāno bhavet /
analyzed: tat yathā mañjuśrīḥ śreṣṭhinaḥ eka putrakaḥ glānaḥ bhavet
translated: Mañjuśrī, it is just as when a merchant’s only son is sick,

analyzed: tasya mātā pitarau api glānau syātām
translated: his parents are also sick.

original: tāvac ca duḥkhitau bhavetāṃ yāvan nāsāv ekaputrakas tayor vigatavyādhiḥ syāt /
analyzed: tāvat ca duḥkhitau bhavetām yāvat na asau eka putrakaḥ tayoḥ vigata vyādhiḥ syāt
translated: And they are miserable as long as that only son is not free from disease.

original: evaṃ mañjuśrīḥ bodhisatvasya sarvasatveṣv ekaputrakaprema /🔽sa satvaglānyena glāno bhavati /
analyzed: evam mañjuśrīḥ bodhisatvasya sarva satveṣu eka putraka prema  sa satva glānyena glānaḥ bhavati
translated: In the same way, Mañjuśrī, the bodhisattva loves all sentient beings as his only son.🔽He is sick because of the sickness of sentient beings.

analyzed: satva ārogyāt tu arogaḥ
translated: But he is healthy when sentient beings are healthy.

original: yat punar mañjuśriḥ evaṃ vadasi ḥ kutaḥ samutthito vyādhir iti /
analyzed: yat punar mañjuśriḥ evam vadasi kutas samutthitaḥ vyādhiḥ iti
translated: And again, Mañjuśrī, when you ask, “Where does disease arise from?”

analyzed: mahā karuṇā samutthitaḥ bodhisatvānām vyādhiḥ
translated: The disease of bodhisattvas arises from great compassion.

analyzed: mañjuśrīḥ āha
translated: Mañjuśrī said:

analyzed: śūnyam te gṛhapate gṛham
translated: Your house, householder, is empty.

analyzed: na ca te kaścid upasthāyakaḥ
translated: And you have no attendant at all.

analyzed: āha sarva buddhakṣetrāṇi api mañjuśriḥ śūnyāni
translated: He said, “Mañjuśrī, all buddha-fields are also empty.”

analyzed: āha kena śūnyāni
translated: He said, “By what are they empty?”

analyzed: āha śūnyatayā śūnyāni
translated: He said, “They are empty by emptiness.”

analyzed: āha śūnyatāyāḥ kā śūnyatā
translated: He said, “What is the emptiness of emptiness?”

original: āha / aparikalpanāś ca śūnyatāyāḥ śūnyatāḥ /🔽āha / śakyā punaḥ śūnyatā parikalpayitum /
analyzed: āha aparikalpanāḥ ca śūnyatāyāḥ śūnyatāḥ  āha śakyā punar śūnyatā parikalpayitum
translated: He said, “The emptinesses are not conceptualized.”🔽He said, “But can emptiness be conceptualized?”

original: āha / yenāpi parikalpyeta tad api śūnyam /
analyzed: āha yena api parikalpyeta tat api śūnyam
translated: He said, “That by which it could be conceptualized is also empty.

analyzed: na ca śūnyatā śūnyatām parikalpayati
translated: And emptiness does not conceptualize emptiness.”

analyzed: āha śūnyatā gṛhapate kutas mārgitavyā
translated: He said, “Householder, from where should emptiness be sought?”

original: āha / śūnyatā mañjuśrīḥ dvāṣaṣṭibhyo dṛṣṭigatebhyo mārgitavyā /
analyzed: āha śūnyatā mañjuśrīḥ dvāṣaṣṭibhyaḥ dṛṣṭi gatebhyaḥ mārgitavyā
translated: He said, “Mañjuśrī, emptiness should be sought from the sixty-two views.”

original: āha / dvāṣaṣṭiḥ punar dṛṣṭigatāni kuto mārgitavyāni /
analyzed: āha dvāṣaṣṭiḥ punar dṛṣṭi gatāni kutas mārgitavyāni
translated: He said, “But from where should the sixty-two views be sought?”

analyzed: āha tathāgata vimuktitaḥ mārgitavyāni
translated: He said, “They should be sought from the liberation of the Tathāgata.”

analyzed: āha tathāgata vimuktiḥ punar kutas mārgitavyā
translated: He said, “But from where should the liberation of the Tathāgata be sought?”

analyzed: āha sarva satva citta caritebhyaḥ mārgitavyā
translated: He said, “It should be sought from the thoughts and actions of all beings.”

original: yat punar mañjuśrīḥ evaṃ vadasi ḥ kas ta upasthāyaka iti /
analyzed: yat punar mañjuśrīḥ evam vadasi ḥ kaḥ te upasthāyakaḥ iti
translated: And again, Mañjuśrī, you ask, ‘Who is his attendant?’

analyzed: sarva mārāḥ sarva para pravādinaḥ ca mama upasthāyakāḥ
translated: All māras and opponents are my attendants.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: mārāḥ hi saṃsārasya varṇa vādinaḥ
translated: Māras praise saṃsāra.

analyzed: saṃsāraḥ ca bodhisatvasya upasthāyakaḥ
translated: And saṃsāra is the attendant of the bodhisattva.

analyzed: parapravādinaḥ dṛṣṭi gatānām varṇa vādinaḥ
translated: Opponents praise the views.

analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ ca sarva dṛṣṭi gatebhyaḥ na calati
translated: And the bodhisattva does not waver from any view.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva mārāḥ sarva para pravādinaḥ ca mama upasthāyakāḥ
translated: Therefore, all māras and opponents are my attendants.”

analyzed: mañjuśrīḥ āha
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

analyzed: kidṛśaḥ yam te gṛhapate vyādhiḥ
translated: “Householder, what is the nature of your illness?”

analyzed: āha adṛśyaḥ nidarśanaḥ
translated: He said, “It is invisible and cannot be shown.”

original: āha / kim eṣa vyādhiḥ kāyasaṃprayukta uta cittasaṃprayuktaḥ /
analyzed: āha kim eṣa vyādhiḥ kāya saṃprayuktaḥ uta citta saṃprayuktaḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī said, “Is this illness related to the body or to the mind?”

analyzed: āha na kāya saṃprayuktaḥ kāya vivikta tayā
translated: He said, “It is not related to the body, because the body is isolated.

analyzed: na citta saṃprayuktaḥ māyā dharma tayā cittasya
translated: It is not related to the mind, because the mind is illusory.”

analyzed: āha catvāraḥ ime gṛhapate dhātavaḥ
translated: Mañjuśrī said, “Householder, there are four elements.

analyzed: katame catvāraḥ
translated: What are the four?

original: yad uta pṛthivīdhātur abdhātus tejodhātur vāyudhātur iti /
analyzed: yat uta pṛthivī dhātuḥ ap dhātuḥ tejaḥ dhātuḥ vāyu dhātuḥ iti
translated: They are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

analyzed: tat katamaḥ tatra dhātuḥ bādhate
translated: Which of these elements is afflicted?”

original: āha / ya evaṃ dhātuko mañjuśrīḥ sarvasatvānāṃ vyādhis tenāhaṃ vyādhitaḥ /
analyzed: āha yaḥ evam dhātukaḥ mañjuśrīḥ sarva satvānām vyādhiḥ tena aham vyādhitaḥ
translated: He said, “Mañjuśrī, I am sick with the same disease that all sentient beings have.

original: Vkn / api tu khalu punar mañjuśrīḥ kathaṃ bodhisatvena glānako bodhisatvaḥ pratisaṃmoditavyaḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar mañjuśrīḥ katham bodhisatvena glānakaḥ bodhisatvaḥ pratisaṃmoditavyaḥ
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, how should a sick bodhisattva be consoled by a bodhisattva?

analyzed: mañjuśrīḥ āha
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

analyzed: kāya anitya tayā na ca niḥ vid virāga tayā
translated: By the impermanence of the body, but not by disgust or aversion.

analyzed: kāya duḥkha tayā na ca nirvāṇa abhinandana tayā
translated: By the suffering of the body, but not by delighting in nirvāṇa.

analyzed: kāya anātma tayā satva paripācana tayā ca
translated: By the selflessness of the body, but by the ripening of sentient beings.

analyzed: kāya śānta tayā na ca atyanta śama tayā
translated: By the peacefulness of the body, but not by ultimate peace.

analyzed: sarva duścarita deśana tayā na ca saṃkrāntitaḥ
translated: By confessing all misdeeds, but not by transferring [the results of] actions.

analyzed: sva glānyena para sattva glāna karuṇa tayā
translated: By compassion for the sickness of other sentient beings with one's own sickness.

analyzed: satva artha kriyā anusmaraṇa tayā
translated: By recollecting the suffering of past times.🔽By recollecting the benefit for sentient beings.

analyzed: kuśala mūla abhimukhīkaraṇa tayā
translated: By turning towards the roots of virtue.

analyzed: ādi viśuddha tayā
translated: By primordial purity.

analyzed: a paritarṣaṇa tayā
translated: By being insatiable.

analyzed: sadā vīrya āraṃbhāt ca
translated: And by always exerting effort.

analyzed: vaidya rājaḥ bhaviṣyasi sarva vyādhīnām śamayitā iti
translated: You will become the king of physicians, pacifying all diseases.

analyzed: evam bodhisatvena bodhisatvaḥ glānaḥ pratisaṃmoditavyaḥ
translated: Thus, Mañjuśrī, a sick bodhisattva should be consoled by a bodhisattva.

analyzed: mañjuśrīḥ āha
translated: Mañjuśrī said,

original: kathaṃ kulaputra bodhisatvena glānena svacittaṃ nidhyapayitavyam /🔽vimalakīrtir āha /
analyzed: katham kula putra bodhisatvena glānena sva cittam  vimalakīrtiḥ āha
translated: “Noble sir, how should a sick bodhisattva control his own mind?”

original: iha mañjuśrīḥ bodhisatvena glānenaivaṃ svacittaṃ nidhyapayitavyam /
analyzed: iha mañjuśrīḥ bodhisatvena glānena evam sva cittam
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, “Noble sir, a sick bodhisattva should control his own mind with the following consideration:

analyzed: pūrva anta asat viparyāsa karma samutthāna samutthitaḥ yam vyādhiḥ abhūta parikalpa kleśa samutthitaḥ
translated: ‘This sickness is due to my own karma. It arises from the fundamental mental affliction of misknowledge, which in turn arises from the fundamental mental affliction of the view of the reality of the perishable aggregates.

original: na punar atra kaścit paramārthato dharma upalabhyate yasyaiṣa vyādhiḥ /
analyzed: na punar atra kaścid paramārthataḥ dharmaḥ upalabhyate yasya eṣa vyādhiḥ
translated: It is not possible for sickness to arise from any other cause.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: cāturmahābhautikaḥ yam samucchrayaḥ
translated: This body is composed of the four great elements.

original: na caiṣāṃ dhātūnāṃ kaścit svāmī na samutthāpayitā /🔽anātmā hy ayaṃ samucchrayaḥ /🔽yo 'yaṃ vyādhir nāma nāyaṃ paramārthata upalabhyate /
analyzed: na ca eṣām dhātūnām kaścid svāmī na samutthāpayitā  anātmā hi ayam samucchrayaḥ  yaḥ yam vyādhiḥ nāma na ayam paramārthataḥ upalabhyate
translated: None of these elements is under my control, nor am I under their control.🔽This body is composed of the four great elements, but it is not the self.

analyzed: anyatra ātma abhiniveśāt  uta na ātmani abhiviniṣṭāḥ vihariṣyāmaḥ vyādhi mūla parijñātāvinaḥ
translated: This sickness is not real, but is imagined because of attachment to the self.🔽I should not be attached to it.

analyzed: tena ātma saṃjñām viṣṭhāpya dharma saṃjñā utpādayitavyā
translated: I should not be attached to the body, which is the basis of sickness, but should contemplate the body as a basis for the Dharma.

analyzed: dharma saṃghātaḥ yam kāyaḥ
translated: This body is a collection of many dharmas.

analyzed: dharmāḥ eva utpadyamānāḥ utpadyante
translated: The dharmas that arise are not under my control, nor am I under their control.

analyzed: dharmāḥ eva nirudhyamānāḥ nirudhyante
translated: The dharmas themselves, when ceasing, cease.

original: te ca dharmāḥ parasparaṃ na cetayanti na jānanti /
analyzed: te ca dharmāḥ parasparam na cetayanti na jānanti
translated: And those dharmas do not think about each other, do not know each other.

original: na ca teṣām utpadyamānānām evaṃ bhavaty utpadyāmaha iti /
analyzed: na ca teṣām utpadyamānānām evam bhavati utpadyāmahe iti
translated: And it does not occur to those dharmas that are arising, 'We are arising.'

original: na nirudhyamānānām evaṃ bhavati nirudhyāmaha iti /
analyzed: na nirudhyamānānām evam bhavati nirudhyāmahe iti
translated: And it does not occur to those that are ceasing, 'We are ceasing.'

original: Vkn / tena dharmasaṃjñāyā evaṃ cittam utpādayitavyam /
analyzed: tena dharma saṃjñāyāḥ evam cittam utpādayitavyam
translated: Therefore, with regard to the perception of dharmas, one should arouse the following thought:

analyzed: yā api eṣā dharma saṃjñā sā u pi viparyāsaḥ
translated: Even this perception of dharmas is a perversion.

original: viparyāsaś ca mahāvyādhiḥ /🔽vigatavyādhikena ca mayā bhavitavyam /
analyzed: viparyāsaḥ ca mahā vyādhiḥ  vigata vyādhikena ca mayā bhavitavyam
translated: And perversion is a great sickness.🔽I should be free from sickness.

analyzed: vyādhi prahāṇāya ca yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: And I should practice yoga for the abandonment of sickness.

analyzed: tatra katamat vyādhi prahāṇam
translated: What, then, is the abandonment of sickness?

analyzed: yat idam ahaṃkāra mamakāra prahāṇam
translated: It is the abandonment of the notion of 'I' and 'mine.'

analyzed: tat ca katamat ahaṃkāra mamakāra prahāṇam
translated: And what is the abandonment of the notion of 'I' and 'mine'?

analyzed: yat idam dvaya vigamaḥ
translated: It is the separation from duality.

analyzed: tatra katamaḥ dvaya vigamaḥ
translated: What is the separation from duality?

original: yad idam adhyātmaṃ bahirdhā ca samudācāraḥ /
analyzed: yat idam adhyātmam bahirdhā ca samudācāraḥ
translated: It is the non-occurrence of internal and external.

analyzed: tatra katamaḥ dhyātmam bahirdhā samudācāraḥ
translated: What is the non-occurrence of internal and external?

analyzed: yat uta sama tayā a calana tā a pracalana tā
translated: It is the unshakability and unagitation by equality.

analyzed: katamā ca samatā
translated: And what is equality?

analyzed: ātma samatayā ca nirvāṇa samatā
translated: And the equality of nirvana is through the equality of self.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: ubhe pi ete śūnye
translated: Both of these are empty:

analyzed: yat uta ātmā nirvāṇam ca
translated: namely, the self and nirvana.

analyzed: kena ete śūnye
translated: By what are these two empty?

analyzed: nāma udāhāreṇa ete śūnye
translated: By the utterance of the name, these two are empty.

analyzed: ubhau api etau a pariniṣpannau
translated: Both of these are unproduced:

analyzed: yat uta ātmā nirvāṇam ca
translated: namely, the self and nirvana.

original: tena samadarśinā nānyo vyādhir nānyā śūnyatā kartavyā /
analyzed: tena sama darśinā na anyaḥ vyādhiḥ na anyā śūnyatā kartavyā
translated: Therefore, one who sees equally should not make any difference between disease and emptiness.

analyzed: vyādhiḥ eva śūnyatā
translated: Disease itself is emptiness.

original: Vkn / aviditā ca sā vedanā veditavyā /
analyzed: a viditā ca sā vedanā veditavyā
translated: And that feeling should be known as unknown.

analyzed: na ca anena vedanā nirodhaḥ sākṣātkartavyaḥ
translated: And one should not realize the cessation of feeling.

analyzed: a paripūrṇeṣu buddha dharmeṣu ubhe vedane na utsraṣṭavye
translated: In incomplete buddha-qualities, both feelings should not be abandoned.

original: na ca durgatyupapannānāṃ satvānām antike mahākaruṇā notpādayitavyā /
analyzed: na ca durgati upapannānām satvānām antike mahā karuṇā na utpādayitavyā
translated: And great compassion should not be generated towards beings born in unfortunate realms.

original: tathā kariṣyāmo yathaiṣāṃ satvānām evam ayoniśonidhyaptyā vyādhim apaneṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tathā kariṣyāmaḥ yathā eṣām satvānām evam a yoni śonidhi aptyā vyādhim apaneṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will act so as to remove the disease of these beings through such improper reflection.

original: Vkn / na caiṣāṃ kaṃcid dharmam upaneṣyāmo nāpaneṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: na ca eṣām kaṃcid dharmam upaneṣyāmaḥ na apaneṣyāmaḥ
translated: And we will neither lead anyone to any dharma nor dissuade anyone from it.

original: yato nidānāc ca punar vyādhir utpadyate tasya parijñāyai tebhyo dharmaṃ deśayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yatas nidānāt ca punar vyādhiḥ utpadyate tasya parijñāyai tebhyaḥ dharmam deśayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: And from whatever cause the disease arises, we will teach the dharma to them for the complete knowledge of that.

analyzed: katamat ca punar nidānam
translated: And what, again, is the cause?

analyzed: yat idam adhyālambana nidānam  yāvatā adhyālambana nidānam adhyālambate
translated: It is the cause of taking up the object.🔽As much as one takes up the cause of taking up the object,

analyzed: tāvat vyādhi nidānam
translated: that much is the cause of the disease.

analyzed: kim ca adhyālambate
translated: And what does one take up?

analyzed: traidhātukam adhyālambate
translated: One takes up the three realms.

analyzed: tasya adhyālambana tayā kā parijñā
translated: What is the thorough knowledge of that taking up?

analyzed: yat idam ālambana anupalambhaḥ
translated: It is the non-apprehension of the object.

analyzed: yam hi na upalabhyate tam na ālambate
translated: For what is not apprehended is not taken up as an object.

analyzed: kim ca na upalabhate
translated: And what is not apprehended?

analyzed: ubhe dṛṣṭī na upalabhate
translated: One does not apprehend the two views,

analyzed: yat idam ātma dṛṣṭim para dṛṣṭim ca
translated: namely the view of self and the view of others.

analyzed: tat ucyate na upalambhaḥ iti
translated: That is called non-apprehension.

original: evaṃ hi mañjuśrīḥ glānena bodhisatvena svacittaṃ nidhyapayitavyaṃ jarāvyādhimaraṇopapattiprahāṇāya /
analyzed: evam hi mañjuśrīḥ glānena bodhisatvena sva cittam nidhyapayitavyam jarā vyādhi maraṇa upapatti prahāṇāya
translated: Thus, Mañjuśrī, a sick bodhisattva should contemplate his own mind in order to abandon old age, sickness, death, and rebirth.

original: evaṃ ca mañjuśrīḥ bodhisatvānāṃ bodhir yadi na bhavet /
analyzed: evam ca mañjuśrīḥ bodhisatvānām bodhiḥ yadi na bhavet
translated: If, Mañjuśrī, the enlightenment of bodhisattvas were not like this,

original: nirarthako nanu vyāyāmo bhavet /🔽yathā pratyarthikanirghātāc churā ity ucyante /
analyzed: nirarthakaḥ nanu vyāyāmaḥ bhavet  yathā pratyarthika nirghātāt churāḥ iti ucyante
translated: would not their exertion be pointless?🔽Just as those who conquer their enemies are called heroes,

original: evam eva jarāvyādhimaraṇaduḥkhopaśamanād bodhisatvā ity ucyante /
analyzed: evam eva jarā vyādhi maraṇa duḥkha upaśamanāt bodhisatvāḥ iti ucyante
translated: in the same way, because they pacify the suffering of old age, sickness, and death, they are called bodhisattvas.

analyzed: tena bodhisatvena vyādhitena evam pratyavekṣitavyam
translated: That sick bodhisattva should contemplate in this way:

original: yathā mama vyādhir abhūto 'sann evaṃ sarvasatvānām api vyādhir abhūto 'sann iti /
analyzed: yathā mama vyādhiḥ san evam sarva satvānām api vyādhiḥ san iti
translated: “Just as my illness is unreal and non-existent, so also the illness of all sentient beings is unreal and non-existent.”

analyzed: tasya evam pratyavekṣamāṇasya na anuśaṃsā dṛṣṭi pati tā satveṣu mahā karuṇā utpadyate
translated: When he contemplates in this way, great compassion arises for sentient beings, not falling into the view of advantages.

analyzed: anyatra āgantuka kleśa prahāṇa abhiyuktyā satveṣu mahā karuṇā utpadyate
translated: Rather, great compassion arises for sentient beings, being devoted to the abandonment of adventitious afflictions.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: anuśaṃsadṛṣṭipatitayaiva hi mahākaruṇayā bodhisatvasya khedo bhavaty upapattiṣu /
analyzed: anuśaṃsa dṛṣṭi patitayā eva hi mahā karuṇayā bodhisatvasya khedaḥ bhavati upapattiṣu
translated: Because by great compassion that falls into the view of advantages, the bodhisattva becomes weary in births.

original: anuśaṃsadṛṣṭiparyutthānavigatayā punar mahākaruṇayā bodhisatvasya khedo na bhavaty upapattiṣu /
analyzed: anuśaṃsa dṛṣṭi paryutthāna vigatayā punar mahā karuṇayā bodhisatvasya khedaḥ na bhavati upapattiṣu
translated: But by great compassion that is free from the mental affliction of the view of advantages, the bodhisattva does not become weary in births.

analyzed: saḥ yam upapadyate
translated: This is what happens.

analyzed: na ca dṛṣṭi paryutthāna paryutthitaḥ upapadyate
translated: One does not take birth with the mental affliction of the view of advantages.

original: so 'paryutthitacitta upapadyamāno mukta evotpadyate mukta eva jāyate /
analyzed: saḥ paryutthita cittaḥ upapadyamānaḥ muktaḥ eva utpadyate muktaḥ eva jāyate
translated: When one is born with a mind free from mental afflictions, one is born free, one is born liberated.

original: sa mukta evotpadyamāno mukta eva jāyamāno baddhānāṃ satvānāṃ śaktaḥ pratibalo bandhamokṣāya dharmaṃ deśayitum /
analyzed: sa muktaḥ eva utpadyamānaḥ muktaḥ eva jāyamānaḥ baddhānām satvānām śaktaḥ pratibalaḥ bandha mokṣāya dharmam deśayitum
translated: He, being liberated, being born, being born as a liberated one, is able and capable of teaching the Dharma for the liberation of bound beings.

original: yathoktaṃ bhagavatā sa tāvad ātmanā baddhaḥ paraṃ bandhanān mocayiṣyatīti nādaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate /
analyzed: yathā uktam bhagavatā sa tāvat ātmanā baddhaḥ param bandhanāt mocayiṣyati iti na adam sthānam vidyate
translated: As the Blessed One said, It is not possible for one who is bound to liberate another from bondage.

original: yas tv ātmanā muktaḥ paraṃ bandhanān mocayiṣyatīti sthānam etad vidyate tasmān muktena bodhisatvena bhavitavyam /
analyzed: yaḥ tu ātmanā muktaḥ param bandhanāt mocayiṣyati iti sthānam etat vidyate tasmāt muktena bodhisatvena bhavitavyam
translated: But it is possible for one who is liberated to liberate another from bondage. Therefore, a bodhisattva should be liberated,

analyzed: na baddhena
translated: not bound.

analyzed: tatra katamaḥ bandhaḥ
translated: There, what is bondage?

analyzed: katamaḥ mokṣaḥ
translated: What is liberation?

analyzed: anupāyāt bhava gati parigrahaḥ bodhisatvasya bandhaḥ
translated: For a bodhisattva, taking up existence and destiny without skillful means is bondage.

analyzed: upāyāt bhava gati gamanam mokṣaḥ
translated: Going to existence and destiny with skillful means is liberation.

analyzed: anupāyāt dhyāna samādhi āsvādana tā bodhisatvasya bandhaḥ
translated: For a bodhisattva, savoring the dhyānas and concentrations without skillful means is bondage.

analyzed: upāyena dhyāna samādhi āsvādana tā mokṣaḥ
translated: Savoring the dhyānas and concentrations with skillful means is liberation.

analyzed: an upāya saṃgṛhītā prajñā bandhaḥ
translated: Wisdom not embraced by skillful means is bondage.

analyzed: upāya saṃgṛhītā prajñā mokṣaḥ
translated: Wisdom embraced by skillful means is liberation.

analyzed: prajñayā a saṃgṛhītaḥ upāyaḥ bandhanam
translated: Skillful means not embraced by wisdom is bondage.

analyzed: prajñā saṃgṛhītaḥ upāyaḥ mokṣaḥ
translated: Skillful means embraced by wisdom is liberation.

analyzed: tatra katamaḥ prajñā bandhaḥ
translated: There, what is the bondage of wisdom not included in skillful means?

analyzed: yat idam śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita nidhi aptiḥ
translated: It is the ascertainment of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

analyzed: na ca lakṣaṇa anuvyañjana buddhakṣetra alaṃkāra satva paripācana nidhi aptiḥ
translated: But it is not the ascertainment of the major and minor marks, the adornment of the Buddha-field, and the maturation of beings.

analyzed: iyam an upāya saṃgṛhītā prajñā bandhaḥ
translated: This is the bondage of wisdom not included in skillful means.

analyzed: tatra katamā upāya saṃgṛhītā prajñā mokṣaḥ
translated: There, what is the liberation of wisdom included in skillful means?

analyzed: yat idam lakṣanā anuvyañjana buddhakṣetra alaṃkāra satva paripācana nidhi apti cittam ca śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita parijayaḥ ca
translated: It is the mind of ascertainment of the major and minor marks, the adornment of the Buddha-field, and the maturation of beings, and the mastery of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

analyzed: iyam upāya saṃgṛhītā prajñā mokṣaḥ
translated: This is the liberation of wisdom included in skillful means.

analyzed: tatra katamaḥ prajñayā a saṃgṛhītaḥ upāyaḥ bandhaḥ
translated: There, what is the bondage of skillful means not included in wisdom?

analyzed: yat idam sarva dṛṣṭi kleśa paryutthāna anuśaya anunaya pratigha pratiṣṭhitasya sarva kuśala mūla ārambhaḥ bodhau ca apariṇāmanā
translated: It is the establishment of all views, afflictions, mental disturbances, latent tendencies, attachment, and aversion, and the undertaking of all wholesome actions without dedicating them to enlightenment.

analyzed: ayam prajñayā a saṃgṛhītaḥ upāyaḥ bandhaḥ
translated: This is the bondage of skillful means not included in wisdom.

analyzed: tatra katamaḥ prajñā saṃgṛhītaḥ upāyaḥ mokṣaḥ
translated: There, what is the liberation of skillful means included in wisdom?🔽Here it is.

original: yad idaṃ sarvadṛṣṭikleśaparyutthānānuśayānunayapratighaprahīṇasya sarvakuśalamūlārambho bodhau pariṇāmitas tasya cāparāmarśaḥ /
analyzed: yat idam sarva dṛṣṭi kleśa paryutthāna anuśaya anunaya pratigha prahīṇasya sarva kuśala mūla ārambhaḥ bodhau pariṇāmitaḥ tasya ca a parāmarśaḥ
translated: It is the complete relinquishment of all views, afflictions, latent tendencies, attachments, and aversions, and the transformation of all roots of virtue into enlightenment without clinging to them.

analyzed: ayam bodhisatvasya prajñā saṃgṛhītaḥ upāyaḥ mokṣaḥ
translated: This is the liberation of skillful means embraced by the wisdom of a bodhisattva: the complete abandonment of all views, afflictions, latent tendencies, attachments, and aversions, and the dedication of all roots of virtue to enlightenment without clinging to them.

original: Vkn / tatra mañjuśrīḥ glānena bodhisatvenaivam ime dharmā nidhyapayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: tatra mañjuśrīḥ glānena bodhisatvena evam ime dharmāḥ
translated: In this regard, Mañjuśrī, a sick bodhisattva should understand these dharmas in the following way:

original: yatl kāyasya cittasya ca vyādheś cānityaduḥkhaśūnyānātmapratyavekṣaṇā /
analyzed: kāyasya cittasya ca vyādheḥ ca anitya duḥkha śūnya anātma pratyavekṣaṇā
translated: The contemplation of the impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness of the body, mind, and illness.

analyzed: iyam asya prajñā
translated: This is his wisdom.

analyzed: yat punar kāya vyādhi pariharaṇa tayā na khidyate
translated: Moreover, not being weary due to avoiding bodily illness,

analyzed: na pratibadhnāti saṃsāram
translated: not being obstructed in the cycle of existence,

analyzed: satva artha yogam anuyuktaḥ
translated: devoted to benefiting beings,

analyzed: ayam asya upāyaḥ
translated: this is his skillful means.

original: punar aparaṃ yat kāyasya vyādheś cittasya cānyonyaparāparatāṃ na nirnavatāniḥpurāṇatāṃ pratyavekṣate /
analyzed: punar aparam yat kāyasya vyādheḥ cittasya ca anyonya para apara tām na nirnava tā niḥpurāṇa tām pratyavekṣate
translated: Furthermore, contemplating the mutual dependence of the body, mind, and illness, their lack of novelty and lack of antiquity,

analyzed: iyam asya prajñā
translated: this is his wisdom.

original: yat punaḥ kāyasya vyādheś cittasya ca nātyantopaśamaṃ nirodham atyayati /
analyzed: yat punar kāyasya vyādheḥ cittasya ca na atyanta upaśamam nirodham
translated: Moreover, not prematurely seeking the complete cessation and end of the body, mind, and illness,

analyzed: ayam asya upāyaḥ
translated: this is his skillful means.

original: Vkn / evaṃ hi mañjuśriḥ glānena bodhisatvena cittaṃ nidhyapayitavyam /
analyzed: evam hi mañjuśriḥ glānena bodhisatvena cittam nidhyapayitavyam
translated: Thus, Mañjuśrī, a sick bodhisattva should direct his mind.

original: na ca tena nidhyaptau vānidhyaptau vā sthātavyam /
analyzed: na ca tena nidhi aptau vā a nidhi aptau vā sthātavyam
translated: And he should not abide either in directing or not directing.

original: tat kasmād dhetoḥ /🔽yadi hy anidhyaptau tiṣṭhed bāladharma eṣaḥ /
analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ  yadi hi a nidhi aptau tiṣṭhet bāla dharmaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: Why is that?🔽If he abides in not directing, that is the dharma of a fool.

analyzed: atha nidhi aptau tiṣṭhet śrāvaka dharmaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: If he abides in directing, that is the dharma of a śrāvaka.

analyzed: tasmāt bodhisatvena na nidhi aptau sthātavyam
translated: Therefore, a bodhisattva should not abide in directing.

analyzed: yat atra āsthānam ayam bodhisatvasya gocaraḥ
translated: The non-abiding here is the domain of the bodhisattva.

analyzed: yat na pṛthagjana gocaraḥ na ārya gocaraḥ
translated: The domain that is neither the domain of ordinary beings nor the domain of the noble ones,

analyzed: ayam bodhisatvasya gocaraḥ

analyzed: ayam bodhisatvasya gocaraḥ

analyzed: ayam bodhisatvasya gocaraḥ

analyzed: yat pratītyasamutpāda gocaraḥ ca sarva dṛṣṭi vigata gocaraḥ ca

analyzed: ayam bodhisatvasya gocaraḥ

analyzed: ayam bodhisatvasya gocaraḥ
translated: This is the domain of the bodhisattva.

analyzed: ayam bodhisatvasya gocaraḥ

analyzed: ayam bodhisatvasya gocaraḥ

analyzed: saṃvāsa arthikāḥ te

analyzed: dharmaḥ dṛṣṭa śruta mata vijñātaḥ
translated: The Dharma is not seen, heard, thought, or known.

analyzed: ye dṛṣṭa śruta mata vijñāteṣu caranti
translated: Those who practice in what is seen, heard, thought, or known

analyzed: na te dharma arthikāḥ
translated: are not seekers of the Dharma.

analyzed: dṛṣṭa śruta mata vijñāta arthikāḥ te
translated: They are seekers of what is seen, heard, thought, or known.

analyzed: dharmaḥ bhadanta śāriputra asaṃskṛtaḥ saṃskṛta apagataḥ
translated: The Dharma, Venerable Śāriputra, is unconditioned, free from conditioned things.

analyzed: ye saṃskṛta gocarāḥ
translated: Those who have the conditioned as their sphere

analyzed: na te dharma arthikāḥ
translated: are not seekers of the Dharma.

analyzed: saṃskṛta udgrahaṇa arthikāḥ te
translated: They are seekers of the grasping of the conditioned.

original: tasmād iha bhadantaśāriputra dharmārthikena te bhavitukāmena sarvadharmānarthikena bhavitavyam /
analyzed: tasmāt iha bhadanta śāriputra dharma arthikena te bhavitu kāmena sarva dharma anarthikena bhavitavyam
translated: Therefore, Venerable Śāriputra, one who wishes to be a seeker of the Dharma here should be a seeker of the meaning of all dharmas.

original: iha dharmanirdeśe nirdiśyamāne pañcānāṃ devaputraśatānāṃ dharmeṣu dharmacakṣur viśuddham /
analyzed: iha dharma nirdeśe nirdiśyamāne pañcānām devaputra śatānām dharmeṣu dharma cakṣuḥ viśuddham
translated: When this teaching of the Dharma was being given, the Dharma-eye for the discernment of dharmas was purified for five hundred gods regarding dharmas.

original: Vkn / atha vimalakīrtir licchavir mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtam āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Licchavi Vimalakīrti said to Mañjuśrī, the crown prince:

original: tvaṃ mañjuśrīḥ daśasu dikṣv asaṃkhyeyeṣu buddhakṣetraśatasahasreṣu buddhakṣetracārikāṃ carasi /
analyzed: tvam mañjuśrīḥ daśasu dikṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu buddhakṣetra śata sahasreṣu buddhakṣetra cārikām carasi
translated: Mañjuśrī, you go to hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of buddha-fields in the ten directions, traversing them with the speed of thought.

original: tat katarasmin buddhakṣetre tvayā sarvaviśiṣṭāni sarvaguṇopetāni siṃhāsanāni dṛṣṭāni /
analyzed: tat katarasmin buddhakṣetre tvayā sarva viśiṣṭāni sarva guṇa upetāni siṃhāsanāni dṛṣṭāni
translated: In which buddha-field did you see the lion-thrones endowed with all the best and most excellent qualities?

original: evam ukte mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūto vimalakīrtiṃ licchavim etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ vimalakīrtim licchavim etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the crown prince Mañjuśrī said to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti:

original: asti kulaputra pūrve digbhāge ṣaṭtriṃśadgaṅgānadīvālikāsamāni buddhakṣetrāṇy atikramya merudhvajā nāma lokadhātuḥ /
analyzed: asti kula putra pūrve digbhāge ṣaṭtriṃśat gaṅgā nadī vālikā samāni buddhakṣetrāṇi atikramya merudhvajāḥ nāma lokadhātuḥ
translated: “Noble sir, in the eastern direction, beyond buddhafields equal to the atoms in thirty-two buddhafields, there is a world-system called Merudhvaja,

original: tatra merupradīparājo nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhas tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati /
analyzed: tatra merupradīparājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tiṣṭhati dhriyate yāpayati
translated: and in it a buddhafield of the Tathagata Meru­pradīpa­raja, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One.

analyzed: tasya tathāgatasya caturaśīti yojana śata sahasraḥ ātmabhāvaḥ
translated: The body of that Tathagata is eighty-four thousand leagues tall.

analyzed: aṣṭaṣaṣṭi yojana śata sahasram tasya bhagavataḥ siṃhāsanam
translated: The lion-throne of that Blessed One is sixty-eight thousand leagues high.

analyzed: teṣām ca bodhisatvānām catvāriṃśat yojana śata sahasraḥ ātmabhāvaḥ
translated: The bodies of those bodhisattvas are forty thousand leagues tall.

analyzed: catustriṃśat yojana śata sahāsrāni teṣām bodhisatvānām siṃhāsanāni
translated: The lion-thrones of those bodhisattvas are thirty-two thousand leagues high.

original: merudhvajāyāṃ lokadhātau tasya bhagavato merupradīparājasya tathāgatasya buddhakṣetre sarvaviśiṣṭāni sarvagunopetāni siṃhāsanāni /
analyzed: merudhvajāyām lokadhātau tasya bhagavataḥ merupradīparājasya tathāgatasya buddhakṣetre sarva viśiṣṭāni sarva gunā upetāni siṃhāsanāni
translated: In the world-system Merudhvaja, in the buddhafield of the Blessed One, the Tathagata Meru­pradīpa­raja, the lion-thrones are the most excellent and endowed with all good qualities.”

original: Vkn / atha vimalakīrtir licchavis tasyāṃ velāyāṃ tathārūpaṃ samanvāhāraṃ samanvāharati sma /
analyzed: atha vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ tasyām velāyām tathārūpam samanvāhāram samanvāharati sma
translated: Vkn 1. Then the Licchavi Vimalakīrti entered into a concentration, and performed a miraculous feat such that those bodhisattvas and those great disciples were enabled to see the universe called Sarva­gandha­sugandhā, which is located in the direction of the zenith, ninety-one quintillion world-realms away from here.

analyzed: tādṛśam ca ṛddhi abhisaṃskāram abhisaṃskṛtavān
translated: He performed such a miracle.

original: yat tato merudhvajālokadhātor dvātriṃśatsiṃhāsanaśatasahasrāṇi tena bhagavatā merupradīparājena tathāgatena preṣitāni /🔽tāvad udviddhāni tāvad vistīrṇāni tāvad darśanīyāni yad apūrvāṇi tair bodhisatvais taiś ca mahāśrāvakais taiś ca śakrabrahmalokapālair devaputraiś
analyzed: yat tatas merudhvajā lokadhātoḥ dvātriṃśat siṃhāsana śata sahasrāṇi tena bhagavatā merupradīparājena tathāgatena preṣitāni  tāvat udviddhāni tāvat vistīrṇāni tāvat darśanīyāni yat apūrvāṇi taiḥ bodhisatvaiḥ taiḥ ca mahāśrāvakaiḥ taiḥ ca śakra brahma lokapālaiḥ devaputraiḥ
translated: Thirty-two hundred thousand lion thrones were sent by the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Meru-pradīpa-rāja, from that world system Meru-dhvaja.🔽They were so high, so wide, so beautiful that the previously unseen bodhisattvas, the great disciples, the Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, and gods

analyzed: ca
translated: had never seen anything like them.

original: tāny upary antarīkṣeṇāgatya vimalakirter licchaver niveśane pratyatiṣṭhan /
analyzed: tāni upari antarīkṣeṇa āgatya vimalakirteḥ licchaveḥ niveśane pratyatiṣṭhan
translated: They came through the sky above and settled in the house of Vimalakīrti.

original: tac ca gṛhaṃ tāvad vistīrṇaṃ saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: tat ca gṛham tāvat vistīrṇam saṃdṛśyate
translated: And that house appeared to be large enough to contain them all.

analyzed: yatra tāni dvātriṃśat siṃhāsana śata sahasrāṇi vicitrāṇi an utpīḍana tayā
translated: There were thirty-two hundred thousand lion thrones, variously adorned, without crowding.

original: na ca vaiśālyā mahānagaryā āvaraṇaṃ kṛtam /🔽na jambūdvīpasya /
analyzed: na ca vaiśālyāḥ mahā nagaryāḥ āvaraṇam kṛtam  na jambūdvīpasya
translated: And yet the great city of Vaiśālī was not obstructed in any way.🔽And neither was the Rose Apple Continent.

analyzed: na cāturdvīpikasya āvaraṇam
translated: And neither was the Four Continent World-system.

original: sarve te tathaiva saṃdṛśyante yathā pūrvaṃ tathā paścāt /
analyzed: sarve te tathā eva saṃdṛśyante yathā pūrvam tathā paścāt
translated: All of them were visible just as before.

original: Vkn / atha vimalakīrtir licchavir mañjuśriyaṃ kumārabhūtam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ mañjuśriyam kumāra bhūtam etat avocat
translated: Then the Licchavi Vimalakīrti said to Mañjuśrī, the crown prince:

original: niṣida tvaṃ mañjuśrīḥ siṃhāsane sārdham etair bodhisatvaiḥ /
analyzed: niṣida tvam mañjuśrīḥ siṃhāsane sārdham etaiḥ bodhisatvaiḥ
translated: “Mañjuśrī, sit down on this lion-throne together with these bodhisattvas.

original: tādṛśāṃś cātmabhāvān adhitiṣṭhata yat siṃhāsaneṣv anurūpāḥ syuḥ /
analyzed: tādṛśān ca ātmabhāvān adhitiṣṭhata yat siṃhāsaneṣu anurūpāḥ syuḥ
translated: And assume such bodies as will be fitting for these lion-thrones.”

original: atha ye 'bhijñāpratilabdhā bodhisatvās te dvācatvāriṃśadyojanaśatasahasram ātmabhāvam adhiṣṭhāya teṣu siṃhāsaneṣu nisīdanti sma /
analyzed: atha ye bhijñā pratilabdhāḥ bodhisatvāḥ te dvācatvāriṃśat yojana śata sahasram ātma bhāvam adhiṣṭhāya teṣu siṃhāsaneṣu nisīdanti sma
translated: Then those bodhisattvas who had attained the superknowledges increased their bodies to four hundred leagues in height and sat down on those lion-thrones.

original: ye cādikarmikā bodhisatvās te na śaknuvanti sma teṣu siṃhāsaneṣu niṣattum /
analyzed: ye ca ādi karmikāḥ bodhisatvāḥ te na śaknuvanti sma teṣu siṃhāsaneṣu niṣattum
translated: But the bodhisattvas who were beginners could not sit down on those lion-thrones.

original: atha vimalakīrtir licchavir āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ āyuṣmantam śāriputram āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Licchavi Vimalakīrti said to the venerable Śāriputra:

analyzed: niṣīda bhadanta śāriputra siṃhāsane
translated: “Reverend Śāriputra, sit down on a lion-throne.”

original: āha / na śaknomi satpuruṣa niṣattum uccāni pragṛhitāni cemāni siṃhāsanāni /🔽āha / tena hi bhadantaśāriputra tasyaiva bhagavato merupradīparājasya tathāgatasya namaskāraṃ kuru /
analyzed: āha na śaknomi sat puruṣa niṣattum uccāni pragṛhitāni ca imāni siṃhāsanāni 🔽āha tena hi bhadanta śāriputra tasya eva bhagavataḥ merupradīparājasya tathāgatasya namaskāram kuru
translated: Śāriputra replied: “Good man, I am unable to sit down on a lion-throne.”🔽Vimalakīrti said: “Reverend Śāriputra, do not be afraid.

analyzed: tatas śakṣyasi niṣattum
translated: Then you will be able to sit down.”

original: atha te mahāśrāvakās tasya bhagavato merupradīparājasya tathāgatasya namaskāraṃ kurvanti sma /
analyzed: atha te mahāśrāvakāḥ tasya bhagavataḥ merupradīparājasya tathāgatasya namaskāram kurvanti sma
translated: Then his great disciples bowed to the Blessed One, the Tathāgata Meru-pradīpa-rāja,

original: te tatra paścāt teṣu siṃhāsaneṣu nyaṣīdan /🔽Vkn / athāyuṣmāñ śāriputro vimalakirtiṃ licchavim evam āha /
analyzed: te tatra paścāt teṣu siṃhāsaneṣu nyaṣīdan  atha āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ vimalakirtim licchavim evam āha
translated: and they sat down on those lion thrones.

original: āścaryaṃ kulaputra yad ihaivaṃ parītte gṛha imānīyanti siṃhāsanasahasrāṇy evam uccāny evaṃ pragṛhītāni vicitrāṇi /🔽na ca vaiśālyā mahānagaryā āvaraṇaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: āścaryam kula putra yat iha evam parītte gṛhe imā ānīyanti siṃhāsana sahasrāṇi evam uccāni evam pragṛhītāni vicitrāṇi  na ca vaiśālyāḥ mahā nagaryāḥ āvaraṇam kṛtam
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti, “Good sir, it is astonishing that in this small house you are able to accommodate so many persons, and each one has such an enormous throne, and there is still space left over.

analyzed: na jambūdvīpasya  na grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra rājadhānīnām
translated: And yet the great city of Vaiśālī is not crowded, nor is the land of Jambudvīpa.

analyzed: na cāturmahādvīpikasya kiṃcid āvaraṇam
translated: Nor is there any difference in the size of the great ocean, of Mount Sumeru, king of mountains, or of the three-thousand-great-thousandfold world system.

analyzed: na deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoragāṇām āvaraṇam kṛtam
translated: Nor is there any difference in the size of the abodes of the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, and asuras.

original: tathaiva saṃdṛśyante yathā pūrvaṃ tathā paścāt /
analyzed: tathā eva saṃdṛśyante yathā pūrvam tathā paścāt
translated: They are seen just as they were before.”

analyzed: vimalakīrtiḥ āha
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, “Śāriputra, take an example: A magician or magician’s apprentice, standing at a crossroads, might enchant the people with a magic spell and a magic device, and produce an illusion in which he feeds many hundreds of thousands of people with many courses of food, both raw and cooked.

original: asti bhadantaśāriputra tathāgatānāṃ bodhisatvānāṃ cācintyo nāma vimokṣaḥ /🔽yatrācintyavimokṣe pratiṣṭhito bodhisatvaḥ sumeruṃ parvatarājaṃ tāvad uccaṃ tāvat pragṛhītaṃ tāvad udviddhaṃ tāvad vistīrṇaṃ sarṣapaphalakośe
analyzed: asti bhadanta śāriputra tathāgatānām bodhisatvānām ca acintyaḥ nāma vimokṣaḥ  yatra acintya vimokṣe pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisatvaḥ sumerum parvata rājam tāvat uccam tāvat pragṛhītam tāvat udviddham tāvat vistīrṇam sarṣapa phalakośe
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, there is an inconceivable liberation of the Tathāgatas and Bodhisattvas.

analyzed: praveśayet  na ca sarṣapa phala kośam vivardhayet
translated: In that inconceivable liberation, a Bodhisattva, having taken Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, so high, so vast, so lofty, and so wide, would place it in a mustard seed.🔽He would not enlarge the mustard seed,

analyzed: na ca sumerum hāpayet
translated: nor would he diminish Mount Sumeru.

analyzed: tām ca kriyām ādarśayet
translated: He would demonstrate that action.

original: na cāturmahārājakāyikā devās trayastriṃśato vā jānīran ḥ kasmin vayaṃ prakṣiptāḥ /
analyzed: na cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ devāḥ trayastriṃśataḥ vā jānīran kasmin vayam prakṣiptāḥ
translated: The gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings or the Thirty-Three would not know: Where have we been placed?

original: anye ca satvā ṛddhivineyā jānīyuḥ paśyeyus taṃ sumeruṃ parvatarājaṃ sarśapaphalakośapraviṣṭam /
analyzed: anye ca satvāḥ ṛddhi vineyāḥ jānīyuḥ paśyeyuḥ tam sumerum parvata rājam sarśapa phalakośa praviṣṭam
translated: Other beings to be guided by miracles would know and see that Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, had entered into the mustard seed.

original: ayaṃ bhadantaśāriputra bodhisatvānām acintyasya vimokṣasya viṣayapraveśaḥ /
analyzed: ayam bhadanta śāriputra bodhisatvānām acintyasya vimokṣasya viṣaya praveśaḥ
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, this is the entry into the domain of the inconceivable liberation of the Bodhisattvas.

original: Vkn / punar aparaṃ bhadantaśāriputra acintyavimokṣapratiṣṭhito bodhisatvo yaś caturṣu mahāsamudreṣv apskandhas tam ekasmin romakūpe prakṣipet
analyzed: punar aparam bhadanta śāriputra acintya vimokṣa pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisatvaḥ yaḥ caturṣu mahā samudreṣu ap skandhaḥ tam ekasmin romakūpe prakṣipet
translated: Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva established in the inconceivable liberation would pour into a single pore of his skin all the water in the great oceans,

original: na ca matsyakacchapaśiśumāramaṇḍūkānām anyeṣāṃ vaudakānāṃ prāṇināṃ pīḍā bhavet /
analyzed: na ca matsya kacchapa śiśumāra maṇḍūkānām anyeṣām vaudakānām prāṇinām pīḍā bhavet
translated: without the fish, turtles, crocodiles, and other water creatures being harmed,

original: na ca nāgayakṣagandharvāsurāṇām evaṃ bhavet ḥ kasmin vayaṃ prakṣiptāḥ /
analyzed: na ca nāga yakṣa gandharva asurāṇām evam bhavet kasmin vayam prakṣiptāḥ
translated: and without the nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, and asuras even knowing, “In which place have we been placed?”

analyzed: sā ca kriyā prajñāyeta
translated: And that action would be known.

original: na ca kaścit satvo vihiṃsito viheṭhito vā bhavet /
analyzed: na ca kaścid satvaḥ vihiṃsitaḥ viheṭhitaḥ vā bhavet
translated: And no being would be harmed or injured.

original: Vkn / imaṃ ca trisāhasramahāsāhasraṃ lokadhātuṃ bhārgavacakram iva parigṛhya dakṣiṇe pāṇāv avabhrāmya gaṅgānadīvālikāsamān lokadhātūn kṣipet
analyzed: imam ca tri sāhasra mahā sāhasram lokadhātum bhārgava cakram iva parigṛhya dakṣiṇe pāṇau avabhrāmya gaṅgā nadī vālikā samān lokadhātūn kṣipet
translated: And he would take this great trichiliocosm in his right hand and, whirling it about as a potter whirls his wheel, would hurl it beyond universes as numerous as the sands of the Ganges,

original: na ca satvā jānīran ḥ kasmin vayaṃ nītāḥ /
analyzed: na ca satvāḥ jānīran kasmin vayam nītāḥ
translated: and the beings there would not even know, “In which place have we been placed?

analyzed: kutas vā āgatāḥ iti
translated: Or from which place have we come?”

analyzed: punar api ca ānāyya yathāsthānam sthāpayet
translated: And he would bring them back again and set them in their original places.

analyzed: na ca gamana āgamanam saṃjānīran
translated: And they would not even know whether they had been moved or not.

analyzed: sā ca kriyā saṃdṛśyeta
translated: And that action would be seen.

original: Vkn / punar aparaṃ bhadantaśāriputra santi satvā apramāṇasaṃsāravainayikāḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam bhadanta śāriputra santi satvāḥ apramāṇa saṃsāra vainayikāḥ
translated: Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra, there are beings who are to be guided by immeasurable saṃsāra,

analyzed: santi saṃkṣipta saṃsāra vainayikāḥ
translated: and there are those who are to be guided by condensed saṃsāra.

original: tatrācintyavimokṣapratiṣṭhito bodhisatvo 'pramāṇasaṃsāravainayikānāṃ satvānāṃ vainayikavaśam upādāya saptarātraṃ kalpam atikrāntam ādarśayet
analyzed: tatra acintya vimokṣa pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisatvaḥ pramāṇa saṃsāra vainayikānām satvānām vainayika vaśam upādāya sapta rātram kalpam atikrāntam ādarśayet
translated: There, the bodhisattva established in the inconceivable liberation, for the sake of guiding beings who are to be guided by immeasurable saṃsāra, would display a night of seven days as having passed a kalpa,

original: saṃkṣiptasaṃsāravainayikānāṃ satvānāṃ vainayikavaśam upādāya kalpaṃ saptarātram atikrāntam ādarśayet /
analyzed: saṃkṣipta saṃsāra vainayikānām satvānām vainayika vaśam upādāya kalpam sapta rātram atikrāntam ādarśayet
translated: and for the sake of guiding beings who are to be guided by condensed saṃsāra, he would display a kalpa as having passed a night of seven days.

original: tatrāpramāṇasaṃsāravineyāḥ satvāḥ saptarātraṃ kalpam atikrāntaṃ saṃjānīran I saṃkṣiptasaṃsāravineyāḥ satvāḥ kalpaṃ saptarātram atikrāntaṃ saṃjānīran
analyzed: tatra apramāṇa saṃsāra vineyāḥ satvāḥ sapta rātram kalpam atikrāntam saṃjānīran i saṃkṣipta saṃsāra vineyāḥ satvāḥ kalpam sapta rātram atikrāntam saṃjānīran
translated: There, beings to be guided by immeasurable saṃsāra would perceive a night of seven days as having passed a kalpa, and beings to be guided by condensed saṃsāra would perceive a kalpa as having passed a night of seven days.

original: Vkn / iti hy acintyavimokṣapratiṣṭhito bodhisatvaḥ sarvabuddhakṣetraguṇavyūhān ekasmin buddhakṣetre saṃdarśayati /
analyzed: iti hi acintya vimokṣa pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisatvaḥ sarva buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūhān ekasmin buddhakṣetre saṃdarśayati
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva established in the inconceivable liberation displays all the adornments of the qualities of all buddha-fields in a single buddha-field,

original: sarvasatvān api dakṣiṇe karatale pratiṣṭhāpya cittajāyikayarddhyā kramet /
analyzed: sarva satvān api dakṣiṇe kara tale pratiṣṭhāpya cittajāyikayā ṛddhyā kramet
translated: and having established all beings in the right palm, he would travel by the psychic power of mind-born flight.

analyzed: sarva buddhakṣetreṣu ca saṃdarśanam dadyāt
translated: He would be able to show himself in all the Buddha-fields,

original: na caikato 'pi kṣetrāc calet /🔽yāvatyaś ca daśasu dikṣu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ pūjā vartante /
analyzed: na ca ekatas kṣetrāt calet  yāvatyaḥ ca daśasu dikṣu buddhānām bhagavatām pūjāḥ vartante
translated: without moving from any one of those fields.

original: tāḥ sarvā ekaromakūpa ādarśayet /🔽yāvantaś ca daśasu dikṣu candrasūryās tārārūpāni ca /
analyzed: tāḥ sarvāḥ eka romakūpe ādarśayet  yāvantaḥ ca daśasu dikṣu candra sūryāḥ tārā rūpāni ca
translated: And he would be able to show in a single pore of his skin all the worship that is being offered to the Blessed Buddhas in all the ten directions.

original: tāny api sarvāṇy ekaromakūpa ādarśayet /🔽yāvatyaś ca daśasu dikṣu vātamaṇḍalyaḥ pravānti /
analyzed: tāni api sarvāṇi eka romakūpe ādarśayet  yāvatyaḥ ca daśasu dikṣu vāta maṇḍalyaḥ pravānti
translated: And he would be able to show in a single pore of his skin all the moons, suns, and stars in all the ten directions.

analyzed: tāḥ api sarvāḥ mukha dvāre praveśayet
translated: And he would be able to make all the wind-circles in all the ten directions enter his mouth,

analyzed: na ca asya kāyaḥ vikīryeta
translated: without his body becoming any larger,

original: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre tṛṇavanaspatayo nameyuḥ /🔽Vkn / yāni ca daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetrāṇy uddahyante kalpoddāhena /
analyzed: na ca tatra buddhakṣetre tṛṇa vanaspatayaḥ nameyuḥ  yāni ca daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetrāṇi uddahyante kalpa uddāhena
translated: and without the grass, trees, and forests in that Buddha-field being damaged.

original: tad api sarvam agniskandhaṃ svamukhe prakṣipet /🔽yac ca tena karma kartavyaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: tat api sarvam agni skandham sva mukhe prakṣipet  yat ca tena karma kartavyam bhavet
translated: And he would be able to put into his mouth all the masses of fire that burn in the ten directions when the eon is destroyed,

analyzed: tat ca kuryāt
translated: and he would be able to do whatever work needs to be done with fire.

original: yac cāvastād gaṅgānadīvālikākoṭīsameṣu buddhakṣetreṣv atikramya buddhakṣetram /
analyzed: yat ca avastāt gaṅgā nadī vālikā koṭī sameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu atikramya buddhakṣetram
translated: And he would be able to show in a single pore of his skin all the Buddha-fields that lie beyond as many Buddha-fields as there are sands in the Ganges River in the western direction.

original: tad abhyutkṣipyordhaṃ digbhāgaṃ gaṅgānadīvālikākoṭīsameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pratiṣṭhāpayet /
analyzed: tat abhyutkṣipya ūrdham digbhāgam gaṅgā nadī vālikā koṭī sameṣu buddhakṣetreṣu pratiṣṭhāpayet
translated: and having lifted it up, he would place it in buddha-fields as numerous as the sands of the Ganges in the upward direction.

original: tadyathāpi nāma balavān puruṣaḥ sūcyagreṇa badarīpatram utkṣipet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma balavān puruṣaḥ sūci agreṇa badarī patram utkṣipet
translated: Just as a strong man might lift a myrobalan fruit with the tip of a blade of grass.

original: Vkn / evam acṃtyavimokṣapratiṣṭhito bodhisatvaḥ sarvasatvāni cakravartyādirūpāṇy adhitiṣṭhet /
analyzed: evam evam acṃtya vimokṣa pratiṣṭhitaḥ bodhisatvaḥ sarva satvāni cakravarti ādi rūpāṇi adhitiṣṭhet
translated: In the same way, a bodhisattva established in the inconceivable liberation could establish all beings in the form of a universal monarch, etc.

original: Vkn / yāvantaś ca daśasu dikṣu śabdāvabhāsāḥ śabdaprajñāptayaḥ /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ ca daśasu dikṣu śabda avabhāsāḥ śabda prajñāptayaḥ
translated: And all the sounds, appearances of sound, and designations of sound in the ten directions,

original: tāḥ sarvā hīnamadhyaviśiṣṭānāṃ satvānāṃ sarvabuddhaghoṣarutaracitāny adhitiṣṭhan /
analyzed: tāḥ sarvāḥ hīna madhya viśiṣṭānām satvānām sarva buddha ghoṣa ruta racitāni adhitiṣṭhan
translated: he could establish them all as the sounds of the voices of all the Buddhas, for beings of low, middling, and superior faculties.

analyzed: tatas ca ruta ghoṣāt anitya duḥkha śūnya anātma śabda rutāni niścārayet
translated: And from those sounds and voices, he could cause the sounds of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self to emerge.

original: yāvadbhiś cākāranirdeśair daśasu dikṣu buddhā bhagavanto dharmaṃ deśayanti /
analyzed: yāvadbhiḥ ca ākāra nirdeśaiḥ daśasu dikṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ dharmam deśayanti
translated: And with however many descriptions of aspects the Blessed Buddhas in the ten directions teach the Dharma,

analyzed: tān tatas ruta nirghoṣān niścārayet
translated: he could cause those sounds and voices to emerge.

original: Vkn / ayaṃ bhadantaśāriputra acintyavimokṣapratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisatvānāṃ yatkiṃcinmātro viṣayāvatāranirdeśaḥ /
analyzed: ayam bhadanta śāriputra acintya vimokṣa pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisatvānām yat kiṃcid mātraḥ viṣaya avatāra nirdeśaḥ
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, this is just a brief explanation of the domain of entry for bodhisattvas established in the inconceivable liberation.

original: api tu kalpam ahaṃ bhadantaśāriputra kalpāvaśesaṃ vācintyavimokṣapratiṣṭhitānāṃ bodhisatvānāṃ viṣayānāṃ viṣayāvatāranirdeśaṃ nirdiśeyam /🔽ato vottari /
analyzed: api tu kalpam aham bhadanta śāriputra vā acintya vimokṣa pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisatvānām viṣayānām viṣaya avatāra nirdeśam nirdiśeyam  a taḥ vā uttari
translated: But, Venerable Śāriputra, I could explain for an eon or the remainder of an eon the domain of the bodhisattvas established in the inconceivable liberation, entering into the domain of the inconceivable.🔽But even then, I would not come to the end of it.

original: Vkn / atha khalu sthaviro mahākāśyapa imaṃ bodhisatvānām acintyavimokṣaṃ śrutvāścaryaprāptaḥ sthaviraṃ śāriputram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu sthaviraḥ mahākāśyapaḥ imam bodhisatvānām acintya vimokṣam śrutvā āścarya prāptaḥ sthaviram śāriputram etat avocat
translated: Then the elder Mahākāśyapa, having heard this inconceivable liberation of the bodhisattvas, was amazed and said to the elder Śāriputra:

original: tadyathāpi nāma āyuṣmañ śāriputra jātyandhasya puruṣasya purastāt kaścid eva sarvarūpagatāny upadarśayet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma āyuṣmam śāriputra jāti andhasya puruṣasya purastāt kaścid eva sarva rūpa gatāni upadarśayet
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, it is as if someone were to show all forms to a man born blind,

original: na ca tatra sa jātyandha ekarūpam api paśyet /
analyzed: na ca tatra sa jāti andhaḥ eka rūpam api paśyet
translated: and the man born blind would not see even one form.

original: evam eva āyuṣmañ śāriputra ihācintyavimokṣe nirdiśyamāne sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhā iha jātyandhā iva cakṣurvihīnā ekasminn apy acintyakāraṇe
analyzed: evam eva āyuṣmam śāriputra iha acintya vimokṣe nirdiśyamāne sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhāḥ iha jāti andhāḥ iva cakṣuḥ vihīnāḥ ekasmin api acintya kāraṇe
translated: In the same way, Venerable Śāriputra, when this inconceivable liberation is being taught, all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, like the man born blind, are deprived of the eye and do not see even one cause of the inconceivable,

analyzed: na pratyakṣāḥ
translated: not even one.

original: ko nāma vidvān imam acintyaṃ vimokṣaṃ śrutvānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittaṃ notpādayet /
analyzed: kaḥ nāma vidvān imam acintyam vimokṣam śrutvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam na utpādayet
translated: What wise person, having heard this inconceivable liberation, would not conceive the spirit of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment?

original: tat kiṃ nu bhūyaḥ kariṣyāmo 'tyantopahatendriyā dagdhavinaṣṭānīva bījāny abhājanībhūtā iha mahāyāne /
analyzed: tat kim nu bhūyas kariṣyāmaḥ tyanta upahata indriyāḥ dagdha vinaṣṭāni iva bījāni a bhājanībhūtāḥ iha mahāyāne
translated: What else can we do, with our faculties so utterly impaired, like seeds burned by fire, unfit for the Great Vehicle?

original: sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhair imaṃ dharmanirdeśaṃ śrutvā rudadbhis trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātur vijñāpayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhaiḥ imam dharma nirdeśam śrutvā rudadbhiḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ vijñāpayitavyaḥ
translated: All the Disciples and Solitary Sages, having heard this teaching of the Dharma, should weep, and the world system of a billion worlds should be informed.

original: sarvabodhisatvaiś ca pramuditair imam acintyavimokṣaṃ śrutvā mūrdhnā saṃpratyetavyaḥ /
analyzed: sarva bodhisatvaiḥ ca pramuditaiḥ imam acintya vimokṣam śrutvā mūrdhnā saṃpratyetavyaḥ
translated: And all the Bodhisattvas, having joyfully heard this inconceivable liberation, should accept it on their heads.

analyzed: adhimukti balam ca saṃjanayitavyam
translated: And they should generate the power of faith.

analyzed: yasya eṣā acintya vimokṣa adhimuktiḥ sarva mārāḥ tasya kim kariṣyanti
translated: What can all the Maras do to one who has faith in this inconceivable liberation?

original: imaṃ nirdeśaṃ nirdiśataḥ sthavirasya mahākāśyapasya dvātriṃśatā devaputrasahasrair anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittāny utpannāni /🔽Vkn / atha vimalakīrtir licchaviḥ sthaviraṃ mahākāśyapam evam āha /
analyzed: imam nirdeśam nirdiśataḥ sthavirasya mahākāśyapasya dvātriṃśatā devaputra sahasraiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpannāni  atha vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ sthaviram mahākāśyapam evam āha
translated: When the Elder Mahakasyapa was giving this teaching, thirty-two thousand gods generated the intention to achieve supreme enlightenment.

original: yāvanto bhadantamahākāśyapa daśasu dikṣv aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu mārā māratvaṃ kārayanti /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ bhadanta mahākāśyapa daśasu dikṣu aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu mārāḥ māra tvam kārayanti
translated: Then the Licchavi Vimalakirti said to the Elder Mahakasyapa, “Reverend Mahakasyapa, the Maras who play the same tricks on the Bodhisattvas as the Mara Paplyas does on the Tathagatas are innumerable.

original: sarve te yadbhūyasācintyavimokṣapratiṣṭhitā bodhisatvā upāyakauśalyena satvaparipācanāya māratvaṃ kārayanti /
analyzed: sarve te yat bhūyasā acintya vimokṣa pratiṣṭhitāḥ bodhisatvāḥ upāya kauśalyena satva paripācanāya māra tvam kārayanti
translated: All of them, for the most part, are established in the inconceivable liberation, and by skillful means, for the sake of ripening beings, they act as Māra.

original: yāvadbhir bhadantamahākāśyapa daśasu dikṣv aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu bodhisatvā yācanakair
analyzed: yāvadbhiḥ bhadanta mahākāśyapa daśasu dikṣu aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu bodhisatvāḥ yācanakaiḥ
translated: As many bodhisattvas as there are in the immeasurable world systems in the ten directions, who are asked by beggars

original: yācyante hastapādān vā karṇanāsaṃ vā śoṇitaṃ snāyuṃ vāsthimajjānaṃ vā netrāṇi vottamāṅgāni
analyzed: yācyante hasta pādān vā karṇa nāsam vā śoṇitam snāyum vā asthi majjānam vā netrāṇi vā uttamāṅgāni
translated: for their hands, feet, ears, nose, blood, sinews, bones, marrow, eyes, heads, limbs,

original: śirāṃsi vāṅgapratyaṅgāni vā rājyarāṣṭrajanapadān vā bhāryāputraduhitṝr vā dāsadāsīr
analyzed: śirāṃsi vā aṅga pratyaṅgāni vā rājya rāṣṭra janapadān vā bhāryā putra duhitṝr vā dāsa dāsīḥ
translated: major and minor parts of the body, kingdoms, countries, villages, wives, sons, daughters, slaves,

analyzed: vā haya gaja ratha vāhanāni vā suvarṇa maṇi muktā vaiḍūrya śaṅkha śilā pravāḍa maṇi ratna jātam
translated: horses, elephants, chariots, vehicles, gold, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals, corals, precious stones,

analyzed: vā anna pānāni rasān vā
translated: food, drink, flavors,

analyzed: vastrāṇi ca utpīḍya yācyante
translated: and are pressed and asked for clothes,

original: sarve te yācanakā yadbhūyasācintyavimokṣapratiṣṭhitā bodhisatvā upāyakauśalyenemāṃ dṛḍhādhyāśayatāṃ darśayanti /
analyzed: sarve te yācanakāḥ yat bhūyasā acintya vimokṣa pratiṣṭhitāḥ bodhisatvāḥ upāya kauśalyena imām dṛḍha adhyāśaya tām darśayanti
translated: all those beggars, for the most part, are established in the inconceivable liberation, and by skillful means, they show this firm resolve.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: ugratapaso hi bhadantamahākāśyapa bodhisatvās ta evaṃ darśayanti /
analyzed: ugra tapasaḥ hi bhadanta mahākāśyapa bodhisatvāḥ te evam darśayanti
translated: For, reverend Mahakasyapa, the bodhisattvas are of fierce austerities, and they show themselves thus.

analyzed: na asti hi prākṛta janasya asthāna anavakāśa kṛtasya bodhisatvam utpīḍayitum
translated: For there is no opportunity for an ordinary person to oppress a bodhisattva who has not created an opportunity.

original: tadyathāpi nāma bhadantamahākāśyapa na śaktir asti khadyotakasya sūryamaṇḍalaprabhām abhibhavitum /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhadanta mahākāśyapa na śaktiḥ asti khadyotakasya sūrya maṇḍala prabhām abhibhavitum
translated: Just as, reverend Mahakasyapa, a glowworm does not have the power to overpower the radiance of the sun's orb,

original: evam eva bhadantamahākāśyapa na śaktir asti prākṛtasya janasya bodhisatvenānavakāśakṛtasyopasaṃkramituṃ yācituṃ vā /
analyzed: evam eva bhadanta mahākāśyapa na śaktiḥ asti prākṛtasya janasya bodhisatvena an avakāśa kṛtasya upasaṃkramitum yācitum vā
translated: in the same way, reverend Mahakasyapa, an ordinary person does not have the power to approach or request a bodhisattva who has not created an opportunity.

original: tadyathā bhadantamahākāśyapa yo hastināgasya prahāro na sa śakyo gardabhena soḍhum /
analyzed: tat yathā bhadanta mahākāśyapa yaḥ hasti nāgasya prahāraḥ na sa śakyaḥ gardabhena soḍhum
translated: Just as, reverend Mahakasyapa, a blow from an elephant is not something a donkey can bear,

original: evam eva bhadantamahākāśyapa na śakyam abodhisatvena bodhisatvasyotpīḍanaṃ soḍhum /
analyzed: evam eva bhadanta mahākāśyapa na śakyam a bodhisatvena bodhisatvasya utpīḍanam soḍhum
translated: in the same way, reverend Mahakasyapa, it is not possible for one who is not a bodhisattva to bear the oppression of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: bodhisatvaḥ eva bodhisatva utpīḍām sahate
translated: Only a bodhisattva can bear the oppression of a bodhisattva.

analyzed: ayam bhadanta mahākāśyapa acintya vimokṣa pratiṣṭhitānām bodhisatvānām upāya jñāna bala praveśaḥ
translated: This, reverend Mahakasyapa, is the entry into the knowledge and power of means of the bodhisattvas who are established in the inconceivable liberation.

analyzed: acintyavimokṣasaṃdarśana parivartaḥ pañcamaḥ
translated: Chapter Five: The Display of the Inconceivable Liberation

original: Vkn / atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumārabhūto vimalakīrtiṃ licchavim etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu mañjuśrīḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ vimalakīrtim licchavim etat avocat
translated: Then the youthful Mañjuśrī said this to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti:

analyzed: katham sat puruṣa bodhisatvena sarva satvāḥ avekṣitavyāḥ
translated: “Good man, how should a bodhisattva regard all sentient beings?”

original: āha / tadyathāpi nāma mañjuśrīḥ vijñapuruṣa udakacandram avekṣeta /
analyzed: āha tat yathā api nāma mañjuśrīḥ vijña puruṣaḥ udaka candram avekṣeta
translated: He replied, “Mañjuśrī, just as a wise man would regard the reflection of the moon in water,

analyzed: evam bodhisatvena sarva satvāḥ avekṣitavyāḥ

analyzed: tat yathā api nāma mañjuśrīḥ ādarśa maṇḍale mukha maṇḍalam ālokayet

analyzed: ye nirabhimānikāḥ

translated: And, Reverend Śāriputra, when Śakra, Brahmā, the Lokapālas, the devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas enter this house,

analyzed: ayam prathamaḥ āścarya adbhutaḥ dharmaḥ

analyzed: ayam dvitīyaḥ āścarya adbhutaḥ dharmaḥ

analyzed: ayam tṛtīyaḥ āścarya adbhutaḥ dharmaḥ
translated: This is the third wonderful and marvelous thing.

analyzed: punar aparam bhadanta śāriputra idam gṛham satata samitam avirahitam dharma śravaṇena ṣaṣ pāramitā pratisaṃyuktayā kathayā a vivartya dharma kathayā

analyzed: ayam pañcamaḥ āścarya adbhutaḥ dharmaḥ
translated: This is the fifth wonderful and marvelous thing.

analyzed: ayam ṣaṣṭhaḥ āścarya adbhutaḥ dharmaḥ
translated: This is the sixth wonderful and marvelous thing.

analyzed: ayam aṣṭamaḥ āścarya adbhutaḥ dharmaḥ
translated: This is the eighth amazing and marvelous thing.

analyzed: āha paripūrṇāni me dvādaśa varṣāṇi upādāya strī bhāvam paryeṣamāṇāyāḥ na ca enam labhe  api ca bhadanta śāriputra yā māyākāreṇa strī nirmitā yaḥ tām evam vadet
translated: ” The goddess answered, “Although I have sought the female form for these twelve years, I have not yet found it.

analyzed: kim tvam strī bhāvam na nivartayasi iti
translated: Moreover, reverend Śāriputra, if a magician were to conjure up a woman, would you ask her, ‘Why do you not change this female body of yours?’

analyzed: sa kim vadet
translated: What do you think? Would that which is conjured up exist?

original: āha / na tasyāḥ kācit bhūtā pariniṣpattiḥ /
analyzed: āha na tasyāḥ kācid bhūtā pariniṣpattiḥ
translated: He said, “It has no real perfection at all.”

analyzed: śāriputraḥ devatārūpī āha
translated: Śāriputra in the form of a goddess said:

analyzed: na jāne kim vinivartayāmi iti
translated: “I don’t know what to turn back.”

analyzed: puruṣa rūpam antarhitam strī rūpam me nirvṛttam
translated: The male form disappeared and a female form appeared.

original: āha / yadi sthaviraḥ śakṣyati strībhāvaṃ vinivartayitum /
analyzed: āha yadi sthaviraḥ śakṣyati strī bhāvam vinivartayitum
translated: He said, “If the elder can turn back from being a woman,

analyzed: tatas sarvāḥ striyaḥ api strī bhāvam vinivartayiṣyanti
translated: then all women will also turn back from being women.”

original: yathā sthaviro na strī strīva saṃdṛśyate /

translated: Just as the elder did not appear as a woman, although he was seen as a woman.

translated: In the same way, the female form of all women is not a woman, and women are not seen as having a female form.

analyzed: idam saṃdhāya bhagavān āha
translated: With this in mind, the Blessed One said:

original: ḥsarvadharmā na strī na puruṣaḥ iti /
analyzed: ḥsarva dharmā na strī na puruṣaḥ iti
translated: All dharmas are neither male nor female.
