original: Vkn / athāyuṣmāñ śāriputro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One:

original: katamasmād bhagavan buddhakṣetrāc cyutau vimalakīrtiḥ kulaputra idaṃ buddhakṣetram āgataḥ /
analyzed: katamasmāt bhagavan buddhakṣetrāt cyutau vimalakīrtiḥ kula putraḥ idam buddhakṣetram āgataḥ
translated: Blessed One, from which buddha-field did the noble Vimalakīrti pass away to be reborn in this buddha-field?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: etam eva tvaṃ śāriputra satpuruṣaṃ paripṛccha ḥ kutas tvaṃ cyutvehopapanna iti /
analyzed: etam eva tvam śāriputra sat puruṣam paripṛccha ḥ kutas tvam cyutvā iha upapannaḥ iti
translated: Śāriputra, you yourself should ask this good man from where he passed away to be reborn here.

original: athāyuṣmāñ śāriputro vimalakīrtiṃ licchavim etad avocat /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ vimalakīrtim licchavim etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said this to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti:

analyzed: kutas tvam kula putra cyutyā iha upapannaḥ
translated: Noble sir, from where did you pass away to be reborn here?

analyzed: vimalakīrtiḥ āha  yaḥ sthavireṇa dharmaḥ sākṣātkṛtaḥ
translated: Vimalakīrti said,

original: kaccit tasya dharmasya cyutir upapattir vā /
analyzed: kaccit tasya dharmasya cyutiḥ upapattiḥ vā
translated: “Elder, is the Dharma that you have realized subject to destruction or origination?”

original: āha / na tasya dharmasya kācic cyutir upapattir vā /
analyzed: āha na tasya dharmasya kācid cyutiḥ upapattiḥ vā
translated: He replied, “No, that Dharma is not subject to destruction or origination.”

original: āha / evam acyutikānām anutpattikānāṃ bhadantaśāriputra sarvadharmāṇāṃ kutas tavaivaṃ bhavati ḥ kutas tvaṃ cyutvehopapanna iti /🔽yaṃ bhadantaśāriputra nirmitāṃ striyaṃ puruṣaṃ vā pṛccheḥ ḥ kutas tvaṃ cyutvehopapanna iti /
analyzed: āha evam acyutikānām anutpattikānām bhadanta śāriputra sarva dharmāṇām kutas tava evam bhavati kutas tvam cyutvā iha upapannaḥ iti  yam bhadanta śāriputra nirmitām striyam puruṣam vā pṛccheḥ kutas tvam cyutvā iha upapannaḥ iti
translated: Vimalakīrti continued, “Elder, if the Dharma is not subject to destruction or origination, why do you say, ‘I have realized the Dharma’?

analyzed: sa kim vyākuryāt
translated: Elder, if you ask a magical creation, ‘Where have you been reborn from? Where have you come to?’ what do you think it will answer?”

original: āha / na kulaputra nirmitasya cyutir nopapattiḥ /
analyzed: āha na kula putra nirmitasya cyutiḥ nā upapattiḥ
translated: He replied, “Noble sir, a magical creation has neither death nor birth.

analyzed: sa kim vyākariṣyati
translated: What could it answer?”

original: āha / nanu bhadantaśāriputra nirmitasvabhāvāḥ sarvadharmās tathāgatena nirdiṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: āha nanu bhadanta śāriputra nirmita svabhāvāḥ sarva dharmāḥ tathāgatena nirdiṣṭāḥ
translated: Vimalakīrti continued, “Elder, have not all things been taught by the Tathāgata to be like a magical creation?”

analyzed: āha evam etat kula putra
translated: He replied, “Yes, noble sir.”

original: āha / nirmitasvabhāveṣu bhadantaśāriputra sarvadharmeṣu ḥ kutas tvaṃ cyutvehopapanna iti /
analyzed: āha nirmita svabhāveṣu bhadanta śāriputra sarva dharmeṣu kutas tvam cyutvā iha upapannaḥ iti
translated: Vimalakīrti continued, “Elder, if all things are like a magical creation, how can you say, ‘I have realized the Dharma’?”

analyzed: cyutiḥ iti bhadanta śāriputra abhisaṃskāra kṣanai akṣaṇa padam etat
translated: Death, Reverend Śāriputra, is a term for the moment of the exhaustion of the karma of sentient beings.

analyzed: upapattiḥ iti abhisaṃskāra prabandhaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: Birth is a continuum of karma.

analyzed: tatra bodhisatvaḥ cyavate
translated: There the bodhisattva dies.

analyzed: na kuśala mūla abhisaṃskāram kṣapayati
translated: But he does not exhaust the karma of the roots of virtue.

analyzed: upapadyate ca
translated: He is born.

analyzed: na ca akuśalam prabadhnāti
translated: But he does not become bound to evil.

original: Vkn / tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram āmantrayate sma
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the venerable Śāriputra:

original: akṣobhyasya śāriputra tathāgatasya sakāśād āgata eṣa kulaputro 'bhiratyā Iokadhātoḥ /
analyzed: akṣobhyasya śāriputra tathāgatasya sakāśāt āgataḥ eṣa kula putraḥ bhiratyāḥ iokadhātoḥ
translated: This good man has come from the presence of the Tathāgata Akṣobhya in the world system Abhirati.

original: āha / āścaryaṃ bhagavan yad eṣa satpuruṣas tāvatpariśuddhād buddhakṣetrād āgatyehaivaṃ bahudoṣaduṣṭe buddhakṣetre 'bhiramate /🔽vimalakīrtir āha /
analyzed: āha āścaryam bhagavan yat eṣa sat puruṣaḥ tāvat pariśuddhāt buddhakṣetrāt āgatya iha evam bahu doṣa duṣṭe buddhakṣetre bhiramate  vimalakīrtiḥ āha
translated: He said, It is wonderful, Blessed One, that this good man, having come from such a pure buddhafield, should delight in a buddhafield with so many faults!

original: tat kiṃ manyase bhadantaśāriputra api nu sūryaraśmayo 'ndhakāreṇa sārdhaṃ ramante /
analyzed: tat kim manyase bhadanta śāriputra api nu sūrya raśmayaḥ ndhakāreṇa sārdham ramante
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, Reverend Śāriputra, what is your opinion? Do the rays of the sun delight in the dark?

analyzed: āha no hi idam kula putra
translated: He replied, No, indeed, good sir.

analyzed: na tayoḥ yogaḥ sti
translated: They are not in union.

analyzed: saha udgate hi sūrya maṇḍale sarvam tamaḥ upayānti
translated: When the orb of the sun rises, all darkness is destroyed.

original: āha / kiṃ kāraṇaṃ punaḥ sūryo jambūdvīpa udayate /
analyzed: āha kim kāraṇam punar sūryaḥ jambūdvīpe udayate
translated: He said, “What is the reason that the sun rises in Jambudvīpa?

analyzed: āha yāvat eva avabhāsa karaṇāya tamaḥ upaghātaya ca
translated: He said, “Just so that it may illuminate and dispel darkness.

original: āha / evam eva śāriputra saṃcintya bodhisatvā apariśuddheṣu buddhakṣetreṣūpapadyante satvānāṃ pariśodhanāya /
analyzed: āha evam eva śāriputra saṃcintya bodhisatvāḥ apariśuddheṣu buddhakṣetreṣu upapadyante satvānām pariśodhanāya
translated: He said, “In the same way, Śāriputra, the bodhisattvas intentionally take birth in impure buddha-fields in order to purify beings.

analyzed: na ca kleśaiḥ sārdham saṃvasanti
translated: And they do not dwell together with the afflictions.

analyzed: kleśa andhakāram ca vidhamanti sarva satvānām
translated: They dispel the darkness of the afflictions of all beings.”

original: Vkn / atha sā sarvā parṣat paritṛṣitābhut /
analyzed: atha sā sarvā parṣad paritṛṣitā abhut
translated: Then the entire assembly became thirsty,

original: paśyema vayaṃ tam abhiratiṃ lokadhātuṃ taṃ cākṣobhyaṃ tathāgataṃ tāṃś ca bodhisatvāṃs tāṃś ca mahāśrāvakān /
analyzed: paśyema vayam tam abhiratim lokadhātum tam ca akṣobhyam tathāgatam tān ca bodhisatvān tān ca mahāśrāvakān
translated: “We would like to see that Abhirati world-realm, that Akṣobhya Tathāgata, those bodhisattvas, and those great hearers.”

original: atha bhagavāṃs tasyāḥ sarvasyāḥ parṣadaś cetasa cetaḥparivitarkam ājñāya vimalakīrtiṃ licchavim etad avocat /
analyzed: atha bhagavān tasyāḥ sarvasyāḥ parṣadaḥ cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya vimalakīrtim licchavim etat avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the mental reflection of the entire assembly, said this to Vimalakīrti:

original: darśaya kulaputra asyāḥ parṣadas tām abhiratiṃ lokadhātuṃ taṃ cākṣobhyaṃ tathāgatam /
analyzed: darśaya kula putra asyāḥ parṣadaḥ tām abhiratim lokadhātum tam ca akṣobhyam tathāgatam
translated: “Noble sir, show this assembly that Abhirati world-realm and that Akṣobhya Tathāgata.

analyzed: draṣṭu kamā iyam parsat
translated: This assembly wishes to see them.”

analyzed: atha vimalakīrteḥ licchaveḥ etat abhavat
translated: Then the Licchavi Vimalakīrti thought,

original: yan nv aham itaś cāsanān nottiṣṭheyam /
analyzed: yat nu aham itas ca āsanāt na uttiṣṭheyam
translated: What if I were not to rise from this seat,

analyzed: tām ca abhiratim lokadhātum aneka bodhisatva śata sahasrām deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura adhyuṣitām
translated: and that very Abhirati world realm, inhabited by many hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, and asuras,

analyzed: sa cakravāḍa parikhām sa nadī taḍāga utsa saraḥ samudra parikhām sa sumeru giri kūṭa parvatām
translated: with its Cakravāḍa outer wall, its rivers, streams, ponds, lakes, and oceans, its Mount Sumeru and other mountains,

analyzed: sa candra sūrya jyotiṣām sa deva nāga yakṣa gandharva bhavanām sa brahma bhavana pārisadyām
translated: its sun, moon, and stars, its abodes of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, and gandharvas, its Brahmā abodes and the assembly of Brahmapārṣada gods,

analyzed: sa grāma nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra manuṣyām sa strī āgārām sa bodhisatva sa śrāvaka parṣadam
translated: its villages, towns, cities, countries, states, and human beings, its women and men, its bodhisattvas and assembly of śrāvakas,

analyzed: akṣobhyasya tathāgatasya bodhivṛkṣam
translated: the Bodhi tree of the Tathāgata Akṣobhya,

original: akṣobhyaṃ ca tathāgataṃ sāgaropamāyāṃ mahāparṣadi niṣaṇṇaṃ dharmaṃ deśayamānam /
analyzed: akṣobhyam ca tathāgatam sāgara upamāyām mahā parṣadi niṣaṇṇam dharmam deśayamānam
translated: and the Tathāgata Akṣobhya himself, seated in the great assembly that is like the ocean, teaching the Dharma,

original: api tāni padmāni yāni daśasu dikṣu buddhakṛtyaṃ kurvanti satvānām /
analyzed: api tāni padmāni yāni daśasu dikṣu buddha kṛtyam kurvanti satvānām
translated: and those lotuses that perform the Buddha's work for beings in the ten directions,

original: api tāni trīṇi ratnamayāni sopānāni yāni jambūdvīpam upādāya trayastriṃśadbhavanam
analyzed: api tāni trīṇi ratna mayāni sopānāni yāni jambūdvīpam upādāya trayastriṃśat bhavanam
translated: and those three jeweled stairways that lead from Jambudvīpa to the Heaven of the Thirty-Three,

original: abhyudgatāni yaiḥ sopānair devās trayastriṃśato jambūdvīpam avataranty akṣobhyaṃ
analyzed: abhyudgatāni yaiḥ sopānaiḥ devāḥ trayastriṃśataḥ jambūdvīpam avataranti akṣobhyam
translated: By which stairs the gods of the Thirty-Three descend to Jambudvipa

original: tathāgataṃ darśanāya vandanāyai paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya jāmbudvīpakāś ca manuṣyās
analyzed: tathāgatam darśanāya vandanāyai paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya jāmbudvīpakāḥ ca manuṣyāḥ
translated: to see the Tathagata Akshobhya, to pay homage to him, to wait on him, and to hear the Dharma, and the people of Jambudvipa

original: trayastriṃśadbhavanam abhirohanti devāṃs trayastriṃśato darśanāya /🔽evam apramāṇaguṇasamuditāṃ tām abhiratiṃ lokadhātum apskandham upādāya yāvad akaniṣṭhabhavanaṃ
analyzed: trayastriṃśat bhavanam abhirohanti devān trayastriṃśataḥ darśanāya  evam apramāṇa guṇa samuditām tām abhiratim lokadhātum ap skandham upādāya yāvat a kaniṣṭha bhavanam
translated: ascend to the abode of the Thirty-Three to see the gods of the Thirty-Three.🔽Thus, having taken up the water element up to the Akanishtha abode,

original: bhārgavacakram iva paricchidya dakṣiṇena pāṇinā puṣpadāmam ivādāyemāṃ lokadhātuṃ praveśayeyam /
analyzed: bhārgava cakram iva paricchidya dakṣiṇena pāṇinā puṣpa dāmam iva ādāya imām lokadhātum praveśayeyam
translated: having cut off the Abhirati world system like a piece of bamboo, I would take it in my right hand and bring it into this world system,

analyzed: praveśya ca asyāḥ sarvasyāḥ parṣadaḥ darśayeyam
translated: and having brought it, I would show it to this entire assembly.

original: Vkn / atha vimalakīrtir licchavis tasyāṃ velāyāṃ tathārūpaṃ samādhim samāpannaḥ /
analyzed: atha vimalakīrtiḥ licchaviḥ tasyām velāyām tathārūpam samādhim samāpannaḥ
translated: Then the Licchavi Vimalakirti, at that time, entered into a concentration,

original: tādṛśaṃ carddhyabhisaṃskāram abhisaṃskṛtavān yas tam abhiratiṃ lokadhatuṃ paricchidya dakṣiṇena pāninā gṛhītvemaṃ sahaṃ lokadhātuṃ praveśayati
analyzed: tādṛśam ca ṛddhi abhisaṃskāram abhisaṃskṛtavān yaḥ tam abhiratim lokadhatum paricchidya dakṣiṇena pāninā gṛhītvā imam saham lokadhātum praveśayati  /
translated: and performed such a miracle that he took that Abhirati world system, cut it into pieces, and, holding it in his right hand, brought it into this Sahaloka world system,

analyzed: sma
translated: said:

original: Vkn / tatra ye divyacakṣuṣo 'bhijñāpratilabdhāḥ śrāvakā bodhisatvā devamanuṣyāś ca /
analyzed: tatra ye divya cakṣuṣaḥ bhijñā pratilabdhāḥ śrāvakāḥ bodhisatvāḥ deva manuṣyāḥ ca
translated: There, those disciples, bodhisattvas, gods and humans who had attained the supernormal power of the divine eye,

analyzed: te mahāntam utkrośam utkrośanti sma
translated: they cried out a great cry:

analyzed: knyāmahe bhagavan kriyāmahe sugata
translated: We are lost, Blessed One! We are lost, Sugata!

analyzed: trāya ca tathāgataḥ iti
translated: And the Tathagata is our refuge.

analyzed: tān bhagavān vinayana artham evam āha
translated: Then the Blessed One, in order to guide them, said this:

original: na mamātra vṛṣabhitā vimalakīrtinā bodhisatvena kriyamāṇānām /
analyzed: na mama atra vṛṣabhitā vimalakīrtinā bodhisatvena kriyamāṇānām
translated: The supremacy of the deeds performed by the bodhisattva Vimalakirti is not mine.

analyzed: tatra ye punar anye deva manuṣyāḥ
translated: There, those other gods and humans,

original: te na jānanti na paśyanti ḥ kuto vayaṃ kriyāmaha iti /
analyzed: te na jānanti na paśyanti kutas vayam kriyāmahe iti

analyzed: bhūta pūrvam devānām indra atīte dhvani asaṃkhyeye kalpe saṃkhyeyatare

analyzed: vipule pramāṇe cintye yat āsīt tena kālena tena samayena bhaisajyarājaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ  rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ
translated: At that time, in that time, there was a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Enlightened One named Bhaiṣajyarāja,

translated: Moreover, O King of Gods, the lifespan of that Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Bhaiṣajyarāja was twenty intermediate eons.

analyzed: yūyam idānīm tathāgatasya pūjām kuruta

analyzed: satkurvanti sarva sukha upadhānaiḥ

original: Vkn / tataś caiko rājakumāraḥ somacchatro nāma /

analyzed: tasya ekākinaḥ rahaḥ gatasya etat abhūt

analyzed: tasya antarīkṣāt devatā buddha adhiṣṭhānena evam āha

translated: Good man, the worship of the Dharma is superior to all other kinds of worship.

analyzed: sa te bhagavān vyākariṣyati

analyzed: katamā sā dharma pūjā iti

analyzed: sa bhagavān āha

analyzed: nirupalambhānām bodhisatva piṭaka antargatānām dhāraṇī sūtra anta rājamudrā mudritānām a vivarta cakra sūcakānām
translated: without reference points, included in the Bodhisattva canon, sealed with the seal of the king of dharani sutras, indicating the irreversible wheel,

analyzed: ṣaṣ pāramitā nirjātānām saṃgṛhīta grahāṇām bodhi pakṣya dharma anugatānām

translated: They are the upholders of the treasure of the Dharma, who have entered the foremost worship of the Dharma, who are upheld by all noble beings,

translated: who are the teachers of the conduct of all bodhisattvas, who have attained the Dharma that is in accord with the true meaning, who have the Dharma summaries that arise from the impermanence, suffering, non-self, and peace of the Dharma,

translated: who shake the splendor of those with bad conduct, who frighten those who are attached to the views and conceptualizations of all opponents, who are praised by all Buddhas,

translated: who are opposed to saṃsāra, who show the happiness of nirvāṇa.

analyzed: evaṃrūpāṇām sūtrāntānām yā deśanā saṃprakāśanā dhāraṇā pratyavekṣaṇā saddharma saṃgrahaḥ
translated: The teaching, explanation, upholding, and contemplation of sūtras of this kind, the collection of the true Dharma,

analyzed: iyam ucyate dharma pūjā iti
translated: this is called Dharma worship.

original: Vkn / punar aparaṃ kulaputra dharmapūjā yā dhārmeṣu dharmanidhyaptiḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kula putra dharma pūjā yā dhārmeṣu dharma nidhi aptiḥ
translated: Moreover, noble sir, Dharma worship is the discernment of the Dharma in regard to the Dharma,

analyzed: dharma pratipattiḥ
translated: the practice of the Dharma,

analyzed: pratītyasamutpāda anuloma tā
translated: being in accord with dependent origination,

analyzed: sarva anta dṛṣṭi vigamaḥ  ajāta anutpāda kṣāntiḥ
translated: being free from all extreme views,🔽patience with the unborn and non-arising,
entering into selflessness and the absence of living beings,

analyzed: hetu pratyaya avirodhaḥ
translated: not contradicting causes and conditions,

analyzed: a vigrahaḥ
translated: being without conflict,

analyzed: avivādaḥ  amamatvam
translated: It is being free from disputes.🔽It is being free from possessiveness.

analyzed: mamakāra vigamaḥ
translated: It is being free from the notion of mine.

analyzed: artha pratiśaraṇa tā na vyañjana pratiśaraṇa tā
translated: It is taking refuge in the meaning, not in the letter.

analyzed: jñana pratiśaraṇa tā na vijñana pratiśaraṇa tā  nīta artha sūtrānta pratiśaraṇa tā na neya artha saṃvṛti abhiniveśaḥ
translated: It is taking refuge in wisdom, not in consciousness.🔽It is taking refuge in the sutras of definitive meaning, not in the sutras of provisional meaning or in clinging to conventionalities.

analyzed: dharmatā pratiśaraṇa tā na pudgala dṛṣṭi upalambhaḥ na grāhya abhiniviṣṭa tā
translated: It is taking refuge in the nature of reality, not in the view of the individual or in the grasping of objects.

analyzed: yathāvat dharma anugamaḥ
translated: It is following the Dharma as it is.

analyzed: an ālaya praveśaḥ
translated: It is entering the absence of a basis.

analyzed: ālaya samudghātaḥ
translated: It is the destruction of the storehouse.

analyzed: avidyā vyupaśamaḥ yāvat jarā maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsa vyupaśamaḥ
translated: It is the pacification of ignorance up to the pacification of old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair.

analyzed: evam ca dvādaśa aṅgam pratītyasamutpādam avekṣyate
translated: Thus, one observes the twelve links of dependent origination.

analyzed: akṣaya abhinirhāreṇa ca abhinirharati
translated: And one accomplishes it through the accomplishment of inexhaustibility.

analyzed: sattva avekṣayā ca dṛṣṭi nirapekṣaḥ
translated: And one is free from the view of beings, not clinging to the view.

analyzed: iyam api kula putra ucyate nuttarā dharma pūjā iti
translated: This, noble sir, is also called the unsurpassed worship of the Dharma.

original: Vkn / iti hi devānām indra sa somacchatro rājakumāras tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyarājasya tathāgatasyāntikād imāṃ dharmapūjāṃ śrutvānulomikīṃ
analyzed: iti hi devānām indra sa somacchatraḥ rāja kumāraḥ tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyarājasya tathāgatasya antikāt imām dharma pūjām śrutvā ānulomikīm
translated: Thus, O Indra of the Gods, that Prince Somacchaitra, having heard this Dharma worship from the presence of the Blessed One, the Tathagata Bhaisajyaraja,

analyzed: dharma kṣāntim pratilabhate sma
translated: obtained the acceptance of the Dharma in accordance with it.

original: yathāprāvṛtaiś ca vastrābharaṇais taṃ bhagavantaṃ chādayati /

analyzed: evam vācam abhāṣat

analyzed: tasya me bhagavān tathā adhiṣṭhānam karotu
translated: May the Blessed One give me his blessing in this matter.

analyzed: yathā aham nihata māra pratyarthikaḥ bhagavataḥ saddharmam parigṛhnīyām
translated: So that, having destroyed Mara and his adversaries, I may uphold the true Dharma of the Blessed One.

translated: That Tathagata, knowing his superior intention, prophesied him for the protection of the city of the true Dharma in the future time.

original: Vkn / sa khalu punar devānām indra somacchatro rājakumāras tasya tathāgatasya
analyzed: sa khalu punar devānām indra somacchatraḥ rāja kumāraḥ tasya tathāgatasya
translated: And, Indra of the Gods, that Prince Somacchaitra, that Tathagata,

analyzed: tiṣṭhataḥ eva śraddhayā āgārāt anagārikām pravrajitaḥ san ārabdha vīryaḥ viharati sma kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu
translated: He went forth from home into homelessness with faith alone, and while dwelling he exerted himself in wholesome dharmas.

original: tenārabdhavīryeṇa kuśaladharmapratiṣṭhitena na cirāt pañcābhijñā utpāditāḥ /
analyzed: tena ārabdhavīryeṇa kuśala dharma pratiṣṭhitena na cirāt pañca abhijñāḥ utpāditāḥ
translated: By that exertion and establishment in wholesome dharmas, he soon produced the five higher knowledges.

analyzed: gatiṃgataḥ ca dhāraṇīnām abhūt an ācchedya pratibhānaḥ
translated: And he became one who had attained the dhāraṇīs, with unimpeded eloquence.

original: sa tasya bhagavataḥ parinirvṛtasyābhijñādhāraṇībalena paripūrṇān daśāntarakalpāṃs tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyarājasya tathāgatasya pravṛttaṃ dharmacakram
analyzed: sa tasya bhagavataḥ parinirvṛtasya abhijñā dhāraṇī balena paripūrṇān daśa antara kalpān tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyarājasya tathāgatasya pravṛttam dharmacakram  /
translated: By the power of the higher knowledges and dhāraṇīs, for a full ten intermediate eons after the passing into nirvāṇa of that Bhagavān, he turned the wheel of the Dharma set in motion by the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajyarāja.

analyzed: anuvartayati sma
translated: He followed it.

original: tena khalu punar devānām indra somacchatreṇa bhikṣuṇā saddharmaparigrahābhiyuktena daśakoṭīśatāni satvānām avaivartikāni kṛtāny abhūvann anuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: tena khalu punar devānām indra somacchatreṇa bhikṣuṇā saddharma parigraha abhiyuktena daśa koṭī śatāni satvānām a vaivartikāni kṛtāni abhūvan anuttarāyām
translated: Moreover, Devendra, by the bhikṣu Somacchātra, who was devoted to upholding the true Dharma, fourteen hundred thousand beings were established in irreversibility from complete knowing,

analyzed: caturdaśa ca prāṇi niyutāni śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yānikāni
translated: and fourteen hundred thousand living beings were established in the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

analyzed: apramāṇāḥ ca satvāḥ svarga upagāḥ kṛtāḥ
translated: And innumerable beings were established in heaven.

original: Vkn / syāt khalu punas te devānām indra anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena ratnacchatro nāma rājābhūc cakravartī /🔽na khalu punas te devānām indra evaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: syāt khalu punar te devānām indra anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena ratnacchatraḥ nāma rājā abhūt cakravartī  na khalu punar te devānām indraḥ evam draṣṭavyam
translated: “Moreover, Śakra, King of the Gods, at that time, on that occasion, was there a king named Ratnacchattra, a universal monarch?🔽Śakra, King of the Gods, you should not regard him as someone else,🔽

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Then, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Licchavi Vimalakīrti: How long will this Dharma discourse remain in the world?

original: ratnārciḥ sa tathāgatas tena kālena tena samayena ratnacchatro nāma rājābhūc cakravartī /🔽yat punas tad rājño ratnacchatrasya putrasahasram abhūt /🔽ime te bhādrakalpikā bodhisatvā abhūvan /
analyzed: ratnārciḥ sa tathāgataḥ tena kālena tena samayena ratnacchatraḥ nāma rājā abhūt cakravartī  yat punar tat rājñaḥ ratnacchatrasya putra sahasram abhūt  ime te bhādrakalpikāḥ bodhisatvāḥ abhūvan
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, As long as the names of the Tathāgata and of the bodhisattva remain in the world, this Dharma discourse will remain in the world.🔽Śakra said, Will this discourse on the Dharma be in circulation in the northern region?🔽Vimalakīrti replied, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, the northern region will have four merits. What are the four?

original: yad iha bhadrakalpe paripūrṇaṃ buddhasahasram utpatsyate yataś catvāra utpannāḥ śeṣā utpatsyante /🔽krakucchandapramukhā yāvad rocaparyavasānāḥ /🔽roco nāma tathāgataḥ paścimako bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yat iha bhadra kalpe paripūrṇam buddha sahasram utpatsyate yatas catvāraḥ utpannāḥ śeṣāḥ utpatsyante  krakucchanda pramukhāḥ yāvat roca paryavasānāḥ  rocaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ paścimakaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: They will be: (1) the land of the spread of the Dharma, (2) the land of the spread of the Vinaya, (3) the land of the spread of the Abhidharma, and (4) the land of the spread of the bodhisattvas.🔽Śakra said, Will this Dharma discourse be in circulation in the northern region?

original: syāt khalu punas te devānām indra evam anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena somacchatro
analyzed: syāt khalu punar te devānām indraḥ evam anyaḥ sa tena kālena tena samayena soma chatro
translated: Vimalakīrti replied, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, the northern region will have four merits. What are the four?

original: nāma rājakumāro 'bhūd yena tasya bhagavato bhaiṣajyarājasya tathāgatasya saddharmaḥ parigṛhīta iti /
analyzed: nāma rāja kumāraḥ bhūt yena tasya bhagavataḥ bhaiṣajyarājasya tathāgatasya saddharmaḥ parigṛhītaḥ iti
translated: The prince named Somadatta, by whom the true Dharma of that Blessed One, the Tathāgata Bhaiṣajyarāja, was upheld.

original: na khalu punas ta evaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: na khalu punar te evam draṣṭavyam
translated: But it should not be seen like this.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ahaṃ sa tena kālena tena samayena somacchatro nāma rājakumāro 'bhūvam /
analyzed: aham sa tena kālena tena samayena somacchatraḥ nāma rāja kumāraḥ bhūvam
translated: At that time, on that occasion, I was the prince named Somadatta.

original: tad anenāpi te devendra paryāyeṇaivaṃ veditavyam /
analyzed: tat anena api te deva indra paryāyeṇa evam veditavyam
translated: Therefore, O Lord of the Gods, by this explanation also, it should be known thus:

analyzed: yāvatyaḥ tathāgatānām pūjāḥ
translated: Whatever offerings there are to the Tathāgatas,

original: dharmapūjā tāsām agryākhyāyate /🔽jyeṣṭhā śreṣṭhā varā pravarā praṇītottarā niruttarākhyāyata iti /🔽tasmād iha devānām indra dharmapūjayā māṃ pūjayata /🔽mā āmiṣapūjayā /🔽dharmasatkāreṇa māṃ satkuruta /
analyzed: dharma pūjā tāsām agrī ākhyāyate  jyeṣṭhā śreṣṭhā varā pravarā praṇītā uttarā niruttarā ākhyāyate iti  tasmāt iha devānām indra dharma pūjayā mām pūjayata  mā āmiṣa pūjayā  dharma satkāreṇa mām satkuruta
translated: the Dharma offering is declared to be the foremost of them,

original: yathema evaṃrūpā dharmaparyāyā yuṣmadadhiṣṭhānena parigraheṇa tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya paścime kāle paścime samaye jambūdvīpe vaistārikā
analyzed: yathā ime evaṃrūpāḥ dharmaparyāyāḥ yuṣmad adhiṣṭhānena parigraheṇa tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya paścime kāle paścime samaye jambūdvīpe vaistārikā
translated: So that this kind of Dharma discourse, through your support and acceptance, will spread in Jambudvīpa in the later times, in the later period, after the Tathāgata’s passing into nirvāṇa,

analyzed: na antardhīyeran
translated: and will not disappear.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: bhaviṣyanti maitreya anāgate 'dhvani kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca devanāgayakṣagandharvāś cāvaropitakuśalā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ saṃprasthitāḥ
analyzed: bhaviṣyanti maitreya anāgate dhvani kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca deva nāga yakṣa gandharvāḥ ca avaropita kuśalāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: Maitreya, in the future there will be sons of good family, daughters of good family, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, who have planted wholesome [roots] and set out for the highest complete enlightenment,

original: te 'śravaṇād asya dharmaparyāyasya mā parihāsyanta iti /
analyzed: te śravaṇāt asya dharmaparyāyasya mā parihāsyante iti
translated: but they will fall away because they have not heard this Dharma discourse.

original: imān evaṃrūpān sūtrāntāñ śrutvātīva prema ca prasādaṃ ca pratilapsyante /
analyzed: imān evaṃrūpān sūtrāntām śrutvā atīva prema ca prasādam ca pratilapsyante
translated: Having heard these kinds of sūtras, they will attain intense love and faith.

analyzed: mūrdhnā ca pratigrahīṣyanti
translated: They will accept them on their heads.

original: teṣāṃ tvaṃ maitreya tathārūpāṇāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ cānurakṣāyā imān evaṃrūpān sūtrāntāṃs tasmin kāle vaistārikān kuryāḥ /
analyzed: teṣām tvam maitreya tathārūpāṇām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām ca anurakṣāyai imān evaṃrūpān sūtrāntān tasmin kāle vaistārikān kuryāḥ
translated: Maitreya, for the protection of those kinds of sons of good family and daughters of good family, you should spread these kinds of sūtras at that time.

original: Vkn / dve ime maitreya bodhisatvānāṃ mudre /
analyzed: dve ime maitreya bodhisatvānām mudre
translated: There are these two seals of the bodhisattvas, Maitreya.

analyzed: katame dve
translated: What are the two?

analyzed: vicitra pada vyañjana prasāda mudrā ca gambhīra dharma naya anuttrāsa yathā bhūta avatāra praveśa mudrā ca
translated: The seal of clarity in the various words and letters, and the seal of entering into the true nature of the profound Dharma without fear.

analyzed: ime maitreya bodhisatvānām dve mudre
translated: Maitreya, these are the two seals of the bodhisattvas.

analyzed: tatra maitreya ye bodhisatvāḥ vicitra pada vyañjana prasāda gurukāḥ
translated: Among them, Maitreya, those bodhisattvas who are devoted to the clarity of the various words and letters,

analyzed: te ādi karmikāḥ bodhisatvāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: should be known as beginner bodhisattvas.

original: ye punar imaṃ maitreya gambhīraṃ sūtrāntam arūpalepaṃ yamakavyatyastanihārapadapuṭaprabhedaṃ pravartayiṣyanti śrosyanty adhimokṣyante vedayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye punar imam maitreya gambhīram sūtrāntam a rūpa lepam yamaka vyatyasta nihāra pada puṭa prabhedam pravartayiṣyanti śrosyanti adhimokṣyante vedayiṣyanti
translated: But, Maitreya, those who will teach this profound sutra, which is without form or stain, which is the analysis of the various combinations and reversals of words and phrases, who will listen to it, aspire to it, and understand it,

analyzed: ime bodhisatvāḥ cira carita brahmacaryāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: should be known as bodhisattvas who have practiced celibacy for a long time.

original: Vkn / tatra maitreya dvābhyāṃ kāraṇābhyām ādikarmikā bodhisatvā ātmānaṃ kṣiṇvanti /
analyzed: tatra maitreya dvābhyām kāraṇābhyām ādi karmikāḥ bodhisatvāḥ ātmānam kṣiṇvanti
translated: In that regard, Maitreya, beginner bodhisattvas harm themselves through two causes.

original: na ca gambhīreṣu dharmeṣu nidhyaptiṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: na ca gambhīreṣu dharmeṣu nidhi aptim gacchanti
translated: They do not attain certainty in the profound dharmas.

analyzed: katamābhyām dvābhyām
translated: What are the two?

analyzed: a śruta pūrvān ca gambhīrān sūtrāntām śrutvā uttrasyanti
translated: Having heard the profound sutras that have not been heard before, they are frightened.

analyzed: saṃśaya prāptāḥ ca bhavanti
translated: They become doubtful.

analyzed: na anumodante
translated: They do not rejoice.

analyzed: uttari ca pratikṣipante
translated: and they reject the teachings of others.

original: ya ete 'smābhiḥ pūrvaṃ na śrutapūrvāḥ kuta ime 'dhunāgatāḥ /
analyzed: ye ete smābhiḥ pūrvam na śruta pūrvāḥ kutas ime dhunā āgatāḥ
translated: “Where did these come from?” they ask, “We have never heard them before.”

original: ye ca te kulaputrā gambhīradharmasūtrāntadhārakā gambhīradharmabhājanā gambhīradharmadeśayitāraḥ /🔽tān na sevante na bhajante na paryupāsante /
analyzed: ye ca te kula putrāḥ gambhīra dharma sūtrānta dhārakāḥ gambhīra dharma bhājanāḥ gambhīra dharma deśayitāraḥ  tān na sevante na bhajante na paryupāsante
translated: Those sons of noble family who hold the profound scriptures, who are vessels for the profound Dharma, and who teach the profound Dharma—🔽they do not serve them, do not attend on them, and do not honor them.

analyzed: a gauravāḥ ca teṣu bhavanti
translated: They have no respect for them.

original: antarāntarā ca teṣām avarṇam api niścārayanti /
analyzed: antarā antarā ca teṣām avarṇam api niścārayanti
translated: And from time to time they even speak uncomplimentarily of them.

original: ābhyāṃ maitreya dvābhyāṃ kāraṇābhyām ādikarmikā bodhisatvā ātmānaṃ kṣiṇvanti /
analyzed: ābhyām maitreya dvābhyām kāraṇābhyām ādi karmikāḥ bodhisatvāḥ ātmānam kṣiṇvanti
translated: Maitreya, these are the two reasons that beginner bodhisattvas harm themselves,

original: na ca gambhīreṣu dharmeṣu nidhyaptiṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: na ca gambhīreṣu dharmeṣu nidhi aptim gacchanti
translated: and do not attain certainty about the profound teachings.

original: Vkn / dvābhyāṃ maitreya kāraṇābhyāṃ gambhīrādhimuktiko bodhisatva ātmānaṃ kṣiṇoti /
analyzed: dvābhyām maitreya kāraṇābhyām gambhīra adhimuktikaḥ bodhisatvaḥ ātmānam kṣiṇoti
translated: Maitreya, there are two reasons that bodhisattvas who have profound confidence harm themselves,

analyzed: na ca anutpattikeṣu dharmeṣu kṣāntim pratilabhate
translated: and do not attain the acceptance that phenomena are not produced.

analyzed: katamābhyām dvābhyām
translated: What are the two?

original: tāṃś cādikarmikān aciracaritān bodhisatvān avamanyate paribhavati na grāhayati na vivecayati nānuśāsti /
analyzed: tān ca ādi karmikān acira caritān bodhisatvān avamanyate paribhavati na grāhayati na vivecayati na anuśāsti
translated: They despise those beginner bodhisattvas who have been practicing for a long time, treat them with contempt, do not teach them, do not explain things to them, and do not instruct them.

original: tayaiva ca gambhīrādhimuktyā śikṣāyām agauravo bhavati /
analyzed: tayā eva ca gambhīra adhimuktyā śikṣāyām agauravaḥ bhavati
translated: And because of that profound faith, he has no respect for the training.

analyzed: loka āmiṣa dānena ca satvān anugṛhṇāti
translated: And he benefits beings with material gifts,

analyzed: na dharma dānena
translated: but not with the gift of Dharma.

original: ābhyāṃ maitreya dvābhyāṃ kāraṇābhyāṃ gambhīrādhimuktiko bodhisatva ātmānaṃ kṣiṇoti /
analyzed: ābhyām maitreya dvābhyām kāraṇābhyām gambhīra adhimuktikaḥ bodhisatvaḥ ātmānam kṣiṇoti
translated: Maitreya, for these two reasons, a bodhisattva with profound faith injures himself.

original: na ca kṣipram anutpattikeṣu dharmeṣu kṣāntiṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: na ca kṣipram anutpattikeṣu dharmeṣu kṣāntim pratilabhate
translated: And he does not quickly attain acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: Vkn / evam ukte maitreyo bodhisatvo bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte maitreyaḥ bodhisatvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva Maitreya said to the Blessed One:

analyzed: āścaryam bhagavan yāvat su bhāṣitam bhagavataḥ
translated: It is wonderful, Blessed One, how well this has been said by the Blessed One!

original: vayaṃ bhagavan etāṃś ca doṣān vivarjayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam bhagavan etān ca doṣān vivarjayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, we will avoid these faults.

original: imāṃ ca tathāgatasyāsaṃkhyeyakalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrasamudānītām anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ parirakṣiṣyāmo dhārayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: imām ca tathāgatasya asaṃkhyeya kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasra samudānītām anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim parirakṣiṣyāmaḥ dhārayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: And we will protect and uphold this unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the Tathāgata, which has been accomplished over countless hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭīs of kalpas.

original: teṣāṃ cānāgatānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṝṇāṃ bhājanībhūtānām imān evaṃrūpān sūtrāntān hastagatān kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām ca anāgatānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṝṇām bhājanībhūtānām imān evaṃrūpān sūtrāntān hasta gatān kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: And we will place in the hands of those future sons and daughters of good family who are vessels for this kind of sūtra, these sūtras of this kind.

original: smṛtiṃ caiṣām upasaṃhariṣyāmo yayā smṛtyemān evaṃrūpān sūtrāntān rocayiṣyanty udgrahīṣyanti
analyzed: smṛtim ca eṣām upasaṃhariṣyāmaḥ yayā smṛtyā imān evaṃrūpān sūtrāntān rocayiṣyanti udgrahīṣyanti
translated: We will restore their memory, by which memory they will delight in such sūtras as these, will take them up,

original: paryavāpsyanti dhārayiṣyanti pravartayiṣyanti likhiṣyanti pareṣāṃ ca vistareṇa deśayiṣyanti /
analyzed: paryavāpsyanti dhārayiṣyanti pravartayiṣyanti likhiṣyanti pareṣām ca vistareṇa deśayiṣyanti
translated: will master them, will keep them, will expound them, will write them out, and will teach them in detail to others.

original: teṣāṃ ca vayaṃ bhagavan upastambhaṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām ca vayam bhagavan upastambham kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will support them, Blessed One.

original: ye ca khalu punar bhagavan tasmin kāla imān evaṃrupān sūtrāntān rocayiṣyanti pravartayiṣyanti /
analyzed: ye ca khalu punar bhagavan tasmin kāle imān evaṃrupān sūtrāntān rocayiṣyanti pravartayiṣyanti
translated: And, Blessed One, those who at that time will delight in such sūtras as these, will expound them,

original: veditavyam etad bhagavan maitreyasya bodhisatvasyādhiṣṭhānam iti /
analyzed: veditavyam etat bhagavat maitreyasya bodhisatvasya adhiṣṭhānam iti
translated: should know, Blessed One, that it is the blessing of the bodhisattva Maitreya.”

original: atha bhagavān maitreyasya bodhisatvasya sādhukāram adāt /
analyzed: atha bhagavān maitreyasya bodhisatvasya sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then the Blessed One gave his approval to the bodhisattva Maitreya:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu maitreya
translated: “Good, good, Maitreya!

analyzed: su bhāṣitā te iyam vāc
translated: Well spoken is this speech of yours.

analyzed: anumodate tathāgataḥ nujānāti ca subhāsitam
translated: The Tathāgata approves and permits well-spoken speech.

original: Vkn / atha te bodhisatvā ekasvareṇa vācam abhāṣanta /
analyzed: atha te bodhisatvāḥ eka svareṇa vācam abhāṣanta
translated: Vkn. Then those bodhisattvas spoke with one voice:

original: vayam api bhagavan tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasyānyonyebhyo buddhakṣetrebhya āgatyemāṃ tathāgatabuddhabodhiṃ vaistārikīṃ kariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam api bhagavan tathāgatasya parinirvṛtasya anyonyebhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ āgatya imām tathāgata buddha bodhim vaistārikīm kariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We too, Blessed One, will come from other buddha-fields after the Thus-Gone One's parinirvāṇa, and we will spread this Thus-Gone One's buddha-enlightenment.

analyzed: teṣām ca kula putrāṇām ārocayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will proclaim it to those noble sons.

original: Vkn / atha catvāro mahārājāno bhagavantam etad avocan /
analyzed: atha catvāraḥ mahā rājānaḥ bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: Then the Four Great Kings said this to the Blessed One:

original: yatra yatra bhagavan grāmanagaranigamarāṣṭrarājadhānīṣv ima evaṃrūpā dharmaparyāyāḥ pracariṣyanti deśayiṣyanti prakāśayiṣyanti /
analyzed: yatra yatra bhagavan grāma nagara nigama rāṣṭra rājadhānīṣu ime evaṃrūpāḥ dharmaparyāyāḥ pracariṣyanti deśayiṣyanti prakāśayiṣyanti
translated: Wherever, Blessed One, these kinds of Dharma discourses will be practiced, taught, and explained in villages, towns, cities, countries, and capital cities,

original: tatra tatra vayaṃ bhagavan catvāro mahārājāḥ sabalāḥ savāhanāḥ saparivārā dharmaśravaṇāyopasaṃkramiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tatra tatra vayam bhagavan catvāraḥ mahā rājāḥ sa balāḥ sa vāhanāḥ sa parivārāḥ dharma śravaṇāya upasaṃkramiṣyāmaḥ
translated: there, Blessed One, we Four Great Kings, with our armies, vehicles, and retinues, will approach to listen to the Dharma.

original: tasya ca dharmabhāṇakasya samantato yojanaśataṃ rakṣāṃ saṃvidhāṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca dharmabhāṇakasya samantataḥ yojana śatam rakṣām saṃvidhāṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will arrange protection all around that Dharma teacher within a distance of one hundred leagues,

original: yathā tasya dharmabhāṇakasya na kaścid avatāraprekṣy avatāragaveṣy avatāraṃ lapsyate /
analyzed: yathā tasya dharma bhāṇakasya na kaścid avatāra prekṣī avatāra gaveṣī avatāram lapsyate
translated: so that no one seeking an opportunity, seeking an entrance, will find an opportunity for that Dharma teacher.

original: Vkn / tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Ānanda:

original: udgṛhāṇa tvam ānanda imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ dhāraya vācaya pareṣāṃ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśaya /
analyzed: udgṛhāṇa tvam ānanda imam dharmaparyāyam dhāraya vācaya pareṣām ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśaya
translated: Ananda, you should uphold this Dharma discourse, recite it, and explain it extensively to others.
